review_content: We relocated to El Paso and someone recommended this place. I sure em glad we listened. This place made this transition so so easy. From they're front desk customer service to the housekeepers and all the staff were friendly. The rooms are spacious, we were in a two bedroom suite with a mini living room and kitchen, the family enjoyed the space, we weren't cramped at all ...  The breakfast and light dinner made it very affordable for a family of four. Oh and let's not forget that they are pet friendly at $10 a night!!!!!!!! All in all I highly recommend this place.Old reviews and pictures for Chase Suite Hotel made me a little weary about a stay here, but my boyfriend and I won a night here and they said it was in their newly renovated rooms so I was all on board.We made it to CSH shortly after check-in started and I was helped as soon as I walked in the door. In just a couple of seconds I had two key cards and a map. We drove over towards our building and realized we wouldn't be able to park in front of our actual building, but on the side of a different one. I will say there is adequate parking for the lot though. If you actually had a lot of luggage that you needed to haul to your suite, you can pull on to a tiny road they have that follows the back of the lot and unload.The renovations are great! As far as I could tell, they're not done with all the rooms so you could end up in a room that has yet to be redone. The outside of the buildings looked like they needed some renovations too, but nothing crazy... just a new coat of paint.Our room was pretty nice and they did a great job of sectioning off the "bedroom" from the "living room" and kitchen. The bed was a king sized, clean, and adorned with down pillows... just the way I like it. The kitchen was equipped with all the plates, glasses, silverware, and utensils we could need as well as a new stove, dishwasher, microwave, full-sized fridge, and two bar stools at the oversized counter. My only gripe about the whole room is that the drawers in the kitchen aren't on a track. I nearly dropped all of the silverware on the floor. The "living room" is a small sitting area in front of the fireplace. Nice! I really liked the bathroom and it looked like they redid the floor as well.I didn't try out their wi-fi because who uses their phones and laptops during a staycation? But I do know that it's available and they give you the password as soon as you check in. As far as the rest of the amenities go, they have two pools, a jacuzzi, a Continental breakfast in the morning, complimentary happy hour on Monday-Thursday, and free access to the nearest Planet Fitness (about six miles away).Out of all the amenities we did try out the Continental breakfast. Unfortunately, this, I wasn't impressed by. They had a good variety of choices... four cereal options, yogurt, bagels, bread, orange juice, coffee, tea, scrambled eggs, and potatoes. I didn't try the scrambled eggs, but the potatoes were cold. The flow was good, but it honestly just felt like the staff put the least amount of effort towards the breakfast and morning experience. There was one lady that was standing behind the counter the whole time doing a crossword and she would occasionally look up and say "good morning" only to return to her crossword again and never engage in conversation with those standing only inches away from her waiting for their toast to be done. She actually didn't come across as that friendly either. At one point my boyfriend went to get a bagel and the tongs had disappeared (someone had put them inside the bread case on the bottom shelf... not easy to see if you don't bend over) and she started yelling at him. I understand using tongs, but clearly he wasn't aware there were tongs and there was absolutely no reason to yell. A man came over (possibly a manager) and placed tongs on top of the handle (doesn't really seem like a good place for tongs) and within minutes they had disappeared again. I think the breakfast staff could've been a lot more welcoming and involved with those staying at the hotel. Would've been nice for them to ask how our stay was while I was waiting for a bagel or start some small talk or give me some insider scoop about the El Paso area (hey, they don't know I live here). It wouldn't deter me from staying here again, but it also doesn't entice me.I've checked the prices for these suites and they're doable. A night is less than $100. It isn't fancy, but this is a good hotel for someone who is planning on being in the area for a bit because of the amenities in the room. Instead of going out to eat for every single meal, you can cook in your room. And I mean actually cook, none of that microwaved TV dinner stuff. Overall, a good hotel with wonderful renovations done! I'd stay here again for another EP staycation.My gf and I were excited to have won a 1 day stay at this hotel by liking their Facebook page. I had stayed there previously a few years ago and was not impressed the first time there. Well its free and we needed a Staycation so we jumped on it. The hotel was promoting their newly renovated units so I was hopeful. Check in seemed very quick and off we go... first impression was the parking. Parking was only located on one side of the complex so we had to walk past a few building to get to building 18. On the way there.....I was concerned because I could see numerous repairs needed on the buildings leading to building 18. Did I mention I am a facility expert? Nonetheless, the repairs would be obvious to anyone. Upon our arrival to unit 1823, I was happy to see new paint and the exterior of the building in order and suggesting that improvement were made. Once inside, we were happily surprised. Everything had been redone and done so with good taste. The kitchen, bath, living room and bedroom was all modern and upgraded. It was very comfortable. They are definitely on the right track. We slept great! The next morning we decide to enjoy the complimentary continental breakfast to guage the full experience. It was typical with eggs and potatoes, juice or coffee, and some cereal or bagels. I was hoping for some meat on the menu or a way to order something but not happening. There were two personnel working their but seemed preoccupied with their crossword puzzle to greet visitors and make them feel comfortable. At one point I attempted to get a bagel and the tongs were missing. I opened the bagel door and surgically removed a bagel ensuring not to touch others. This is when the woman (employee) looked over and in a louder than required  fashion stated, "use the utensil". I was a bit embarrassed but explained that they were not there. She should have given me the benefit of the doubt. She then located some and placed them on the door. The next person used them and when complete laid them inside on the food. She didn't correct him although she was right there. I couldn't help thinking that my method was more sanitary. Why use the tongs if you just going to lay the handle on the food. She does need to work on being friendly and courteous. The overall experience was really good but as a disclaimer....only building 15 and 18 seemed to be complete. Hate for you to visit and not get the same experience. I hope they keep going with the renovations.Absolutely terrible, could not be worse!! Old, run down, and disgustingly dirty. Think I'm exaggerating??? See the pictures I posted (eg., hair on bed, dirty coffee mugs, cigarette burned counter in supposed non-smoking room). We ended up demanding a refund and going elsewhere. Disgusting!!I reserved my room for work purposes over a month in advance. Upon arriving around 5:00 pm to check in, I was informed they were waiting for me to arrive. I was informed there was no room available, as there was a gas leak. I understand these things happen and head towards the other hotel where they reserved a room for me. However, I'm a little agitated they did not call to let me know I could not check in. Upon arriving to the second hotel, the outside is not attractive as it has rusty doors and yellow caution tape around the pool. The next day, I was called and asked if I would return. I explained I would because the hotel chosen for me was not comparable. Thinking I was complementing them, they thanked me. I proceeded to explain it was not a compliment. I was upset. Upon arriving at the hotel to check in I voiced my disapproval again. I was told it was out of their control and sent to a room which reeks of smoke, is old and out dated, and dingy at best.The shower tub does not drain and the curtain floats in the water. After digging through towels, I managed to find one without hair on it. The floor was soaked, be sure to put a towel down. The hand towels were covered in black marks. Just awful. Since I have left I have contacted the office 3 times asking for proof that I was sent to another hotel, as I need it for my work records. It still has not arrived...3 days later and a call each day.I was VERY disappointed with my entire interaction with this hotel. I had booked and confirmed eight rooms for a basketball tournament. All eight rooms were secured with a credit card and I had a confirmation number for each room.  3 days before check in, I was told that they could no longer accommodate us, other guests had decided to extend their stay. As most other rooms that would accommodate families in the area were already booked with such late notice, I was forced to try to work with Chase Hotel.  Of the eight rooms that I had confirmed, they were only able to give us 4.  We were offered rooms smaller than those booked and confirmed, requiring families to split up.  Several families found other accommodations so we reluctantly accepted the rooms.  After checking in, we found the hotel to be extremely dilapidated.  Each of the 6 rooms had a sofa that was so disgusting that it had to be covered with a blanket before one would sit on it.  Coffee makers were missing carafes, drawers were missing, counters peeling, doors would not close and everything was just generally run down.  Despite having to sign an agreement for each room about noise levels, one patron outside of our group was playing music well into the night and yelling to his friends.  Repeated calls to the front desk did not stop the noise.  Dog excrement lined the sidewalks and was not cleaned the entire three days of our stay.  The front desk clerks were friendly and helpful with directions but the management was rude in dealing with cancelling confirmed reservations.  They did not respond to repeated phone calls or emails and were generally unprofessional.  With the number of hotels in this direct area, save a few dollars and go to a hotel that is clean, not falling down and treats a customer fairly.If it had a better breakfast, it might be 5 stars.  The room is big, the TV is nice, it has a full kitchen and a spacious bathroom.  It's nicer and better equipped than my apartment in CA!  Hands down my first choice for a long stay in El Paso.On my way to Austin from San Diego I needed to stop and rest for the night and I decided to stay at the Chase Suite Hotel. My room was spacious, clean and relaxing with a full kitchen, a fireplace, living room area and large restroom. The hotel was clean and quite with friendly staff. I would highly recommend for anyone to stay here and will be staying here again the next time I drive to California from Texas. The whole process was effortless and a great value when you compare the competition which were priced $50 to $80 more per night.I don't know what the bad reviews are about. I was actually nervous because of  them.Yes the place is a little old but this is a great place!They picked me up from the airport. I got my own studio apartment. Very clean. Fully furnished. The kitchen is completely stocked. I needed to go to the mall, and they drove me there and picked me up.They also do complimentary breakfast and dinner. I mean hello! Where elese do you get all that?The staff is very helpful and there's a little community here. I think people stay here for long terms of times and I see why.The place is pretty good for the price. A nice studio, full kitchen, sofa bed,comfy bed. If i was with family id come here. Theres a nice pool right outside my suite. I just fell in love how the small space was set up to be everything you would need. Very friendly staff.This place is very nice. Couch, kitchen with dishes and cooking pans, flat screen tv, very comfortable bed. Excellent customer service. I locked my room card in my room on accident and they had no problem giving me another. Make this your place to stay if you're in el paso, texas.This is a very nice place with awesome customer service. We are military and moving here. We stayed with them for over a month and they helped us out many times. We got a great deal and they even saved us the tax in the bill. They also have free breakfast and dinner during the week. The food is pretty good and helpful when your out house hunting. I would highly recommend staying here if your military and have a family. They have 2 bedrooms and kitchen and living rooms...it was awesome!!Being pregnant I'm highly sensitive to smells (not saying they smelled bad, but chemicals give me headaches) and the hotel receptionist was very understanding and let me try out four hotel rooms till I was satisfied. I highly recommend dealing with Victoria S. she went above and beyond what one would expect; a diamond in the rough.First room they give me had a leaking roof, switched us to a new room . The new room had the entire carpet soaked from the water heater . To top it off, sheets were stained and towels had urine stains on them. This place is getting run down with the ghetto contract workers that stay there for extended periods. Our neighbor was out until 4 am drinking/ smoking  and yelling on the phone at 4am. Beer bottles everywhere , disgusting !  Mario the manager was very apologetic and offered to get me a new room. Save your money, and time . Stay elsewhereThe place is a little old, but the facility an accommodations  was well worth the price. Stayed for 11 days, breakfast and dinner was included. Place has two pools and grills are provided for residents to use.

hotel_name: Hawthorn Suites By Wyndham El Paso
review_content: We had a family event and had a good experience.  The rooms are nice, size is average, breakfast was hearty and is remodeled nicely.  Only thing i would say that if you do leave your room late morning, be sure to call lobby to let them know your room is free to be cleaned.  We left late one day and it didn't get cleaned.  Not a big deal, just called and they came and did it.  Extremely close to airport so made it nice to not have to drive after 2 long flights.  Would stay here again.Not looking forward to my stay, but I may update this review after I check-out.  My reservation was booked from a third party and my room is the "standard" room given for that reason.  I am on the side that doesn't look like it was recently renovated.  I understood that I would have a kitchenette inside the room, like in the photos online; "No, sorry that costs extra." Though the bathroom counter space is the same as the photo online.  Adding some shelving would be helpful, especially for stays over a week at a time.  On the flip side: I am looking forward to the warm breakfast in the morning and the woman that checked me in seemed nice.The lady at the front desk was nice but for this hotel having been newly renovated... the sink was cracked, the carpet wasn't the cleanest, the wallpaper was coming off the walls and there was a huge, dead cockaroach in the doorway of the woman's restroom in the lobby.FUCK THIS PLACE AND IT'S SHITTY EMPLOYEES!I travel for work, I'm constantly on the road going from hotel to hotel, city to city, and it's always ideal to find a hotel with a laundry room. So I go downstairs to get quarters the lady gives me five bucks in quarters, half of the $10 roll that they come in. I do my laundry, but the shitty washing machines don't wash my clothes properly so I have to use more money to do it again, then I go downstairs to ask for more quarters to dry my clothes and the same cunt who gave me quarters the first time gives me this stupid look and tells me no, she's all out of quarters, and proceeds to tell me that there is no manager on site to help me. Instead of making an executive decision to help one of their customers, the dumb bitch is all shoulders, I ask her what she suggest I should do with all my wet clothes, again all shoulders. She apologizes but her fucking apologies are not going to dry my clothes. Fuck that Ellen DeGeneres looking bitch.I wish I would have read these reviews first. I actually picked this hotel over another because it's a Wyndham. HUGE MISTAKEI booked on orbitz and arrived after an 8 hour drive. I had the confirmation, but they couldn't find the reservation. Orbitz called, tried to fax and email them 3 times and the hotel didn't receive it. Orbitz refunded me and the girl at the desk offered a slightly cheaper rate due to the inconvenience of waiting over 30 mins. Unfortunately, her manager has no idea what the hospitality business is about. He kept talking to her under his breath about me until I called him out and asked if there was an issue. I handed him my temporary debit card (mine had a fraudulent charge so I was waiting on it to be mailed) & he wouldnt run it because it didnt say my name. He got HIS manager who was also arguing but finally ran the card. He asks me to sign the receipt but its $20 more than what the girl offered and when I asked why, he reluctantly changed it and literally said the dreaded "well, that wasnt OUR fault." Also, I travel for work and asked about their rewards program. The manager literally said "you wont get any rewards" while hes standing next to the brochures for wyndhamrewards. When I pointed it out, he said "oh yeah, I think you can sign up with your email or something."Rooms are small, badly need upgraded and the elevator is hardly safe. Can't wait to call Wyndham tomorrow.If you're looking for a budget friendly hotel, this hotel is not bad. It's not quite walking distance from EP airport, better to call and take their free shuttle. The first room I had was newly renovated, the second room I had was still in the process of being renovated.... The bedroom was newIy renovated, but the bathroom looked like something from the 80's. I think they are trying their best to finish reno's, but you can't really tell. I loved how the bathrooms had a heat fan on top of the ceiling, kept me warm when coming out of the shower. The doors of all the rooms seem old, definitely need to change them and the light pink colour. Other than that, wifi is strong, breakfast was better than your average chains and friendly staff.Excellent hotel, rooms are clean, quiet & well furnished.. Beds are comfy, rooms comes with Refrigerator, free wi-fi & Microwave.  AC thermostat/temperatures worked perfectly which can be a problem even in the best of hotels.    The young woman who checked me in named Lupe, was friendly, professional & made me feel welcomed.  Also a Thank you to Kimberly who I believe is an assistant manager.  She was very kind & helpful.  Excel location city wise & perfect if you want to have some wine or beer with the cattle barons rest(excel Salad bar) just across the parking lot, as well as Applebee's and not have to be concerned with driving.   I had lived in el paso for 14 yrs and had stayed in many hotels throughout the city over the years.  I would easily stack this hotel against any of the top hotels in the city.I'll be honest - my biggest complaint about this place was with the housekeeping staff, which is a first for me. I don't think I've ever stayed in a hotel or motel anywhere, of any size, where getting your room cleaned took SO long for such a mediocre result. I stayed here for almost a week during the Sun Bowl, and would leave the room for 3-4 hours every morning to get some coffee, only to come back to a room that had not been cleaned, even though the sign was remaining on the door. One time - fine, but this was the majority of the days. When I called for housekeeping, a rude lady showed up at my door, walked in without saying a word, then walked out saying, "Ok, one minute." 10 minutes later, a nice older lady came to clean my room. About 40 minutes later, it was done, minus the vacuuming, which I asked her to skip because I needed to nurse my baby and wanted to do so in private. The few times housekeeping did come to the room while I was gone, the room always smelled like cigarette smoke - no idea why, but very disappointing for a non-smoking room. The front desk staff members were friendly, and the place is close to the airport. I definitely wouldn't stay here again with a young child. If you have a slightly-outdated hotel, the one thing you have to do is keep it clean.We have never had any problems here! When we aren't at home you can find us checked in at this hotel. The staff is very nice, polite and extremely helpful. The rooms are always ready and well kept! The only complaint this time around is the strong smell of cigarettes in the hallway although all the rooms are clearly marked nonsmoking, but I guess some people just can't read our simply have no respect for others.I reserved a two bedroom suit about a month ago, when arriving after a 24 hour drive I was told it was not available. They had double booked it even though I had paid in advance. The staff did not seem interested in helping fix this problem at all. Finaly after about an hour of arguing in the lobby the agreed to give us two mini suits at the same rate as the two bedroom suit. When we went to our room, they were not the mini suits but the standard two queen bed rooms. I went back down to the lobby and they said they would not give us the mini suits unless we paid the full amount. After another hour they agreed to charge us at the same rate as the two bedroom suit. We did get a nonsmoking room like we asked, but it was right next to a smoking room and our rooms smelled like cigarette smoke the entire time we where there.We had an excellent stay recently at Hawthorn Suites on Boeing.  Staff was great, room was nice and comfy. Here's my complaint.  Cleaning staff parked where perhaps guests should park (in the shade I might add), all day, leaving us to search for a space as we came and went throughout the day.  Paying guests should have first choice for parking and staff should have a designated area to park.What a nightmare. Yes, this hotel is under renovation, but it is unfit for guests. Trash lines the hallways, the rooms are only marginally clean, there was no telephone in our room....just a few examples of the blatant disregard for the paying patrons.Usually, when a hotel is under serious remodel, the owners care enough about the customers to close the building until the work is finished. It is clear that is not the case at this filthy, borderline dangerous, hotel.After reading reviews I was kicking myself for booking this hotel. But my experience went really well. I arrived at the hotel a little after midnight for a three night stay, yes the front of the hotel and lobby area are under construction and honestly that's the only affected part I saw. The guy at the lobby was very nice and accommodating trying to find me a non smoking room since I booked through priceline. The room was clean, small, and had all the essentials. There was no trash lining the hallways, rude house keepers, or loud construction. The only negative I did experience was my key card didn't work but that was taken care of quickly. It's a great hotel, right next to the fort bliss and the airport. I'd stay here again.Fairly Clean, comfortable beds, good price and close to airport.  Staff was friendly. Property was somewhat oudated, but had very nice look to it. There was water stains on the sealing right above my bed. It was raining and I feel sleep praying I would not be woken up by dripping water from the sealing. The next morning I was still dry. We cheerfully got ready for our trip, boarded their author shuttle and had a pleasant coversation with the driver on our way to airport.  All in all its a good place to stay if you have a really flight tho catch.To be honest we never got a room. I reserved a room through the hotel website.. Lots of construction going on.. The person behind the desk was a complete ass.. He wAs rude and lazy.. Couldn't find our reservation.. I gave him our confirmation number and he said we didn't call in to secure the room.. Apparently after you reserve a room you have to call and verify that you want it.. It wasn't even past 20 min past deadline .. He continued to tell us ha had no more king rooms only double rooms.. Complete lies through every website I could still get King rooms I even called to check this time.. Management needs work.. It wAs blessing  the Wyndham suite we got was cheaper and beautiful and huge separate bedroom :) that is the only thanks they get .. Thanks for sending me to a nicer hotel ..The rooms were really small, the bathroom sink wasn't draining, and the kids running up and down the hallway drove me nuts! But on a brighter note, the ice machine was close to my room, they have an indoor pool, they have free breakfast with yummy waffles shaped like texas, Free WiFi, and most of all the staff was very friendly! The shuttle took us to & from the airport, as well as to & from the restaurant & mall! As long as you request it ahead of time or if they have it available!Just arrived...1st king room was tiny...I mean tiny like the king bed filled the room with virtually no room to spare.  The staff was so sweet when we asked for a larger room which is wonderful.  And, the next room was much better in size.  Sadly, the hotel is so run down and icky...the pleasant staff just isn't enough to keep me here for the week.  Just booked a different hotel for the rest of the week.  For the same price I have found much nicer and newer accommodations. I cannot recommend this Hawthorn Inn and am very disappointed that Hawthorn/Wyndham would put their name to it.We stayed here one night as we were driving cross country.  Our room was small, but clean and comfortable, it had a fridge and a microwave.  There was free high speed wifi, and breakfast.  The breakfast is what took me by surprise.  They have two Belgan waffle irons that made waffles the shape of Texas!  They tasted even better than they looked!  They also had all the fixins for breadfast burritos - eggs, hash browns, sausage patties, salsa, cheese, jalapenos, on flour tortillas.  There was 4 kinds of fruit juice, instant oatmeal, cold cereal, bagels, blueberry muffins, and fresh oranges and bananas.  My kids each ate a huge breakfast that would have cost me $40. to $50. had I taken them to a restaurant, and it was fast and convenient.  When we checked out, we were on our way in good time.  The price was right, and the value was excellent.Not a bad place to lay your head. It is convenient to the airport and the room was clean. It is an older hotel so some of the fixtures and carpet are showing their age a bit. But hey, the TV worked, the A/C worked and the water was hot. Bed was pretty comfy but I drug my tail in at 4:00 am so I am sure the floor would have felt nice. You could do worse, and I have, for a lot more money!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn & Suites El Paso West
review_content: Nice service from the staff. Clean, quiet room with functional air conditioning. No freeway noise in spite of proximity to I-10. These places are so predictably good, it's tough to say anything critical. Christy C noted this place has proximity (RFID) cards. Small imperfection: the exterior door closest to I-10 has a fussy card reader. If you're carrying stuff in and hands are full, this is a small hassle. El Paso has a 17.5% hotel tax rate. This is the highest I've ever paid. Not that this is Hampton Inn's fault, but it's a bad trend.Solid Hampton experience.Location is right off the freeway (without the noise) and next to Rudy's! If you're not a Texan, Rudy's is the best chain BBQ you will ever have. Trust.Rudy's also has a tiny convenience store inside, but there is an odd wall between the hotel and Rudy's that you have to go around to reach it.Getting to the Hampton from I-10 eastbound is easy; it's on the feeder. Getting to it Westbound involves turning into the Holiday Inn parking lot behind Rudy's. There's no signage to this effect.Service is good, but not anything super special. The rooms use RFID cards, so instead of sticking your card in the door, you just hold it up to the reader and the door unlocks.Shower was great. Wifi was slow but adequate. Bed was comfy. :-)This is a newer hotel. It is very clean. The lobby, the dining area and the rooms look and smell clean. Also the rooms are quiet. Interstate 10 is right next to it but I did not hear any noise. The employees I encountered were pleasant. Only complaint is 3 of the 4 ice machines did not work. And the one ice machine that did work was empty because it was the only one providing ice for the entire hotel.Ok hotel...except for the fire alarm going off at 12:30 at night and having to stand in the parking lot till  1:15 in the morning.Nice service and nice new looking hotel. Room had a good clean appearance and bathroom was tidy and clean.  Bed was nice and comfy as well. Right offOf I10 and next to Rudy's.Wow, this hotel sure gets a lot of 5 Star Reviews.  I would be giving this Hampton Inn 5 Stars too if I was ranking them against the rest of the Hampton Inn's that I stayed at. Compared to other Hampton Inn's, the rooms here are larger, the staff is excellent, everything seems new/clean, the hotel at night is peaceful, and their free breakfast is pretty damn good.  I had my own parking spot, which is a perk for being a Diamond member.  However, I didn't use it since there's plenty of parking and regular parking was closer to my room.  By far, this is the best Hampton Inn that I have stayed at.  Peace Out!!Great hotel. The staff were extremely helpful and kind. Room was clean and welcoming. Gabriel, Meagan and David located and shipped an item that I had left there. They did so with soothing ease efficiency, even driving to drop off at FedEx Office!I strongly recommend Hampton Inn to anyone traveling through El Paso.Fantastic hotel with a great wheelchair accessible room!  After traveling for 9 hours and it getting late, we needed to find a safe place to stay in El Paso (though we were trying to get past El Paso due to it being so close to Juarez.)  I was *more* than pleasantly surprised with the room we got (Rm 318) and it's size!  We had two queen beds with a separate living room area, a nice size refrigerator, microwave, 2 flat screen TV's, a long mirror, and nice desk, with hi-speed wifi.  For the low price, I'd stay here longer if I could!  I highly recommend this hotel to anyone!  Clean, courteous, and safe.  Oh!  And, after talking to the maids, they have to change the duvet covers every day!  That's a plus in my book!  AND, they have fitted sheets!  Finally, I'm not waking up in the morning sleeping on a bare mattress.  This has been a great experience all around!  Thank you!This place is beautiful. Really cool vibe and a great room. Excellent breakfast and great location to get around El Paso. Top Notch at a very low price!Very good servicre.I called same-day and booked a room (using my Hilton points) and we were immediately accommodated.  We got exactly the room we asked for and when we requested early arrival (early check-in) they were so helpful that she got her housecleaning staff to get our room ready before it needed to be.  That is great service!I did note that on Sat morning (very early, like 4am), the staff guy was quite rude and seemed very annoyed with the 20 or so guests who were awake that early and wanting coffee (they have automated machines that have coffee all night) but had no receptacle to put their trash in (ie. mixing sticks, empty packets of sugar).  When I kindly asked him if they had a bigger trash can, he said curtly to me "use the one outside" and walked away.. I was actually doing him a favor because since the little itty bitty 32oz trashcan they provided by the coffee pots was already overflowing, it was now piling up on the coffee table and I was helping clean it up.. with that attitude, he can forget my thoughtfulness and clean it up!Besides that, clean, modern, well maintained hotel and great reception staff during the day.  I'd come back again.I've stayed here multiple times over the past few months and have had pleasant experiences. The hotel is clean, staff is friendly, and breakfast good. I will return when/if I am in the area again.A few things to note:- The card readers on the outside doors are hit-and-miss; it's frustrating when they don't work- The bathrooms in normal rooms have showers only- The treadmills are of good quality but have a 60 minute timer limit. If you want to run longer than 60 minutes, the machine will need to be resetOne last important item: Although the hotel breakfast is good, go to Rudy's across the parking lot for delicious and inexpensive breakfast tacos. Do it and thank me later.This is THE best Hampton Inn that I've ever stayed... and like Adam P., I also stay in a lot of properties. (And more specifically, a lot of Hampton Inn properties....)I had a very late arrival (around midnight) due to the late flight that I took. But the front desk attendant was very friendly and welcoming. There are 4 floors to this property. Mine was on the 3rd. The key card that they give  you is a "Saflok" card. So it's the kind that you just wave over a a little disc thingy to unlock. Upon entering I saw the upgraded light switches and the Privacy and Clean room buttons. Nice!! (Man, this isn't typical for Hampton's... more like 5 * properties have those buttons...)But then I stepped a little bit more into my spacious room... yes, very spacious... and I found the extremely comfortable bed, a nice sofa and coffee table, comfortable & roomy desk area, and a flat screen TV. The bathroom was nice and spacious as well! Nice large shower area, no bathtub -- which is a-okay with me! Granite countertop... nice Kohler sink. Then downstairs for breakfast. Gorgeous open area for eating with large vaulted ceilings. For complimentary breakfast, the food was actually very good! They had this "bagel topper" item... which was pretty tasty with egg, cheese, and I think sausage. Oh, and I was happy to see at breakfast the plates and utencils are all tater-ware, 100% biodegradable -- just like the kind at my local Whole Foods in PHX. Nice touch Hampton Inn.... :)Always complimentary coffee (I think 24/7).... and complimentary WiFi. This property has to be pretty new... everything looks great. Great decor!The only thing..... is that this is pretty much on the far West side of town. It's kind of a drive to other parts of town.It is right off the 10 Interstate; so if you're road tripping on the 10 through El Paso, I would definitely stay here!BTW, the photos on the Hampton website do not do this place justice!!Summary based on 1 stay:--ok business oriented hotel, close to I10--pricier than average--ok free breakfast, but items like fresh fruit not replenished--helpful staff--aircon more quiet than average--ok work space for laptop BUT--internet wifi unusably slow--parking dumb, requiring steping over median strips in lot--only a couple of restaurant choices for later night dining nearbyWe stopped here on our drive back to TX due to heavy traffic along I-10 E from construction, but I'm really glad we did! The rooms are clean and well-maintained -- almost seemed like a new hotel! They have scanning keycards for the room keys, instead of the usual inserting key cards. Free hotel breakfast runs from 6-10 AM, and hot items are served. They had sausage patties, cheese omelets, and french toast sticks the morning I was there, as well as make-your-own waffles & pancakes, fruit, coffee, juices, cereal, oatmeal, and breakfast pastries/bagels.  Gas station and a Rudy's next door are a plus!Best Hilton property in EP price wise.  Only thing is it is far from the middle of town.As a business traveler, some things are more important to me than if I were traveling for personal reasons. This hotel had many positives, but one glaring negative. Positive attributes include: clean rooms, property in above average repair, several trash cans in each room, below average noise coming from both inside and outside hotel, and consistent water pressure and truly hot water. This property is either fairly new or completely remodeled recently.The one glaring negative for this hotel was very, very, very slow Internet speeds. For those travelers who know what latency is, latency for the Internet at this property was 2,000 at times. The fastest Internet speeds I realized during my five nights were about 500 kB (1/2 of 1 meg). With Internet speeds this slow, and latency that was extremely high, it was virtually impossible to connect to the company network using VPN tunnels and RDCs. While I understand that many guests can be accessing Wi-Fi at the same time, this is 2012, and there is no good reason why this hotel does not have sufficient bandwidth and/or backhaul to provide every guest with adequate and reliable data speeds. No reason at all. I would only consider staying at the Hampton Inn in NW El Paso again if I had strong assurances that decisive steps have been taken to address the Internet speed and latency issues.Other thoughts: If Internet speed and reliability are not important to you in the least, this is a good hotel to consider. Also, while I saw an exercise room, indoor swimming pool, business center, and know there was a breakfast in the morning, I did not use these facilities or services, so I will not offer a review of them.Stayed November 2012, traveled on businessThis is probably one of the nicest Hampton's I have ever stayed at, and I have slept around a lot....hotels...seriously!  Anyway, the hotel is practically new with a very attentive and friendly staff.  Furnishings are tasteful, and my room has been cleaned very well both days.  Breakfast selections were okay, but hey it's free right!  Wi-fi signal was pretty decent.  Stay here, you shouldn't be disappointed.

Pro:*Friendly staff*Fast wifi *HBO movie channel (watched Divergent, Maze runner...)*Room has safe! *Good water pressure and very hot water*Lot of plugs and outlets, desk has both USB and regular outlet. Bedside table has extra outlet attached to. *24 hours coffee in the lobby, microwave too*clean *very comfy pillows Con:*Heater temp set high as 78 only. I kind like it to be hotter. (When it's 30 degrees outside)If you book from Hotwire, this is most likely the hotel you will get.I had a good stay here while driving back to Fort Worth from Los Angeles, CA. While I usually stay at the Residence Inn off of I-20 (they were booked), I settled on this Red Roof Inn. For one night, I wasn't disappointed. Cost was between $55-63.First, the entire property seems to have been newly renovated. My room was on the end corner of the second floor, and it seemed to have been nearly the size of a suite that you would see at a SpringHill Suites or something. The floors were hardwood (no complaints) and clean, as well as that of the bed. The walls weren't paper-thin (another good thing), and there was an elevator available to access my room. Usually in low cost motels/inns like this, having an elevator on property is usually 50/50. This is quite convenient for those that are traveling with family members or friends that don't like walking up stairs.There was a sufficient amount of parking towards the rear of the property. The front area of the property is a bit misleading, as you will think that this is the only place to park. I didn't notice too many places to eat within walking distance, yet I do know that such venues as Dunkin Doughnuts (for coffee), Starbucks and others are within a 1-1.5 mile drive via I-20 and some local roads. While Red Roof Inns in general do not offer breakfast for their guests (no exception here), the coffee choices were not bad. Further, the front desk personnel were also quite cool and easy to deal with.Altogether, I had a good night's stay at this clean property while energizing for my final 9+ hours of driving back to Fort Worth. I'll certainly stay here again, if necessary.Red Roof Inn here in El Paso is a no frills hotel. the room is clean, very clean. the chair to sit and do my computer work exceeds many of the fancy hotels. I really like that. the TV it's a big flat very nice. the bathroom with granite counters is fine. it just has the minimum soap and shampoo, the towels are adequate, not the softest ever, but adequate. the price performance is excellent. so as a no frills hotel Red Roof is looking upNo, this isn't a diamond in the rough. It's tired and odd. Front desk guy seemed out of it. Double booked my fucking room and some guy was trying to get in like 20 minutes after I checked in. I left to get food only to return to find my key deactivated. Now I get to return to the front desk from the third floor with shit in my hands. The only reason for the 2 stars are the proximity to restaurants and the strip club next door. Fuck the hotel.Worst staff on duty,   they lie about  there price  from the sign overlooking the freeway,  they rather  send u away  then to take a third party reservation,  then the host tells me Why did you come back,  I told you I was not giving you a room his word, since when dose a dirty foo like that get the balls to act as if he is the owner , this place looks like a 3 to 4 star hotel but now I know why it's a 2 start should  be a 1 start , advice  get new staff  then u can charge 80 a night , I would have paid it if I was greeted with respect as I came inI mean an inn is an inn right? This one was typical, nothing horrendous, nothing special. Let me warn you though ladies, this place is located not next to one but TWO strip clubs (excuse me, gentlemen's club). Perfect place to spend our anniversary right? Haha luckily for my boyfriend we went boot shopping beforehand and he was let off the hook :)Good value for the price. Our room was $65/night. The room was clean enough and the check in staff was friendly. Free wifi. No pet charge so our pups were FREE! There's also free coffee in the lobby in the morning.My review is on the king suite. We arrived at this location after a cross country drive. We were exhausted and anxious to shower. When we checked in, we got one of the last available rooms. Our room was the handicapped access room as well as a king suite. It was spacious and clean. The bed was comfy and had plenty of pillows. Maybe this location isn't the best choice if you are going to want a fancy breakfast. It worked very well for us as we only wanted a hot shower and good night's sleep. I like the new Red Roof remodel rooms with no carpeting and no dirty, gross comforters. I would stay here again if I am driving through and needing a few hours of sleep.Very disappointed in the room, the hotel states all rooms were remodeled but ours didn't look like it. The shower would back up and it would take forever for the water to drain. Their were brown stains on bathroom walls. The AC unit would cool room down but would make a lot if noise when you would turn it on. The room walls need better insulation, we could hear our neighbors bumping music and other inappropriate noises.Pros:Stayed last night, weekday rate of about $56 plus tax. Large room, office chair/desk. Hard wood floors. Microwave, safe and fridge. Flat screen tv. Good toiletries (Pantene shampoos). Free coffee. Clean and comfy bed. Located near a lot of restaurants.Cons:My room had only one mirror which was in the bathroom. No big deal for me, but might be a big deal for families..?My AC unit knob was broken, couldn't turn the temp up. We were freezing! So we turned it completely off, but luckily, we didn't sweat during the night.Hotel is right next door to a strip club. This wasn't a problem for my husband (LOL!), but it might be a problem for families.Overall, it was a pleasant stay for us. I wouldn't mind coming back again.Not the greatest place to stay, but the rates are not too expensive (about $50-60) per night and we basically needed a place to stay for our trip to Houston from San Diego. No frills here. Beds, tv, coffee, but no breakfast (not even continental)! They messed up on our reservation. I asked for a ground room floor for handicapped since my Dad has a little difficulty with his knees. They did find us a ground floor room, but the smoke alarm wasn't hooked up. Don't think we'll be staying here again!We are frequent guests at Red Roof Inn across the country. Last night we stayed in El Paso East and had an awesome experience. The room was great, the property was well maintained and best part was the service we received. Andy, the overnight shift front desk is the main reason for 5 star rating, he was super polite and helpful, I was in the lobby sitting and observed Andy handling check ins in the late evening line a pro, he also arranged for extra towels and was a pleasure. We chatted for a few minutes, this hard working young man is an asset to the location..,keep up the good work Andy!!! Honorable mention to Gilbert who checked is in.Bare bone basic.Bring your own everything!Not enough towels, no coffee maker, blowdryer, space or  customer care.Wont stay here anymore regardless of thier price.Booked advanced for the trip back in Sep 2013, on their website shows newly re-modeled, but not really, got the room that so old, very dirty shower has crack and a hole on the wall, carpet and bed sheet are dirty too, end up went to Spring Hill Suites next to them! Beware!!Stayed here the first night I arrived in El Paso, I planned on staying for 12 days but checked out the next morning. If you are just looking for a crash pad for the night, this will suffice anything for an extended period I would look elsewhere if I were you.So, I had been driving for 9 hours headed from Phx to Austin.  It was 3 am and I was exhausted..  Finally stop in El Paso and hit up the Holiday Inn Express (mostly so I could say I am not a _______ but I did stay at a Holiday Inn Express last night.)  They wanted $160 for a room that I needed for 5-6 hours max..  NO THANKS!  So, down the road a mile, found the Red Roof Inn.  Wasn't expecting or needing much, just a bed and a shower..For the life of me, I cannot recall the name of the gentleman that helped me that night..  But at 3am he was very cheerful..  Quite the opposite of the near zombie state I was in.I asked him for the price, was quoted something in the range of $60, and asked for any discounts.  He hooked me up with the AARP I believe..  Saved me $15.  He then walked outside with me to find a place for me to park my truck and trailer.Had I needed a place to sleep on the drive back, this would have been my first choice.  But, alas, I drove straight through..Great value for the money.  Very cute, recently renovated room with flat-screen TV, mini fridge and free wifi.  Nice desk for setting up a laptop.  Very clean.Decent motel to crash at. Don't expect to use the filthy shower though. Everything else was clean enough. Walls are very thin though. Didn't mind it much but it wouldn't be our first choice next time thru El Paso. It was cheap (~$65 for a king room)...Nestled snugly between a gentleman club and industrial park sits The Red Roof Inn.  Its pretty much is what you would suspect... the internet is good and the free coffee is palatable compared to other hotel lobby coffee I've tried to digest.  I recommend you request a non-smoking room and head to the Las Palmas Shopping center for dinner or a real cup of coffee).

hotel_name: La Quinta Inn & Suites El Paso West Bartlett
review_content: My family and I stayed at this hotel last night and we thought it was pretty nice. The receptionist was very friendly. We brought our dog here bc I found it on the bring fido app. They were nice enough to even give us doggy bags. I would recommend to someone else. Also Chilis, Texas Roadhouse, and Krispy Kreme are in the same parking lot.While the young man working the front desk in the evening was very polite I believe that is just about the only thing I can say nice about this hotel. Except they do have a security guard watching the cars. They need it! Not a very nice area. The rooms are disgusting to say the least. One step up from a gas station bathroom. A park bench might be more comfortable than the beds. The rooms smell. The carpets are as such you wouldn't dare take your shoes off.  However we did make it though the night. Gotta wait and see if we "catch" anything for the filth. Stay at your own risk.The Hotel is dated, but the price is right.  We upgraded to a master suite for under hundred dollars, plus we had our dogs with us.  The location has dining choices close by, including a Texas Road House, Chilis, and Krispy Kreme if you do not feel like driving for a mealA dead Texas size cockroach (at least 2 inches long) in the room and a lot of baby ones cruising around the bathroom. Yikes!!!!!!! This La Quinta is in serious need of a fix up. There were a lot of broken stuff in the room and I just couldn't take advantage of the free breakfast after seeing the roaches.I'll start off by saying that I booked this hotel through hotwire and when I saw all these negative reviews on Yelp and Tripadvisor I was traumatized.  But after checking into a room, the images of a run-down old shack quickly disappeared. The room itself was spacious and had a nice flat screen with all your favorite cable channels.  There weren't peeling paint as another reviewer stated or growing mold in the showers, so that was a big relief. But most importantly, the bed was large and comfortable which really is the only important thing when staying in a hotel. However the bathroom lights and toilet were really loud and the hallways did reek of smoke.  I'm really sensitive to smoke, so that's definitely not cool :/ Breakfast. Whoever said that their breakfast sucked probably has overly high standards. From my visits I had a freshly toasted bagel with cream cheese. And had we not been in a rush I probably would have made myself a fresh waffle from their waffle maker. The orange juice was from a machine but honestly this is a pretty great selection for a hotel of this caliberFor a economy hotel, this definitely deserves 3 stars.There are two La Quintas almost next to each other in this area so need to be aware of which one you're booking.   I'm an awards member so they upgraded me.  Room on second floor.  Bed was very comfortable queen.  Room was quiet of street noise.  Internet worked very well but that may be a function of how full the hotel is. But even though the room looked great when I checked on after a three night stay I noticed wall wear and a very noisy bathroom vent. These are not deal breakers but there was no business center to use to print out my Southwest boarding pass. That's a big negative for me.lots of good restaurants on Mesa and in the area once you get away from the interstate.I'll stay here again even though the absence of a business center is a big negativeNo water pressure, ac unit was broken, ants on the floor but hey I am just here to sleep. Bed was firm and tv worked. What else could I ask for? Ha...06/15/13WARNING: There are TWO La Quinta Inns right across the street from each other. I accidentially went to the wrong La Quinta when the people across the street kindly told me that this occurs all the time. Whoops. I guess I was just too excited to go to bed after my long drive.This La Quinta was great. It had a nice flat screen TV, wireless internet, and all the basic ammenities you could want. Also, the best thing about here was the free continental breakfast although I could not help notice that this one lady was hoging up the waffle machines. Breakfast was served from 6-9am.Very ghetto. But a wonderful flat screen TV. And the Otis Spunkmeyer muffins at breakfast are pretty good. The bathroom fan is quite strong too.Faces the highway and the traffic noise is high. The expired milk at the breakfast bar poured out in large sour lumps into my once pristine lucky charms. We alerted the lady about it and she only threw away the ones that were one week expired, even though the lumpy one was from the batch that was only one day expired.I believe the other la quinta is the one our climber friends recommend so we'll try that next time.Solid marks for clean, inside doors, and pet friendly. The rate for my stay was less than a lot of other nights on this trip.We have stayed here multiple times while traveling to/from CA to TX. We are always exhausted and don't care if it's a luxury hotel or not we just need a room for the night that will accept pets. Unfortunately, this particular La Quinta has gone further downhill on each visit. We arrived late and all they had available was a smoking room, not usually a big deal, a little odor but we get past it. I had to use my inhaler as soon as I walked on the door!!! I continued using it all night. The room was so gross! To the point that I didn't even take my clothes or socks off and my socks were black from walking on the carpet! The worst part though is our poor dogs (who are treated for fleas) left the hotel itching and scratching and sure enough they had fleas!!! I called the hotel to inform them and they said they would treat the room but you never know, it was obviously infested! Obviously, we won't stay here again.Oh where to start. I have stayed here twice. I try to give everything a fair shake. Ok let me start off with one word. Dated interior. Many have been remodeled and this one is not only in need of updating but MAINTANCE! Elevator- Button on first floor is litterally cracked and broken to the point where I got shocked a few times when calling the elevator.Laundry- For all you folks out there that frequent this chain it is very typical that the Laundry is on the third or fourth floor. Don't ask me why, it just is. I expect this so it is not an issue with me.Interior- as stated before in desperate need of a facelift and maintance and this would go for the appliances too. I had to keep pushing the mini frig around to make it stop grumbling and keeping me up all night.Another not so impressive little incident. I forgot a very expensive item in the room. I was half way back home before I realized it. I called and the front desk person said they would ask housekeeping to check the room for it. They came back and said it wasn't there. I asked him to check the room himself and he promptly told me that he had. I then told him that I knew exactly where I had left it. I was told that he could only go by what he had been told by the staff ( remember he just said that he had checked the room himself!) He said that if I was certain that I could call the police and file a theft report. I told him that I would turn around and come back to El Paso and to let his manager know I was on my way back so that we could do this. I also told him that i knew the device i had left due to the GPS tracking device in the item which is activated even when the unit is not turned on and that it was indicating it was at the hotel address. WIthin seconds I was told that they had now found it and that house keeping was coming with it. I turned around to retrevie the item and when I got there I got an apology from the person that I had spoken to on the phone when I told him that the GPS devices sure do come in handy! He told me that he was sorry and that it was not him that had gone to check the room ( again remember he originally said he had!) This got me off to a really rocky start with the chain that is a preferred vendor for my employer. Needless to say that this location has lost my business and I will look to stay at one of the other locations that has been renovated.Not as new & updated as other la quinta hotels I've stayed at. But, if you've been driving west for ten hours and still haven't left Texas, this is an okay place to sleep. Pillows were soft & the drapes made it way dark. It's right off i10, across from another La Quinta.My only gripes:- no hot water (was room temp, even after letting it run five minutes)- Did not have HBO & half of the channels were in spanish- Looked very vacantLike I said, this place isn't ideal for a romantic get away. You shouldn't be looking in El Paso anyway if you want that.Room looked clean. Nothing in disrepair. Well maintained. Wifi works, but kinda slow. They turned the AC on before I arrived which was good.  Considering how hot it gets in El Paso, that in itself warrants an extra star.  You do not want to spend the next few hours trying to cool down a room that was hot as a furnace upon arrival.I want to start this review off by saying that I now am rest assured that the entire city of El Paso is doomed. The stay here started off horrible. The shower head in our first room was torn out of the wall and the water pressure was so high that it flooded the bathroom. We were moved to another room, which we thought would be better, but we only traded up to trade down yet again. The sheets had disturbing stains and the sink and bath wouldn't drain. To top it off, minutes after I checked out I realized I left my leather jacket in room and called wanting to come right back for it, they claimed my jacket wasn't found which is impossible , being, I walked from room to car and nowhere else. So, I assume their employees are thieves.Stopped on the way back to San DiegoPRO:Nice RoomNice Customer ServicesGreat BreakfastGOOD A/CLots of good places to eat, entertain, and shop.CONS:Across the street from another La Quinta Inn and SuitesPOOL VERY DIRTYBathroom was moldy around the top off the showerLaundry was on the FOURTH floor and my room was on first.Overall, It was Just okay. Second worst of my La Quinta stays at this point.It has a roof and a bed. But this was no comfortable place. I wouldnt come here.If there were less than 1 star, this hotel would earn it!  Take a bath in 6 inches of water---brush your teeth in 6 inches of water!  AND Dirty AND  poor customer service from the front desk.Located roughly 10 minutes west of downtown El Paso right off of I-10, The La Quinta is clean, is in a safe neighborhood, and reasonable. As with all La Quinta's, they are pet friendly and give you a free Continental breakfast in the morning. The La Quinta is older than some and is a little bit run down. However, all in all, it was a nice spot to stay for a reasonable price.Our carpet was dirty and the a/c didn't really cool at night. We had to let the manager know about the problems. The hotel is convenient to many restaurants and shopping.

Very nice hotel!! upon arrival they served evening snacks until 7 pm. Apparently they do this Mondays through Thursdays. The snacks at this location consisted of Nachos and some vegetables. There was also Beer and Wine as well as Water and Lemonade. I'm on the road often and this is one of the first hotels I have seen do this. It was very nice and very welcoming. Rooms are spacious and clean and the staff was very friendly.This is the hotel that made me realize that not all hotels within a chain are created equal. On my travels I typically try to stay at a Hilton brand hotel, and within the Hilton family, I favor the Hampton Inns for their reasonable pricing and free breakfast. They're (generally) nice enough that you don't feel that you're at a seedy place yet not so expensive that you feel that you've wasted money if you don't spend all your time at your hotel. The quality of this Hampton Inn and the way it is managed however, has made me reconsider the Hampton Inn chain, and perhaps the Hilton family as well. To be fair, this Hampton Inn is pretty standard in terms of what you get. My complaints about the hotel itself are minor: The elevator is in a weird place (not centralized), the pipes are noisy so it sounds like your toilet is automatically flushing at random times as water is being forced through the pipes, and you can hear the cars on the highway if your room is facing the highway. My chief complaints however, are with how this hotel is managed:1) The people who work here do not know what they are doing. Before booking this hotel, I saw that my credit card was offering a rebate for spending a certain amount at a Hampton Inn by a certain date. My planned trip to El Paso was a few days after the expiration of this offer so I called the hotel in advance asking if I could pay for my room in advance. They told me that it would not be a problem. So despite seeing rooms for cheaper in El Paso, I booked here in hopes of getting my credit card rebate. A week before my stay, I called the hotel asking to prepay and was directed to billing. They told me sent me a credit card authorization form to fill out and fax back. I did that. A few days later, not seeing any charge on my card, I called them again to make sure that they would charge my credit card before my rebate offer expired. They told me they could not charge my card in advance. The COULD NOT TAKE MY MONEY. Really? The person I called before I booked told me I could. The person who send me the damn credit card authorization said I could. And I guess they were just lying to me. Or they didn't know what the hell they were talking about. And so I stayed at this hotel and didn't get my credit card rebate. I feel cheated because I found a cheaper rate during my stay and didn't book at that hotel because I wanted the rebate here. 2) I suspect the house cleaners will take your moneyMy brother came with me on my trip and he had a significant amount of money in his wallet. When we went out during the day, he forgot his wallet in our room. But I left a do-not-disturb sign up to waive cleaning. When we checked out and went back home, he realized that only he only had half of his money in his wallet. The only time the wallet left his side during our trip was when he forgot it in our hotel room. So this is the only time the money he brought with him on our trip could have been taken. I strongly suspect that house cleaning came into our room anyway to snoop around. They were smart enough to only take part of the cash from the wallet so that we wouldn't immediately discover the theft. 3) No Hilton Honors pointsA week after my stay, I see that they have not posted the Hilton Honor points for my stay, despite such points usually posting after 48 hours. I read the fine print on the Hilton website, and apparently not all Hilton hotels participate in the Hilton Honors program. This Hampton Inn is probably one of them. So I spent a lot of money I didn't have to spent, didn't get my credit card rebate, lost a lot of money, and didn't get any honors points. Worst Hampton Inn experience I've ever had.Its a hotel.  They have beds.  They have breakfast.Place is really in need of a remodel.  Bathroom door is all chipped up and doesn't close properly.Probably a 2.5 but I rounded up (not sure I should have)We recently were passing through El Paso and needed a room for the night. I called a couple of hours prior to our arrival and Sarah was very pleasant and extremely helpful.  On arrival, the check-in was quick and the room was fabulous!Two weeks later, we happened to stop in and not only did Sarah recognize us, but she even remembered our names!A very clean, comfortable hotel and the service is fabulous!  A complimentary breakfast is provide in the morning, and it definitely exceeds the average hotel breakfast.First night and beds were ssoo relaxing and comfortable. Rooms are clean and stocked night and morning staff all friendly!  complimentary buffet is amazing and variable. So far loving it..Quick bullet points...Pros:-Located close to the airport-Close to El Paso' main freeway (I-10)-Great staff-Fitness Room w/free weights and a couple of treadmills-Quiet, especially at night. -Price-Located near restaurants and the mall-Microwave, TV, and Fridge-Honest housekeeping.  Have yet to loose anything-Hilton Honor Points and free stuff-Free WiFiCons:-Breakfast is just your basic precooked liquid eggs, sausage, oatmeal, waffles, and toast.-No room service-Rooms are small, but still comfortable. Even though I prefer to stay at the Hilton Garden, this Hampton Inn has become one of my regular hotels when I'm in El Paso.  The Hilton Garden Inn, which is right on the other side of the freeway, is nicer.  It's just way too crowded.Went to visit for a quick weekend trip to see a friend. I was very pleased with my room. It was clean and fresh when we checked in. They put us in the far back which I was a little irked with initially but glad later because there was a loud crowd staying on the same floor. Breakfast was great.  Lots of variety and the waffle maker was a hit with my dad! The lobby is a bit small and it was a busy weekend so it seemed like a busy restaurant. We checked out super early on Sunday and was halt the was already fresh coffee. I was hoping there might be some breakfast but it was too early. Front desk attendee was amazing she found us 4 muffins to go! That's service!  We'll definitely staying there again.  Only reason I didn't give a 5 star was because of the loud people on our floor.The best low budget, non 5 star or 4 diamonds (whatever rating they receive) ..BEST Hotel I have stayed at in years.Last year I stayed here because of a wedding. The service was sensational, nearly perfect for low-budget hotel. I even high fived the front desk lady. I still remember that, I'm sure you have never high five someone at the front desk. Anyways, This hotel doesn't have room service, but it has a small mini-mini-snack store for microwaveable food (Rooms have microwaves), beverages and more snacks. Rooms are very very clean, up-to-date. Comfy too!Now, I would write more but for what I have left, Mel C. has written a bullet point review that summarizes the rest.(Thanks Mel C.)We decided to stay at this Hampton inn on our way home. Very happy we did.  Front desk staff are very friendly. Room is nice and clean.  They put us in the odd number rooms so nice and quiet.  When I asked for a good Mexican food place they recommended L&J. Then offered to have the shuttle take us and pick us up when we were done.  So happy the have a shuttle.  Was awesome to have them take us and pick us up so we didn't get lost and could have a wine margarita at the restaurant.  Driver was very friendly and when she picked us up offered to take us to the mall.  Made the wife very happy!!  Haven't had the breakfast yet but I'm sure it will be within Hampton standards.  Will update if it's not. But will definitely stay here again when we drive through.I don't recommend this place. It's outdated and kinda dirty. We found a bed bug at room 430 and yellow trailing residue on the wall. We all freaked out and told the manager. The manager was apologetic about it and was told he'll have somebody look into it and he did.  He upgraded us to a suite but it's not impressive at all.We left immediately in the morning (we checked in at 1am). We didn't even consider the free breakfast.Easy convenient location with lots of food and shopping options very close.  The hotel was cute and the rooms were just perfect for what we needed.  Everything was clean, nothing in disrepair and the rooms were very comfortable.  The complimentary breakfast had many options and everything was tasty - cereal, waffles, oatmeal, breakfast rolls, little breakfast pizzas on mini bagels, sausage and more.  We were very pleased and would definitely stay again.I stayed at this hotel for four days for business. I will start with the excellent happy hour from 5:30-7:30 daily. They provide vegetable trays, popcorn, chips & salsa, fruit juice and a keg of beer everyday. They change the entree daily, examples hot wings, chili & cheese and chicken nuggets with fries. The food was outstanding. The staff is courteous and attentive to all your needs. Great hotel in the hottest city in the USA.So, you're probably wondering why the hell anyone would go to El Paso right?  Frankly, so am I.  The only reason I went there at all was for a weekend leadership conference.  The conference was actually at the Marriott but I can get discounts at Hilton Family Hotels so, of course, I decided to stay the nearest one.Anyway,  my friends and I were given 5-star, no, make that 6-star service even before we left El Paso Airport.  Because of work, we had to take a later flight so we didn't even land until 11:30 at night.  When I used the courtesy phone to call the Hampton Inn for a shuttle, the guy on the phone greeted me with "Are you  Ms. Young?  We've been expecting you."  I've been to a few hotels and have never received personalized service at that level.The hotel is small with only four floors and about 140 rooms.  The decor of the lobby is very cozy and reminded me of a large den complete with fire place and comfy sofas.  The rooms are a bit on the small side but they're sparkling clean and the beds are VERY comfortable.I can't say enough good things about the service we received from absolutely EVERY person that worked at this hotel.  They all embodied the level of service I expect to receive from a Hilton Family Hotel and I couldn't have been happier.  In particular, their graveyard shuttle driver (Oscar) was so nice and drove us wherever we needed to go without ever having a poor attitude or complaint.Some other highlights that made me fall in love with the Hampton:*Free 24 hour shuttle service within a 3-mile radius*Free business center use (24 hours)*Free breakfast from 7 a.m. - 10 a.m.*In-room mini fridge*In-room microwaveIf you ever find yourself in El Paso, The Hampton Inn by the airport is definitely the place you want to stay.  You will not regret it!OK please. Only one laundry in the hotel. Food is ok (microwave chicken nuggets). Rooms are not bad...Not great, but not bad.good hotel, good location right off I-10.  nice clean room as i would expect from a Hampton.Breakfast is ok but not great.  Nothing too impressive.  Location was a little weird and hard to get to depending on which way you come from.  Could have been 4 stars maybe because they do have FREE BEER from 5 to 7pm on at least some days.  Other than that it was pretty meh.Having just had a wonderful stay at the Hampton Inn in Sierra Vista, AZ, this location just didn't stand up to the comparison.  Everything was just a bit off.  The room wasn't quite clean.  The breakfast wasn't especially good.  The common area was a bit cramped, and the "business area" was an open countertop with three computers in the lobby.  All in all, disappointing.You know how some hotels say they have a shuttle but it's a hassle and you end up just calling a taxi. That is not the case here. Their drivers will chauffeur you around like you're starring in your own music video. Everything else is nice too. My room had a Juarez view. That's the way I like it.Staff pleasant. But air condition doesn't work I'm rooms 301 and 418! Have switched rooms already but too tired to keep switching.

Room was very clean and the bed and pillows are very comfortable. I even chose to use their pillow instead of my own! The breakfast was very fresh and a wide array of food. I was expecting not that great of food but I was pleasantly surprised of how good it tasted! The lady who was in charge of the food was very nice. I am very glad I stayed here.Another Marriott family suite hotel, located on the fairly suburban side of El Paso. This one is adjacent to its sister hotel, the Fairfield Inn.This location has decent amenities, including an outdoor pool and hot tub, an enhanced continental breakfast, and a room layout that features either a king bed (best rate) or two queens (highest rate) with a desk and separate seating area. The bar area in front of the room includes a microwave, fridge, and a sink, and the bathroom is sensibly separated from the closet and bathroom sink, unlike the illogical set up we encountered at the Springhill in Flagstaff. Hey, there's even a full length mirror. Where this hotel loses points for me is in cleanliness, for one, because the bathroom tiles had dirty floor and shower grout and caulking, and the carpeted corners in the room looked unclean. As another reviewer noted, the sheets and towels are worn and dingy, and I'll add that so are the bedspreads. The beds are comfortable, however, and the price was reasonable at around $125/night.We had AC problems in the middle of the night in August, when it started switching back and forth between AC and heat and smelled like it was on fire. There's no setting for this, so I just turned it colder and hoped it would keep cooling. Not a restful night. The desk manager wasn't very friendly or helpful when we had questions about our stay or our rewards program, but I will say that the entire staff seems to be fluent in Spanish. Lots of international travelers flowing both ways across the border here because it's right next to Juarez. It was my first time staying overnight in El Paso, but I might try to find something in nearby Las Cruces, New Mexico next time to see if it's a little less hectic.For a Marriott property this is definitely a disappointment the rooms need up keeping our The shower was a big dirty when we got into it definitely room for improvement however the location was OK the staff was friendly checking was normal the continental breakfast is pretty much that just microwave food! A bit of a disappointment to be a Marriott propertyThe only reason i wont give the 5 stars is because they were serving breakfast in a very rude manner. maybe because they were mad cuz of alot of people. but if your going to accept a soccer tournament to check in. u know there is going to be alot of people eating breakfast. you need to have a plan ready to get the lines going quickly. other than that the rooms were very clean and very organized. registration and check out went smoothly. i also heard the cleaning ladies say "k cochinos los muchachos dejaron un cochinero". that means that my players were nasty and left a mess. but as the coach i made sure no mess was left. anyways i aint mad but employees need to be careful on what they say. business is all about customer satisfaction. but overall i would stay again. nice place and good price for my team.Easter weekend provided us the opportunity to head to the border. We reserved our room online and this is actually my second time staying at this hotel nestled in northwestern El Paso. The area is quite with your locals shopping or eating at the nearby restaurants and it is in close proximity to IH-10. The rooms are clean, spacious, comfy beds, free wifi and offers free breakfast buffet the next morning filled with bacon, eggs. Waffles, cereal and pastries. Overall a great stay and all for $100 a night, not a bad deal. Till next time El Paso.Stayed April 2015Weeding out the good Marriott properties over the Internet can be hard. This one is clean, but built like a cheap trailer. The towels and bedsheets are old and browning. The walls so thin I could hear the guy on one side snoring and the other side fighting. The faucets are coated with gunk and and the shower head pulls out of the wall.All this for $20 less than the full Marriott down the way.Hotel is not allergy friendly. They bake cookies with nuts. With no sign on door or notice on website. Front desk is rude.This hotel has lost the "new factor". Which is to be expected after time. I have been staying here twice a year since this property opened and this was the first time it felt a bit run down. Towels are no longer bright white and fluffy. Paint is drab and walls have holes in them. This property also charges for toiletries that are typically complimentary. Very convenient location.I love traveling to new places. It is not just the sight seeing, new restaurants and foods and better weather than home but upon return home you see things differently and begin to notice at home and at the office things you took for granted all those years. I like how in the bathroom at home the toilet paper dispenser is within reach. I don't know what design or construction constraint existed in my hotel room's bathroom when it was built that put the paper dispenser just out of reach when sitting on the toilet. My arms are not long enough to stay again at the SpringHill. Lucky for me there was not an embarrassing fall while reaching for the prize wipe tissue. Sure the SpringHill suites was clean and the staff nice. I liked how there was a Keurig K-cup coffee maker in the room even though I don't drink coffee. A black tea K-cup was provided along side the coffee. I disliked the alarm clock set an hour earlier than the local time my entire stay.I have to admit, I was quite nervous staying in El Paso, Texas right across the border! I was encouraged to keep driving but I had to pull in as I was dead tired and barely functioning. I was driving from Phoenix to Orlando, Florida and my thoughts of making it the first night were off, by about 2 days :)Anyways, this hotel was a little gem. The guy working at the front desk was super fast and friendly and without even asking he gave me a room with a view and a military discount. It is situated by a main street with tons of restaurants and a very short walk to Walmart. For El Paso, it felt very safe. The room was brand new looking and smelling and seemed very modern. The TV was great and the bed was super comfortable. They had a great breakfast in the morning that was included in the price. If you so happen to find yourself in El Paso and need a room, this is a very comfortable hotel.I'm a platinum elite Marriott member and have stayed over 150 nights in Marriott's this year. I have seen my share of hotels and I have stayed in all 3 Marriott properties here in El Paso. I think they all have different perks. This is a great and SAFE location. Walmart is across the street as is a Cinemark movie theater and a classic MUST VISIT Mexican restaurant, Leo's. Its on Tue west side of town which is a bit of a drive (for El Paso) to downtown, etc. You can take 54 through the mountains for a scenic drive or to avoid crazy traffic.I stayed here for 2 weeks and had a great stay. Workout facilities are a bit lacking compared to others, but the jacuzzi and pool are quite nice. There is a Fairfield in the same parking lot for a different look that has free breakfast.DO NOT STAY HERE if you are a business traveler. This is my third and last stay. I am a rewards member and I like this brand, but their internet speed is atrocious. They are always packed, and they don't have nearly enough bandwidth at this particular property. DO NOT STAY HERE if you need Internet. In addition the LTE network is also very thin here so not even your own connection will save you.I have stayed here multiple times. Very clean.good breakfast. Fitness center. A little loud due to being near a highway but that wasn't really an issue. Overall good experience.This place opened up a couple of years ago. And we were one of the first guest the hotel had.So, on our trip back to California we stopped again, because it was a nice place and we prefer to stay at SpringHill suites because they are constantly nice.Well, I am sorry to report that this nice new hotel just a couple years ago has lost its appeal. The hotel clerk was not customer service friendly, I dealt with her twice.
