The shower in our room didn't work right and the wall paper is peeling among other maintenance problems that should be addressed.To top it off, the pool was freezing, we had stopped at many hotels and enjoyed the heated pool, but this place just couldn't manage to do that. So enjoying the pool was out. Yeah I know El Paso is hot, but it was May. Staying somewhere else next time.We have stayed at this Marriott a few times, we were very pleased with the service until now. The front desk clerk named Sheryl was very rude to us from the moment we walked in. She snapped at us for asking a question about a charge, she also argued with us until we walked out. Will NOT be staying at this Marriott anymore!I was looking for a non sketchy hotel and found this little gem via Priceline. It was a first staying with this chain and it rocks! The room was spacious and cozy like a studio apt. Good breakfast with all the hot fixin's like waffles, sausages and cheese omelettes while including the cold fixins of fruit and cereals. Best breakfast value! I would definitely come back to this place again.It's always a pleasure to stay at a Marriott. This SpringHill Suites is in a pretty decent location with quite a few amenities nearby. Check-in was fast, simple, and easy and the staff was great. Oh, and Wi-Fi was free too!This is basically an upscale Motel 6. Everything seemed ok until about 5am when I was awakened by 18-wheeler trucks shaking the shower and making too much noise along the highway which my room faced. There was some strange knocks on the same wall where my headboard was and I could hear pipes rattling around 5am. I could also hear the neighboring rooms shower running and drawers closing. Of course, I asked to switch rooms after only one restless night of this. The room itself was crammed and small even for 1 person. The comforter in the bag had black smudges on it so it clearly hadnt been cleaned. The shower still had soap residue and the lighting was bad in the bathroom area. FOX and NBC channels went completely out at 7pm and ABC didnt work at 7am. I called and the front desk was aware of the problem--which really sucked by the way. When I switched rooms, the guy at the front desk said most people dont like being over there by the highway side. Then why would you put me over there then I thought. I'm an elite member. Breakfast was disgusting. The boiled eggs were brown looking, the sausage patties looked like they were 3 days old and salmonella covered, and I guess it was honeydew balls swimming in some kind of water, and there was no waffle maker. The eggs and croissants were the only thing I could stomach. Very disappointing and not the typical Marriott breakfast quality at all. Id have been mad if I had to pay full rate for this. It is clean, and the location is decent to where I needed to be. There is a very small fridge but no freezer area within it which I was hoping for. The front desk personnel are really nice. I think for the city, this is probably considered a nice area. It was mediocre at best. Nothing upscale and nothing section 8 looking. Theres a bunch of fast food and low-end type eateries around which I dont eat at. I stopped at an Albertsons not far from the airport prior to my arrival which Im glad I did. I havent seen any commercial grocery stores in the immediate area. It is close to the sunland park mall area where there's much better eating options and a Sprouts farmers market. There is a Walmart but no CVSs or Walgreens anywhere. This will suffice for the few days im in own. Hopefully I'll never have to come back to El Paso again for business but if I do, Im gonna have to stay somewhere else. I need peace and quiet when Im trying to sleep.What a deal! Clean, easy to find, and a great price. Clicked on the Priceline link through BetterBidding.com and booked a 2 bed suite for $50 a night. I love getting a good value for my money.

For a cheap, quickly accommodating place, I was quite happy with my stay at the hostel. It obviously wasn't a five start hotel, but for 23 bucks i was given sheets and great service. I was given a room that had two bunks and could sleep four people to myself so there was no need to get a locker like other hostels. Sink in the bedroom and a shared shower and bath down the hall. I walked around the area in the evening and felt pretty safe. Good little restaurants in the area, and interesting history as well. When I came back, I was locked out but the front desk man quickly came running to the door to let me in. He told me he locks it after a certain hour to "keep the ugly people out." I told him thanks for letting me in, then.If you like hanging out at the bus station, you'll like this place. My husband picked the place because it was historic and the oldest hotel in El Paso. The downstairs was very cool and using the old elevator. But there was also a shabby quality that felt not so much hip and cool, but rather seedy. It's clear that the owner has tried to keep it up and running but with minimal input. In our room, curtains were falling, blinds, we're filthy. Not sure if there is AC or not but we could open the window. Our shower didn't work. I requested of my husband that we move to a different place for subsequent nights.Do you like the hairs of random strangers to grace your minimalist towel?Do you like when bugs magically appear in your bed over night?Do you like when the throbbing bass from an Adele dance remix wafts its way from the gayborhood into your hostel room on the third floor?Do you like when a hostel inexplicably has free wifi on every floor?If so, this is perfect for you!Also, lock your door at night. There are some interesting characters renting rooms month to month.I have had an actual nightmare about this place.bathrooms are shared and covered in mosquitos where as texas has the highest rating of west nile in the countrymen bringing prostitutes into the hotel as we were trying to check inno air conditioningnot cleannot well litnot safewindows above all doors so anyone of the creepy people that live there can push them in and crawl into your roomDO NOT STAY THERE GO BY THE AIRPORT FOR THE SAME PRICE!!I do not know how it got good reviews. I saw dead bugs along with hairs everywhere in my bed.Quirk El Numero Uno: There appears to be two websites. The old Gardner Hotel is one part hotel, three parts hostel. Depending on which you're looking for defines which URL should best suit you. Here's both:Hotel: gardnerhotel.comHostel: elpasohostel.comQuirk Secondo: There is a dramatic difference between the workers in the morning and in the evening. Reviews on hostel sites support this, as they almost all either love their experience or hate it. I asked around during my own stay, and it's pretty much been narrowed down to someone (or more) on evening shift that is the bad apple. Ergo, show yourself up 'n check in before the afternoon/evening. That should perk your experience immensely.Third: Hostelers be warned, this is one of the more pricey U.S. hostels. It comes in at over 25-bones. There was no free WiFi when I was there, although they had an Internet kiosk that you could pay to use. The kitchen is open to use, but you'll need to bring your own food. Lastly, the dorms are nothing fancy... and are more than a bit run down.Positives: This isn't the El Paso shelter... which is more of a prison than a safe haven. The hostel's location truly is superb. It makes an excellent launch point for almost any trip you're planning within forty or so miles. Also, El Paso has been consistently ranked among the top three safest metro areas in America. That ranking doesn't take into account the lithium content in the water reservoirs, or the corruption of the police force, but it's still a great place to wander around. Just remember that Ciudad Juarez--which is just across the bridge--sits on the opposite side of the safety spectrum.NOTE: I've never stayed in one of the private rooms of the hotel section. I hear they are clean, well kept and quite luxurious. I look forward to seeing a review from someone who's stayed in one just to hear back on the actual costs and if it's worth it..I was in town for a job interview and didn't have much to spend, so I took a chance on the hostel despite the reviews. I must concur with others in that it is not the cleanest around, but in all fairness, i dont think the place is actually dirty, it is just visibly old and not well updated. It had a bed and a shower for a reasonable price, which was all I needed. The place is not terribly charming, but the staff was friendly and accommodating. I suspect I was one of few guests at the hostel- hardly saw anyone else. If you are looking for a social place look elsewhere. This is really just meant to be cheap housing for a brief period. The basement has a kitchen, couches and a television and seems like it could be a decent place to congregate if the hostel had any guests. The rooms are tiny and poorly lit, the bathroom is suspect, but if you go in expecting bare minimum facilities, you are set.Need to stay somewhere in El Paso for a few nights? Look no further than the Gardner, a hostel with character! You'll feel like you're taking a step back in time. This is a must for all you history buffs and fans of the "Public Enemies" movie, because this is the hotel where John Dillinger stayed in the 30s when he came through El Paso. The lobby has a vintage phone booth and switchboard, and a display case with lots of photos from a bygone era. The elevator is 70+ years old, and still works; it's like the ones you only see in old movies. Rooms are a bit small; I didn't care because I only needed to sleep. Free Wi-Fi in all rooms. There is a downstairs TV room with hundreds of channels. When I stayed there on Memorial Day weekend, I was able to lounge on the sofas and had the whole room to myself! Front doors are locked after 10:00; you need to ring for the attendant on duty to open it up. Walking distance: Bars, Dance clubs, Downtown El Paso (interesting art and history museums), and the border to Juarez Mexico. Also there is a wonderful Holocaust Museum nearby, well worth a few hours of your time. Also, if you are a movie buff, you have to check out the nearby Fellini Film Cafe, a coffee bar/restaurant/art-house video store that shows classic/artsy movies here on almost every night of the week. You could easily spend 2-3 days here without a car, but I would recommend one to see more of El Paso, or if you are doing road trips to Carlsbad Canyons or Roswell, New Mexico. If you stay here, the staff is very helpful. This is the only place I stay when I am in El Paso.The only downfall is that they were painting all the hallways when I was there (May 2009). I'm sure they have finished by now.Disclaimer: I stayed here 8 years ago! I was driving cross country from LA to NYC with a friend who was moving from coast to coast. We were all about cheap yet interesting accommodations. This was our first night and I don't recall what side we were on but it wasn't luxurious or safe feeling so I am guessing the hostel side. In fact, we moved the room furniture in order to barricade ourselves in. Yes, we were that scared. Young and silly? Probably. Little did we know at the time it wouldn't be the scariest place we stayed during our adventure however. Obviously we survived but from what my hazy memory recalls I wouldn't want to stay there again. But hey, this was 8 years ago so you never know!

Inexpensive | Good location for climbers $If you're visiting El Paso to check out the Hueco Tanks Park, I recommend staying here. It's perfect for your budget. It's quiet, clean, a little dim, but we had no problems. The bathroom is a bit run down, but this place is decent.I recommend this place for any climbers that aren't camping in or near the climbing areas. Staying at this place is about 45 minutes away, near the airport, close to quick shops and good, cheap food, and you get a nice bed and a shower. Can't complain! We took 2 rooms because we went with our friends -- buddied up.We're looking to stay here every year in November for our annual bouldering trip :)This is a pretty cool old joint. Yes, "Old" being the key word. However, it still has everything you need, i.e. internet, HBO, a toilet & a shower! What else do you need? Oh yes, it has a decent bed & the sheets were clean.It's the old school motel where you park right in front of your room & it's under cover as well. So very convenient! And at 45 bucks per night, what more could you want? If just passing through & you need a place to take a load off, this place won't let you down.We were traveling and stayed at a different hotel in El Paso that my husband thought was fine but I found it to be kind of seedy. We found the Coral Motel in the lonely Planet guide and it had decent reviews on Yelp. This place was very clean, and very quiet. Staff was friendly. For a simple motel at a reasonable price, this was perfect and I would stay here again.If you need clean , but outdated , vintage motel - this place for you. A bit laud , in the morning , low clearance rain guards at front doors , so if you have tall truck , ask for height , or park in the middle of parking lot.Well, pricier than expected but very quiet and clean.  Checking in and out was the easiest I've experienced, amenities not existent but honestly; perfect for what we needed.Location was central to everything we did, parking was dedicated for your room and getting in and out of the parking lot was graciously simple.After reading the reviews we stopped and checked in. Good idea for someone who is looking for a clean well kept affordable nights stay. Staff was courteous and amicable. Room was clean. Parking in front if each room has plenty of space. Staff said they shampoo the rugs every 2 weeks and we saw that two were getting done. Safe place to stay. Walking distance from good food as well.If you are looking to spend a night or even a few nights at an affordable, yet clean place this is it. The staff are extremely helpful. I stayed for one night on my way to California. I had a Uhaul with an auto-transporter. The guy who checked me in helped me park the truck and showed me my room. He even turned on ESPN for me. If I'm ever passing through or staying at El Paso for a short period, I'm definitely coming here.Cool "vintage" motel in El Paso. Easy access to freeway, groovy rooms, free parking and internet.If you are looking for a nice hotel: somewhere where you are tempted to lift extra bottles of their free shampoo off the maid cart because they are giving out such quality stuff, the Coral Motel isn't for you.If you like kitsch and need a cheap, safe, comfortable place to stay the Coral Motel is probably a good bet.  There isn't much to the rooms, but they were relatively clean, and the beds (there were two in our room) were comfortable enough.  The shower had good water pressure, though we noticed that both the tub and toilet were very low to the ground.  Odd.  Lots of kitschy, old details too: elaborate headboards, a dial on the door for maid service, nice neon sign outside.  For one of the cheapest places to stay in El Paso, the Coral Motel is a good choice.

hotel_name: La Quinta Inn El Paso - Airport
review_content: Booked a room at this hotel because it was close to the house we were moving into and they accepted pets free of charge. The bed was very comfortable and with it's proximity to a major highway and airport it wasn't too noisy. The room was not satisfactory, especially with the price we were charged. The carpets had stains that were easily removed, there was a bad odor, the toilet had trouble flushing anything solid. The worst part was the shower went from hot to cold several times during a normal 15 minute shower. The traffic to get out isn't that great either. I wouldn't stay here again.Because pictures can say so much more.....no working electric plugs in bathroom...gfi that won't reset....let's go swimming. ......nice parking lot. .....The reviews on this place are very correct. It sucks. It is very dated The attempts at updating and repair are fat short of what could be expected. Who ever is in charge has spent a lifetime receiving participation trophies....and believes just trying is enough. We travel for work and spend a lot of nights in hotels. I am very glad someone else had to pay for our 3 night stay here. I saw that one fellow (in the reviews)offered to pay for your stay if your unhappy.....hope he is rich if he is to be held to his word.Pass on this place....the many unhappy reviews are very spot on.....I edited this to include pictures cause. .  .....they explain the nausea so well.Not this LaQuinta! Even if you've noticed that LaQuinta has slowly declined in quality over the years and you still don't mind, you might want to pass this one up. Myself and a coworker stayed there just recently and both of our sinks and both of our shower tubs were clogged. He also found pubic hair in his sink and, in my room, a prior tenant had apparently knocked over a candle and spilled wax all over the floor and on the side of the box spring. Yes the prices there are quite reasonable, but I think it's time to go Motel 6 instead.The only real negative I had about this hotel was the location was pretty scary- Not far from Juarez. However with that said, the staff was great, the room was nice and the breakfast was one of the better ones we enjoyed on an 8 day trip.The have a roach problem the manger was rude. Charged my credit card many mistakenly times. I tried to talk with the manger about  it he refused to give me what was owed to me. I had to call The corporate office. To get things settled. Would never stay again west side is a better stay. I wouldn't give one star I had to, in order to post the review. I hope they see this review and change things.Room 147 mold smell could choke a cow!Woke up with a headache I got to believe from it.  This is an old road side motel they slapped a coat of paint on.  Stay far away!Was happy to hear about the price. Not happy with two full size beds instead of two queen beds. It's hard when you are coming in from out of town at midnight and you, your spouse, and your baby are tired. Not the best of feeling to open the door and see these beds. Plus,  I did not know that smoking hotels still existed. Then dead bolt did not work either. Im the kind of person who needs to make sure all locks work. Specially when the rooms have an outside door, and it looks like some kicked open the door or something. I always thought La Quinta were nice, but i guess theybare nolonger what they use to be. Other than that the employees were nice and th e rooms were clean. Thanks but no thanksIt's the preferred hotel closest to the east Juarez boarder Toll entrance, it's nice & the employees are very hospitable. 3rd time I've stayed here for several nights and each time resulted in a good nights rest in a none smoking room. Cons: Although I've always booked a smoke free room. They some how manage to put me twice in a room that has a slight hint of cigaret smell lingering all over the room. Pros: After I kindly discussed the discomfort issue with the front desk, they kindly moved me away from the smoking side, to a completely none smelly room. Without any hassle what so ever.Pros: I noticed they allow pets to stay at the hotel as well. I saw several people with dogs. Good to know!Pros: They have a nice size pool to do back and forth laps in. Pros:  They have a small Gym room with several treadmills, Bike, elliptical, etc...Pros:  They have free breakfast. It's so worth it!On my last trip I forgot my $80 memory foam pillow and didn't notice until the next day. I called 2 days later and they said they will check the lost and found & with the maids and call me back. Pros:  They found my pillow and the manager mailed it back to me, free of charge!  (I live in San Diego)I'll most likely use this place for every business trip I take. And refer friends too.We had no intentions of staying here, but we got stranded in El Paso when the car rental place had no cars (!?). We called to get a shuttle from the airport and it came quickly.  The people checking us in were very friendly.  Especially Clint, who helped me deal with Expedia to cancel the other reservation we couldn't get to.If only the quality of the room matched the quality of the people here.  The room itself was nothing special but was clean.  The sheets were fresh and the bed was comfy.  We were pretty happy until we saw the bathroom.  The bathroom could have used some bleach and I'm not sure how, but there were black scuff marks on the side of the tub.  Overall, it was a fair experience.  I'd be willing to give it another try because the staff was so great.Doesn't deserve a star! Was given a smoking room after I requested a nonsmoking room and after walking into the room, being surrounded the smell of smoke, seeing cigarettes in the ash tray and the nasty filth all over the room I returned to the front desk. When I walked in to the front desk and said "Yeah, that room won't work. I need a nonsmoking room or I can go somewhere else." I was told that if I didn't leave that the cops would be called and I would be removed and still charged for the room. If you want to be lied to, stolen from per say, sleep in filth, then this place is for you. Other than that.....stay away from here!We had just driven 14 hours from Los Angeles and checked in at 9:30 and went straight to our room. As we opened the door, the air conditioner was on, but the room was hot and stuffy.  We figured it may have just been turned on recently, so we gave it some time.  It never cooled down.  We called the front desk and they said they would send maintenance up to check.  We waited an hour and nobody came.  Called again to ask when maintenance was coming and they said "Oh, he just went home for the day."  We requested another room, but because there was a music fest in town, they were entirely booked, but tried to offer us a $10 discount. We tried to tough it out and sleep in the room.  About 3:30 in the morning we awoke to several 20-somethings outside talking/laughing loudly outside our room.  This went on for at least half an hour until we couldn't take it anymore and my wife got up to ask them to keep it down.  At this point we were wide awake and decided to leave less than 7 hours after check in.  I don't know if this is a common occurrence at this place or not, but we will never go back.  They did refund our money for the night though.  I suppose that's something at least.  They should have only booked the music fest people on one side of the building and left the other side for reservations and walk ins.  I feel sorry for anyone who was actually trying to sleep in the hotel that night.Looks can be deceiving but in this case they're right on. I might stay here again but it's not one of my favorite stops along the way. I especially didn't enjoy the dumpster pickup at 7 am. You can see Juarez, Mexico, murder capital of the world, from the southern rooms. It will probably make you not want to spend much time on the outside of your room, though I didn't feel particularly unsafe. The room was a half step above a Motel 6.  The 20% discount at Denny's next door was nice. That's a noticeable discount. Lots of shopping nearby (by car). Lobby seemed nice.we called in advance cause my husband and i were going to be doing a 13 hour drive through the desert.... we wanted to make sure that even though we were arriving late (around 4:30AM) that we would still have our room once we arrived and a late checkout the next day.  Once we arrived the guy at the counter told me we didn't have a reservation. and that we never called... being absolutely EXHAUSTED... this did not help my increasingly waning mood.  He spent 20 minutes tippity typing on the computer, and telling me that we were a "no-show", and that they don't have late checkouts. FOR REAL?!! Anyway... eventually we got our room... but after the day we had, we did NOT want to deal with douche bag mcgee at the front desk. Room was ok. Service... blah.ADDENDUM:  WE DID A SURVEY ABOUT OUR STAY, AND BECAUSE OF OUR RATING, THE GENERAL MANAGER REVIEWED THE TAPE OF OUR CHECK-IN, AND ISSUED US A COMPLETE REFUND FOR OUR TROUBLE... CAN YOU BELIEVE IT??? AMAZING!!

I came into town for work. My room was very good. The hotel is very nice. Plenty of parking and it's very safe.I ate at the restaurant and had three drinks. Service was excellent.I'm from Los Angeles so I know good Mexican food. I've also traveled throughout Mexico. The salsa is better than my mom makes--I couldn't get enough of it The ribeye steak was acceptable. But I kept going back to the salsa and Long Island Ice-T's.It was too cold to use the pool although I thought about itI would most certainly stay here againThe service was excellent but both the front desk and in the restaurant and barGreat place to stay in El Paso.Friendly helpful staff. Clean rooms. Quiet and card-gated for additional security. Little extras like a charging port to recharge assorted devices together on one desk instead of the typical scattering throughout room seeking plugs for multiple items. Close to the Interstate but to my relief, although I was on an outer perimeter, I heard NO Interstate, parking lot or noise from other guests. My room had a refrigerator to store my travel snacks and water. Breakfast was included and offered hot selections such as eggs sausage and oatmeal, plus a nice assortment of fruit, cereal and breads. I even grabbed ice and coffee to go.They even offer room service. I glanced at the menu and saw a decent selection had I wanted something. I wished I hadn't checked in right after eating because they had an apple cranberry chicken salad that would have settled better than the Truck Stop junk I wolfed down in the car shortly before stopping.I was absolutely thrilled with my stay and will definitely stay here when traveling between Austin and Phoenix.Worst hotel stay I've had in a while. Family of 4 in double bed room, found out all they have are full size beds (according to call with front desk)...my wife and I can, and have managed on a queen before but a full is ridiculous. They were also very stiff and uncomfortable beds...my kids tossed and turned all night. I travel a lot and don't expect a ton from hotel rooms, but I'll definitely not stay here again.It didn't help that there were no additional bedding or pillows in the room and only a single set of towels total; this is simple stuff the room should come with.Country Inn & Suites has quickly become one of my favorite hotel chains! I so enjoyed my recent stays here on a road trip to Los Angeles. This location in particular has a southwestern villa style to it which adds some local charm. I love the organization of the buildings and rooms so you're not directly next to someone else. The rooms are staggered in a way so it feels like you're in a private cabin. The beds are SO big and SO comfortable. Each room has a couch or lounge chair along with a desk + office chair. The rooms are very modern and clean.Free WiFi and free breakfast! The WiFi here was always spot on and fast. The breakfast was better than most hotels. Scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, potatoes, fruit, toast, the whole nine yards. The eggs could use some improvement - they were pretty runny and seemed like they must add milk to make them more fluffy, much to my chagrin. During breakfast they have several 'servers' passing through ready to bring you anything that's missing and it's also implied that you should tip after your meal, even though it's 'free'. The front desk service here is superb! We ended up signing up for a Carlson rewards card. Would definitely recommend staying here if you're in El Paso!This hotel was a decent value: $80/night (plus the unavoidable $13 tax, fee, tourist blah blah charges/night). $280 for 3 nights. The hotel offers a 24/7 Shuttle which was offered to us, but didn't take, because I have great relatives willing to cart us around!The location was excellent for us: Right off I-10, 1.7 miles to Sunland Park Casino, 5-10 minutes to Downtown (we arrived in El Paso by train). The airport was 25 minutes away (we picked up a rental car). Nearly every fast food chain is nearby, as well as one of the better malls, Sunland Park Mall. We didn't partake of the bar (closed at 10 pm on Saturday night) nor Room Service (4pm-10pm only). We didn't need housekeeping either, but of course, still left a gratuity. We're pretty low maintenance travelers. The security here is good requiring a room key card for access to the property. Our room must have been recently renovated because there was a slight smell of fresh paint. No worries for us there. The decor was new and modern. The beds and pillows were very comfy. They seemed new. The bathroom was sparkling clean and likewise seemed newly spiffed up. We did have a blow dryer, but didn't use it. The complimentary toiletries were numerous (the usual items plus mouthwash, make up removal towelletes, lotions, etc.). The complimentary breakfast had hot items (scrambled eggs, potatoes, bacon, biscuits and gravy one day of three, waffles, oatmeal), mini breads/pastries, cereal and beverages in a very nice, large, bright lobby area. We tipped $3 for each of us each time we ate. This breakfast was a great start each day for us. Wifi in our room (building 8) was excellent enough for us to do our company employee payroll online. The 40-50 cable channels on the 40-inch flatscreen were adequate for us. Parking near our room was perfect; about 20 steps. Towels were plentiful enough for the two of us. The coffee maker, microwave and a bigger than average room fridge were perfect. We saw an iron, but no ironing board. We didn't have a room safe. There was no writing pad or pen. None of these things were an issue to us, but may be to some. Our stay was generally excellent, but I took away a star for the following:The room lighting could have used one more lamp. The ice machine closest to our room wasn't working so we had to find an operational one. The porch light was out, the duration of our stay. And finally, it was a bit of a maze to get to the Lobby from our room. The assisting signage is fine for daytime, but can be problematic at night. Overall, we would absolutely stay here for the same rate!I searched for a good deal during our trip from San Diego to San Antonio and I came across this place. I read some other reviews and compared them with a few other reviews across the way and down the street. Praying to find a decent place to rest. I found this place. We checked in at the front lobby and I admit, it looked very nice! We headed for the room twisting through the maze of hall ways a bit confused after driving for so many hours, we finally found the room. We were pleasantly surprised when we walked in the room. It smelled and looked clean. The bedding was fresh and fairly new. The bed was comfortable and I liked the pillows. The mini fridge was turned down too low. I turned it up full temp and by morning my ice tea was almost frozen. Since it was 45 degrees out this Dec. 20th. We turned the heater on. It worked great pumping out plenty of heat. The only problem was that it was kinda loud and I am a medium to light sleeper. I did manage to sleep for 6 hours before it woke me up which is pretty good for me. We called for guest services and they arrived within minutes. Great service! Very prompt. I am Feeling satisfied with this stop. I would recommend it. Room 4201 was good besides the small trek from the car. Happy camping!! Hotels.com $71 for a Saturday night.We stayed one night during a road trip from Los Angeles to Austin and were SO happy to have found this place. It was $79 a night including a pet fee for our cat. We got a king bed that was unbelievably comfortable and exactly what we needed after 12 hours of driving. The lobby area is really fancy and newly remodeled; they said earlier in 2015 it was completely re-done. The rooms as well. I don't know what they looked like before but they are top notch now. The check-in staff were really friendly. We didn't use the pool or gym but they both look top notch as well. We will recommend Country Inn to anyone stopping through El Paso and we will certainly stay here again.We checked in after driving all day, we checked in around 8pm. Front desk and lobby were excellent. We got our keys and headed to our rooms and everything was fine. We decided to order food around 850pm. The front desk clerk told us the kitchen closed at 10pm, so we ordered something simple. we got our food at 1050pm. They told us that there was a party done stairs, after we called and asked where was our food was. We order mac and cheese and shrimp pasta, once again something simple because we knew the kitchen would be closing soon. not only did the order come late, they didn't give us forks!!! we had spoons!! for linguine!! why would you do that? anyway,the guy had to go back and get it, he came back 15 mins later!!! He was very short with us, as if he was mad that we had called back to ask for such a thing. He handled me my receipt and got out of dodge.There was also 1 towel in the bathroom. No rag, no soap.Also for those who bring an apple tv or ps4, just know the tv won't switch to any other inputs, unless you UNHOOK the cable coax.Internet is horrible, i just stayed at the radisson where it was phenomenal, and after reading reviews here i was thinking it would be very similar, but boy oh boy was i wrong. I will never stay here again. I would rate it a one star, but the bartender was awesome and the front desk clerk was on point, but overall,this place left a sour taste in my mouth. Don't stay unless you have too, at least at the el paso in texas.Not happy at all. Internet connection is extremely slow, food was delivered hour and a half after was ordered, was brought without forks and napkins soaking in the sauce. We were still charged for a food. They gave us "complimentary" sloppy joes because of that, but they were spicy and too saulty, we couldn't even eat them (Outstanding Staff. Great price $80+taxes. Free breakfast. Manager's special 6-7 PM. One of a kind high end Country InnWhat a beautifully appointed well run hotel.. The renovations are fantastic and the service impeccable.Full service with 3 meal restaurant and a lounge. complimentary WiFi and hot breakfast served on real china not styrofoam. I'll be back!The location is about 8 miles from downtown El Paso and sits right on Interstate 10. The area is safe and suburb like with a nearby mall and restaurants. We arrived at 11am on a Sunday thinking there was no way we were going to get an early check in, but they accommodated us. The lobby is newly renovated and modern. Free continental breakfast and the lobby does have a bar. The rest of the hotel is divided into sections, some of which you have to drive your car to. All rooms have an outside door. No elevators. This was a struggle trying to carry two 50 pound suitcases up a flight of stairs. The rooms do look a lot better on the website but they are remodeled and fairly clean. The noise level is quiet for being next to the Interstate but you hear every door slam from other nearby rooms. The bed was comfy and I appreciated the nice shower and good water pressure. The price was right at under $100 a night and I would stay again.We loved our stay here. The price was right. The location was great with many convenient stores near by. Located near the freeway, but you'd never know it because it was very quiet. Didn't like being put upstairs but, meh. The A/C worked great! Since the hotel is non smoking, a suggestion I would make would be to put cigarette containers outside, or you'll end up with butts everywhere or worse people putting them out on the walls outside. Just preventive maintenance. Another suggestion would be to make sure the housekeepers wipe doors down and check the recliners for cleaning. They are doing a great job otherwise because the room was very clean! The carpet was very clean to the naked eye. We will be back!!Having traveled to Louisiana and back to California this has been the best place we've stayed at. It's amazing really nice and comfortable and the staff is really nice and accommodating. Would definitely recommend to others traveling through this part of town.From the moment we walked to the front desk we were treated as valued guests. The room was comfortable and spacious. Slept soundly in the king size bed. Also, we ate a filling dinner in the restaurant. Fish and chips (or sweet potato fries in my case) which was delicious. And my husband had a jalapeno burger and fries that he stated was great too. Would stay here again.Appeared nice from the outside but beware not to get stuck with room not renovated as I just did. A/C doesn't blow cold air, TV screen is wavering, room carpet has major stains. Also room did not have shampoo or conditioner. Found empty bottle of Ensure on nightstand as well. Will be taking with the front deskThe most amazing secret paradise in El Paso!!!! The hotel is amazing... Like being at a resort! Beautiful landscaping... Gorgeous rooms...and fantastic resort style pool!!! Food is phenomenal!!! Added bonus... margaritas are delicious!!! Stay here!!! Exit 13 off of I10!!!

While I was reading the Yelp reviews when I was staying here, I had to double-check the address to make sure I was in the same place. Wow, I thought this Holiday Inn was pretty cool.There are three blocks of the usual mid-level name brand hotels facing this stretch of I-10 & the airport, and I'm guessing they must do those weird hotel shuffle things, when one place completely exchanges their building & identity with another. You know, when you come back a year later and go, "Huh?"In any case, this particular Holiday Inn sure looked like the newest building on the block to me - big, bright, cheery, a happy staff, and an immaculate room with a really comfortable bed. And that's just frosting, because my cake is all about the big three for free: Parking, WiFi, and a hot breakfast that won't make me puke. It's how I filter my hotel searches online. And among the five hotels that popped up for this unexpected overnighter in El Paso, this place also had the best price, using my Triple-A card. And there's a 24-hour Taco Cabana & Walgreen's in the same parking lot. I'm pretty much a fan of "Score!"The staff at this hotel is exceptional, they go out of their way to accommodate your needs to make your stay comfortable.The rooms are spotless as well as the hotel. Not in airport but 2 miles away. On highway so ask for a higher floor.Hotel was nice... But...Breakfast staff was rude. Found used lube in my friends room. NASTY!!! When they went down to complain "the only thing they could do for them was to reimburse them $25." Took over an hour to get towels sent to our room. Shower went ice cold halfway though my shower. Was told I couldn't get a room key because "they had ran out." I had called and asked if they could send someone up to clean our room around 3pm (was told they would send staff up to do so) then called to confirm sending someone an hour later (was told again they would send someone) returned to my room 2 hours later to find out no one had done so. When I went down to ask the manager about it he informed me they had sent their cleaning staff home at 2:30.Definitely not worth paying the $136 a night. Won't be staying here again.This Holiday Inn is conveniently located 10 minutes from the airport.  It's freeway location made it easy to spot from a distance. I walked through the front doors and was greeted by friendly hotel clerks. The decorations inside resembled classic Spanish style buildings with a full lounge area and bar. The pool and gym were inside the main entrance of the hotel. Once inside the room, it was obvious they took great care of the rooms. I normally find that hotels have a funny smell but my room smelled fresh.  On day two I went to the gym and found two treadmills, an elliptical machine and a set of weights. Small but adequate.  The customer service was average. There was nothing that stood out. Overall a good experience.This hotel is decent enough but they have insanely loud music every night until 2 am. I couldn't sleep. Tonight the have a full on DJ in the lobby... It's literally like having a room at a nightclub. We got our money back and went to a nearby hotel. Would never, ever come back here.This is strictly based on their customer service for reservations.  I called in today to the 800 number to set a reservation for hubby's bowling tournament going on there at the El Paso Convention Center this year.  I asked if there was a bowlers discount and the young man told me I had to call to the El Paso Holiday Inn directly.  Broken English but understandable however he kept interrupting me.  Called the Holiday Inn directly in El Paso, must have been busy because I waited on hold for a while however that I can get over.  Young lady named Suzanna answered.  Sounded young and unsure of herself.  I let her know the dates we were coming and that we were there for the USBC Nationals and asked if there were discounts for the bowlers.  She fumbled verbally at me then asked me for my phone number and said someone would get back to me in 5 minutes.  That was 2 1/2 hours ago.  We called Ramada, spoke with Arturo (excellent and very helpful) got our room booked with everything we need as well as getting a very nice little discount.Do not be fooled. The way the hotel looks from the outside is nothing how the rooms are. From the outside this hotel looks nice and modern, but the rooms are old and not very nice. Lets put it this way, the thermostat in the room was probably older then I am. When I arrived the room had cigarette butts on the floor and stunk like cigarette (in a hotel that is supposed to be smoke free). The decor is just so outdated and old fashioned. There are many other hotels in El Paso that are less expensive and have a lot nicer rooms. On the positive side the manager is really nice and was very helpful with everything, it's not her fault the hotel rooms haven't been renovated. The lobby is also very nice and there is a bar inside.Am currently staying here on business. I am very happy with the suite room, it's spacious and well-equipped with a microwave, mini-fridge, and individual coffeemaker. King size bed is one of the most comfortable hotel beds I've ever slept in. HUGE HD TV in the room. Internet can be spotty.Join the Priority Club for Holiday Inn and get free breakfast buffet or 2 free drinks daily. Close to major highways and many restaurants. The restaurant in the hotel has fantastic service and the food is fairly tasty for a hotel restaurant.Only downfall is the presence of Teddy's Flame Room downstairs, which can attract some interesting clientele, but fortunately I am staying on the opposite side of the hotel from it, so it hasn't affected my stay too much. Staff has been attentive and maid service has been more than adequate.This was nice. Staff cool (meaning not overly friendly but sufficiently helpful and available). Better said, The room I stayed in was nice. No complaints. It was clean, cool, smelled nice... everything you expect from a $100+ per night hotel room. But I don't remember breakfast being memorable. (That could be a good thing...)pet friendlystaff provided me with current promos. very informative and pleasant.received free vouchers for drinks at the barplenty of free bottled water.inexpensive stayThis is really a little above your average Holiday Inn.  This is not an express so the establishments got its own charm!!  Right behind a Starbucks too, so that's gotta be some extra brownie points!!  But the rooms were nice, it fit the price, they had a nice pool.  They gave me free booze all week so that in its own is 4 stars!!  In other words, other then it being in El Paso, Texass...  it was a comfortable stay!!  Recommended, indeed!I went here and lasted 5 minutes.Totally NOT for me..lol. Everytime I think about that place I hear Missy Elliot's " Get your freak on" playing in my head.Good place to stay, fast check-in and check out. HD TV with HBO, Discovery, ESPN and other channels in every room. Streaming videos on demand. Clean room, clean beds, overall a good place to stay. Starbucks right next door.Very nice hotel! The lobby and other common areas were very clean and bright. The front desk staff was very attentive and friendly.Make sure you tell the front desk people how often you want your bed sheets changed. I stayed three nights and my bed linens were never changed. When I asked at the front desk about this, they said it was the guest's responsibility to request fresh linen.Don't go out for breakfast. Have it at their breakfast buffet. It's not the least expensive breakfast but the food is awesome! Everything is fresh and the service is great. For your entertainment, there's a lobby bar and Teddy's Lounge is connected to the hotel. They were doing karaoke the night I visited. There's also a Starbucks next to the property - an easy walk.Need to read something "bad"? The ice machine on my floor didn't work. The wall paper in my room had a huge rip in it. This is definitely a great place to stay!This place was terrible, the only redeeming quality was the shuttle driver. Too expensive to get a place with stains on the hallway carpet, molding coming off the baseboards and an awful smell outside the hotel.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express & Suites El Paso Airport
review_content: Literally so happy we decided to stay here. They have this Monday night football social with cold cuts, chips, and lemonade. After a long trip, it was so nice to just come in, fix a sandwich, and head to bed. The room was very clean and the beds were comfortable.The staff is amazingly sweet! Valerie, the director of sales, was so nice. She took time to tell us about spots to visit in the town and was just overall super hospitable. We plan on staying here again for sure!All I can say is WOW I stayed here 3 nights. I hesitated to stay at a express but man I'm glad I did.  From Friday 19-21 it was nothing short of comfort. The person that was preparing the breakfast he was so helpful so friendly and suggested some pretty awesome places to go and to eat. Adrian at the front desk make sure all our needs were met. I thought I was a model show because the people here are all well very attractive. And yet their hospitality was top-notch. Management at this hotel is doing something right and I hope he/she does not stop. I've stayed at some pretty nice places including Fifth Avenue in New York and I have never come across such clean, friendly staff at a hotel. Keep up the great work!I highly recommend this hotel its new its clean and the staff is very friendly!! There is a restaraunt an bar onsite so you dont have to look far for food if your from out of town! I think the price for this hotel is well worth the stay!! In fact its a steal of a deal!! Ask for Jessica or Mary they are the best!!!Very impressed with this hotel. At the price I expected a lower standard but pleasantly surprised with the cleanliness, accomidations, included breakfast, and the comforts afforded to higher costing hotels.First time staying here. When I checked in it took a while because the guy was new and he tried to tell me I had to pay more when I already had a locked in reservation with a certain rate. He told me I needed to speak with a manager in the morning about it. I can go on about some of the comments he made such as eluding to me "smuggling in a pet" after he told me about the no pet policy and I told him that I did not have a pet with me. The next morning I spoke wisdom wine else who took care of it so no biggie. The toilet in my room (402) felt unstable. The sheets on the bed are relatively thin and the housekeeping staff sometimes play loud music in the morning so on the one day of my work week where I could sleep until 8 it was ruined. But 4 stars because the staff were all friendly, professional, and courteous. The free hot breakfast has a variety of hot and cold options. The dining area is clean, spacious and inviting. The gym is 24/7, small but clean and have a variety of cardio machines and a few free weights. Nothing fancy but it gets the job done. The airport is about 1.5 miles away approx 8 minute drive. There is a hotel shuttle and apparently it goes other places than the airport. I took the shuttle to the airport for my departure and there were two gentleman on there who were going to Best Buy so there must be a radius. I was displaced from my coworkers on this trip due to last minute reservations so this place is not my first option but if I had to stay here again, I would. There is no nice welcome for being an IGH member like with HiltonHonors but.... oh well the free breakfast makes up for it to me LOLClose to airport. Large dining room for continental breakfast. Suite rooms are very nice. Rooms are clean beds are comfy and every thing is in great shape. Kitchen living room and bathroom are all in great shape and clean. If I ever fly in here again I will definitely stay hereMy wife and I were supposed to be driving through El Paso to get back home to San Antonio but had to stop here and stay the night as a winter storm had made road conditions dangerous along I-10 in Ft. Stockton. Checked in late and for only one night but everything was comfortable and clean. Attentive front desk staff, security guard walking the premises and a helpful breakfast crew. The room was just adequate but the bed was very comfortable and that is really all I care about on an overnight stay. Checked in, slept, ate breakfast, and then left. Good experience overall and price seemed comparable to other area hotels according to Priceline.Clear, comfortable, standard Holiday Inn Express. You know what to expect and they don't disappoint. No restaurants within walking distance, and the airport shuttle and breakfast operate late on weekend mornings, (had to get a cab to the airport for a 6am flight). Still, more than adequate. Note that rooms on the north end have a lot of highway noise,Exceptional customer service and great breakfast!  The room itself is quite clean and has everything one might need except a fridge.  Wish we had te to check out the pool though (7am-10pm operation times)Nice hotel. I am a raving fan of Holiday Inn and I will say the service I received as a late arrival was great. The rooms are clean, building is clean and I will stay here again. Breakfast is your typical pre-processed food but the coffee was fresh. I have no issues with this location and would recommend to the traveling family or business traveler.I had a good experience here, but its a Holiday Inn Express, so how high can you really rate it? Breakfast starts at 6:30, which is a bit late for me. Much of the breakfast food is pre-processed. There is no restaurant or bar.Recently constructed, so it looks new and clean everywhere.So far so good! Rooms are nice the pool is clean and the service is with a very nice smile. Im happy!So clean! We would definitely stay her again.

We have stayed here many times, and have been happy.  The rooms are spacious, with a kitchenette.  The rooms are usually clean, but if the are not they will find you another room.  If you are nice to them they will be nice to you.  It is not as close to the border as people have said, please don't get the wrong idea.  Yes, it is very close to the freeway. But most of the rooms are quiet.we have never had any problems here, and sometimes we have a trailer full of stuff.  The hot tub is usually enjoyable. But we usually avid the pool, because it is too cold for my liking.  The breakfast is enjoyable.Very good quality room for $60/night. We truthfully didn't expect much, but were pleasantly surprised. (Arrived on 5/8/15, departed 5/9/15). The hotel is not located in too great of an area, its right near the border, so we didn't venture around too much at night time.The room was spacious and didn't feel cramped. We stayed in a non-smoking room which included a King-sized bed, kitchenette (equipped with an electric two-burner stove, sink, full size refrigerator and freezer, microwave, and coffee maker), dining table, living room area, a large flat-screen TV, and a nice bathroom.We settled in our room and everything seemed to be in working order until we tried to use the stove. The burners would not work. We called the front desk (around 10pm) and they came to take a look at our stove. The front desk employee told us he would need to contact his maintenance guy and come back to try and get it fixed. We waited about 20 minutes before the same front desk employee (not maintenance) came. We were a little puzzled that he was the one doing the fixing, but he ended up getting the burners to work. For some reason, they were not connected.... strange. But nevertheless, our problem was taken care of.Everything else in the room was fully functional. The kitchenette does not include any dishes or silverware, but I think they are available upon request, although, I am not certain of this. (*Please double check with them directly, if this is important to you!) We brought our own, just in case. The shower/bathtub was a good size and there were plenty of towels in the room. The flat screen TV was very clear and had a lot of different channels to choose from. I liked how the TV could be moved around on the mount so you can view it from all areas of the room. The King bed was very comfortable and we woke up well rested.Our stay included complimentary breakfast, which is offered between 6-9am (I think?) in a small room located across from the front desk in their main lobby. Once again, we weren't expecting a whole lot of choices, but there were proved wrong again! They had Yoplait yogurts in various flavors, small danishes, bagels and cream cheese, muffins, oatmeal, eggs, and you could even make your own waffles. For drinks, you had a choice of orange juice, cranberry juice cocktail, coffee, or tea. We enjoyed our breakfast!The only thing that put a damper on our stay was the attitude of the girl working the front desk that morning. We had a little confusion at check-out about whether our AAA discount could be applied to our stay. I mentioned her that I had contacted someone at the front desk the day before and they ensured me that the discount could be applied. She said that she had no idea and that I would have to call Wyndham directly to find out. I asked her if she had that phone number and she shrugged her shoulders and was absolutely no help. I was irritated that she didn't even try to address the issue or look into the situation. So instead of leaving on a happy note, we left frustrated.BUT, for the most part, we liked this place.We stayed 2 nights here and received the worst customer service EVER.... Stayed in a room which the lock on the door was broken, hole in the wall where door hits by the front door, rips in the furniture, missing picture on the wall, broken baby glass food container in the fridge and to top it off the front desk lady was accusing us to have done all this and was rude about giving us a new room... I will never ever EVER stay here or any other Ramada ever again. People here hate their job and you can tell. What a waste of money.We really enjoyed our stay at this property, rooms were well kept and staff was courteous and helpful. They are also pet friendly, which is a huge plus especially in the El Paso area.I will definitely stay here again.This place was alright. I stayed for one night and it was just okay. The rooms look like they were trying to be renovated, but it was a major fail. Granite countertops with peeling paint on the walls along with little nicks and holes. The front desk didn't seem welcoming, but like I said, I only stayed here for one night. Oh, also the side of the hotel I was placed on is directly next door to the Harley Davidson store so there was quite a bit of noise.... And the hotel is located right off the freeway on a busy Main Street. They do serve a continental breakfast but didn't stay long enough. I left b4 the sun came up. Would only come here again if I have to.Room itself was nice, but the grounds and area left something to be desired. There was a gym, but the door didn't close properly leaving the cold air (34 degrees  outside) to blow in. Yes, a gym should be kept cool, but that's a bit much. Many men hanging out and/wandering around. One asked me which room I was in and what I was doing for the evening--i gave him a look and he didn't ask again. A couple of them were watching my car with such interest that I moved it. Did not feel safe. Breakfast was a so-so continental one, but its free.Thanks ramada. I never understood, how you can be so lazy to just leave the body's after killing them. Really hit the spot. So very disappointing. Please keep a cleanse environment.We stayed here 02-07-15. I thought it was in a bit of a sketchy area when we arrived but we had no issues. The room was just okay overall. It was very spacious. The TV had something wrong with it. We asked to be moved & an employee swiveled the tv and fixed the picture sort of. It would still go in and out. Room 208 needs a new TV. The kitchenette was nice, but had no pots, dishes or silverware. The fan in the bathroom made a loud obnoxious noise. The bed was comfortable though. The noise levels were minimal. Not a bad place to stay if you have a budget.Bedbugs make for a bad nights sleep and the breakfasts leave much to be desired.  The beds are hard but you get used to them.  This is definitely a two star motel.What a dump.   I'm traveling from AZ to San Antonio, TX and decided to stay here the night.  It sits on a loud road.  When I was given my first room, it smelled so foul.  Then I tried to turn on the lights and half of them didn't work.  The TV screen was fine on 30% of the screen and 70% looked like an invasion from Mars.  The bed was uncomfortable and the pillows and sheets were incredibly cheap.  The shower was grotesque but the water pressure was great.  Honestly, the only reason to come here is the rate--$80.  I don't know why, but in El Paso, hotels that are normally quite inexpensive are expensive and this was the only place that didn't cost around $150.  I would have been happy to pay an extra $70 for a nicer experience.Clean. A good value for what you pay. The service left a lot to be desired. But that might be the norm for the area. The options to here are $10 less but this place was worth the extra $10.  the only problem we has was that when we arrived a few hours early to check in they charged me $20.  Overall it was a good experienceRooms are nice & super clean. Comes with coffee in room & kitchen with stove top an large fridge, huge bed, couch. and its pet friendly !  We had been driving all night and they let us check in early, which was nice of them. Continental breakfast was empty by 9 am and they didn't put out anymore wafffles :''''(. Great experience tho, especially for the price.People with disabilities, beware! I checked out both 'accessible' rooms and they were identical: door keys refused to work, toilets were small & not ADA-acceptable. Bathroom space was SMALL. The two ice machines are outside at the far ends of the parking lot and one was broken (Mexico's border is very close so wandering around the parking lot looking for ice was not my favorite thing to do at 10 PM). The room was clean and cheap (82.00), but we wouldn't stay here again.Well here is my update on our stay at the Ramada El Paso.  I can not say how surprised we were!  The king room was fabulous.  Clean, homey feeling.  Smelled wonderful when we walked in.  Almost felt like a studio apartment really.  Had a nice sitting area with a couch and the flat screen TV could be angled to face the couch or the bed.  Fridge and freezer, two burner stove, 4 cup coffee maker with coffee provided, creamer and sugar as well as 2 paper cups, nice size vanity with good lighting, microwave, hair dryer.  Our remote wasn't working properly and we needed some extra towels and those were both taken care of promptly after a call to the desk.  The complimentary breakfast was so much more than just the typical muffin and coffee.  Choice of yogurts, muffins, danish, bagels & cream cheese, waffles, eggs, coffee, tea, orange and apple juice and a few more items.  Took advantage of the hot tub and after a long drive that was a nice treat.  Swimming pool was not heated and it was just a bit chilly for a dip but on a hot summer day it would be great.  Our only complaint and it's not really a complaint was the young gal at the desk.  Not very personable.  Very business like, which in most cases is a good thing, but no smile or friendly attitude.  Did nothing wrong so I can't fault her in her ability to do her job but a friendly disposition would have been nice after a 1200 mile trip in.  Same goes for the gentleman checking us out.  Professional attitude but not very friendly.  My husband put it like this ::  "It was as if we were bothering them."  Again not a big deal since we enjoyed our stay in all other aspects.  So for $59 a night I would HIGHLY recommend this Ramada.Wow - what a hidden gem in El Paso.  I've stayed at several places in the El Paso area over the years and all but one was $40 or so more per night and only half as nice.  I'm super impressed with the nice room layout, full kitchen area and the nice sleeper sofa would be great if I ever had more family along.Really enjoyed my stay here.  Very reasonably priced for what you get.  It had a full kitchen with large refrigerator and stove, table and chairs.Arrived in El Paso after a 4 hour drive from Albuquerque around 9:30pm. Wasn't expecting much considering what I paid for. But, when I opened the door to the room I was surprised how nice it was. Kitchen, little living room area with a couch, and a brand new bathroom. You could smell the newness in the air. The shower was so relaxing and comfortable. I love this hotel. Wish I didn't only stay for a night.Not a picky guy and in the military, but this hotel had hairs allover the bed/pillows (not ours!), it was disgusting. I called in and told them about it, so they moved us to another room and there still hairs (fewer) in the bed. We just decided to stay since were so tired and got there at 9pm. I drove 8+ hours and before that I woke up at 5am to go to work. Good thing is we brought our own bed sheets/blankets/pillows for the long trip from Fort Hood to Las Vegas. If you don't plan on bringing your own bed sheets, you can call the front desk and ask them. Ill give them a 3 star, because even though there were hairs in the bed, they still were nice and tried to move us to a cleaner room. We reserved online and paid $59 for a night with free breakfast.Worst experience of our 15 day road tripArrived 3/29/2013, departed 3/30/2013.We booked a non-smoking king, accessible.  Room 126 had the non-smoking sign ripped off the door and the room had been smoked in very recently.  We moved to 159 that had no towels.  At about midnight, sewerage boiled up in the bathtub creating a couple of inches of, well, you know.  My wife called the office.  The girl said she would call the manager and we could move to another room.  There were no other accessible king rooms.  We waited to see if the effluent would drain and it, eventually, did.  We finished the night.The female who handled the checkout came just short of calling us liars.  She took our number and said she'd have the manager call.  I will not hold my breath.  Regardless, the conditions and treatment remove Ramada from any future travel plans.Ok first of all the sign says Ramada .....  Don't let that fool you cuz this is ghetto Ramada.  Thank god I brought my gun or we would have had to have taken turns "on watch duty"  upon driving in, going to check in to our room all seemed ok  so far so good  got to the room which appearance seemed ok  the problem is all the occupants (and/ or residence) seemed to be hookers and/pimps and drug addicts/dealer lurking around in the darkness.  We literally had to arm ourself (bring a gunfire all u non gun people) just to get ice  I haven't seen any bugs but I assure u a thorough search was made by the Gf.  So lesson learned just becuz there is a good name on the sign doesn't mean it lives up to standards. Hell for all I know they stole the sign ......All I can say is gun at bedside round in chamber sleeping just fine tonight.
review_content_20: Besides the one roach on the floor, I don't think it's so bad. Cheap, 32" Tv, kitchen area, nice size rooms. Bring your own covers and pillow, just in case.Where to begin. Pulling up to the hotel it looked nice and the lobby looked fancy. Our first issue was the clerk needed to stop while checking us in to answer the phone. Apperantly it was someone that just checked in and was not happy the pool was closed even though it was advertised as being open and heated. The clerk was very rude in the way he handled the situation and I gathered from the converation the person was going to checkout and leave. As we got to our room we could see the age of the building and how the older exterior was painted over without being repaired. The steps are old and need to be replaced, you can see the age in the wood. Our room looks ok but the floor is as bumpy and uneven as a fairground fun house. There is actually a spot in front of the sink that feels rotted. The bathroom is so small you have to step around the toilet to open and close the door. The cleaning staff speak no english. We were trying to ask for a new do not disturb sign because ours blew off and in trying to point at what we needed she was going to use her key just to let us in a random room. Lastly, the first night, there was a bunch of people partying out in the parking lot at 11pm and then the next day there were people having arguments in the parking lot for a good part of the afternoon that just left an uneasy feeling with us. Oh and the sink was stopped up.

review_content: Stayed one night on my way to San Antonio. Nice clean accommodations. Quiet and relaxing. Breakfast was delicious as always. Residence inn never fails to impress!!!I always try to find the best things to say about people but in this case there are no words which can positively describe this experience. It's late and we drove from Houston TX heading back home to the Central Coast, CA. Decided to snag a Hotwire hotel deal for the night which offers super great rates (using them since 2004) Upon arrival the front desk was unmanned. We waited 17 min for the receptionist to show up. When she walked down the hall no explanation or concern was given for her absence. I advised we booked a Hotwire deal and her attitude was as if I kicked her in the back. She was abrupt, didn't smile, and refused to offer a room with two beds verses a bed and sofa bed. After 40 min of trying to reason with her I finally called Hotwire and the representative there found her so unreasonable that he canceled my reservation out of frustration (he called her and they went back and forth for about 15min trying to convince her she has the power to make the change).Finally once the reservation was canceled we walked across the parking lot to holiday inn where we were welcomed with smiles and laughs (see my review) I DO NOT under ANY circumstance recommend this hotel!!!!!!!If you're in town for a long stay, this is an ideal place as you have a kitchen in your hotel suite/room, living room, separate bedroom, they offer a warm breakfast every morning and dinner three nights out of the week. If your room is not clean to your standards, tell the front desk, they will fix it! This place is good at ensuring you're as comfortable as possible!  Location is ideal to many restaurants, not far from the theater/museum district and the scenic drive. I will be back on my many future trips to El Paso.The rooms in this Residence Inn meet expectations: clean, roomy, and with enough room amenities to be comfortable for weeks on end. One thing that was really obvious to me on both visits was that the customer service at this location is very, very good from the front desk agent to the sales rep + GM that you see at breakfast.Although I stayed at this location twice on a Monday, I wasn't able to take advantage of the manager's reception in the evening. This is held from Tuesday-Friday after 4 PM, I think. Even though I missed the manager's reception, the breakfast was sufficient and very palatable. No complaints here, and there was enough food to take with you on a long road trip. The parking outside was good, and the location is just off of I-10 (exit 24B?). Also, there is a Wells Fargo, WalGreen's and Taco Bueno within walking distance.I'll definitely return to this location. Well worth the $$$.Yay for pet friendly!  and they only charge the same as a typical guestroom.  You can't beat that!Typically, any Residence Inn you stay at is basically the same.  This place is the same.  Not good but more importantly, not bad.  Located right off the highway, it offers easy visibility to spot it, but really could easily miss it while driving.  A typical service road gets you to it, but don't miss it cause it's a long way to the turn about.  The hotel itself served its purpose.  Friendly staff and quick check-in.  I could stay here again.I had stayed at the Courtyard up the road a bit the last time I had to travel to El Paso for business.  This time I decided to try the Residence Inn because I'd be here all week.CONS:I had to wait at the counter for 15 minutes before being checked in because the person was on the phone.  The manager in the office did not come out to assist.The breakfast is OK.  They do have some fruit options, but they weren't ripe. Other than that, it's the yoplait yogurt if you want a healthier option (and that stuff is loaded with chemicals and sweeteners).PROS:This Residence Inn is superior to the Courtyard El Paso Airport, in my opinion.The rooms are clean and well-appointed with all my technology needs. I have outlets anywhere I could need one for charging my laptop and phone.  The rooms have been updated recently, I think, because it all looks new and they have the new lamp and TV styles Marriott is going with lately.The kitchen is fine, clean, and has what I need for a business trip.  The shower pressure is adequate, and the water gets good and hot if you like that sort of thing.TV channels are sufficient for what I need.I'll tell you what I love about this particular room (212): it is not only near the elevator, but it's on the side of the property near the back - the way the terrain is here, I have utter privacy and can open my windows and leave the curtains open without worrying about anything or anyone peaking in!Staff is friendly.All in all, I am pleased with this hotel and will stay here in the future for business trips in the area.NOTE: I am giving this a 'pricey' rating, but it could be just the weekday rate for business travelers.  I hear the weekend prices are much more reasonable.I've been here for three days and I'll be here for another ten days or so. My stay here has been great so far. Comfortable beds and a pleasant front staff. I left my key in my room twice because I'm the Simple Jack of hotel room keys and they were cool with it. Even joked around a bit because I'm an idiot.The thing I like best is that they're about the price of a regular hotel room, but have a full kitchen with fridge, stove top (sometimes an oven), dishwasher, and sink, etc.Free wireless internet, free decent hot breakfast, and socials in the evenings with free dumpy Bud Light!Residence Inn has become my home away from home. I definitely find the room rate and value to be pretty consistent. The staff is very friendly and the location is great.Nice.  But $100 charge if you bring a pet. That is absurd. I could see something like $20/day upcharge but a flat fee of $100 is absurd.Great rate and great front desk service.  The morning breakfast was perfect for us on the run.  The rooms are still a little dated (tube T.V.s, older furniture, etc.) but the hospitality makes up for it.Booked my son a room here using my hard fought for Marriott pts. Gave him a handicap room that made the shower impossible and had an air conditioning unit outside the window that kept him awake all night. Won't return points because my son was too embarrassed to complain and to tell me I booked a DUMP!

Nicest Comfort Inn and Suites I've ever seen - rivals most Comfort Suites. Great rooms and the best hotel breakfast I've seen in a long time. I mostly skip them, but this one was very good in the nicest breakfast area I've seen - a spacious 3rd floor area.My husband and I are currently staying here. We're close to the airport and 1-10 highway and we can't hear absolutely no noise. Bed is comfy. Breakfast is good. You can make your own pancakes and waffles. Rooms are clean and updated. Nice lobby area, we were told Monday - Thursday they free beer and food between 5-7,I believe were the times. They have computers and a printer. Only thing that sucks is the parking. We'll stay here again though.Newer furniture and carpets, clean rooms, friendly staff.  The room was easy to sleep in and comfortable enough to spend a few hours catching up on email.Hotel staff was nice. Parking lot a little small but found parking. Room was super nice and breakfast was decent. All in all everything I expected with a little extra. Would stay again.Pro - The room is clean and staff is very friendly. A con for me is having no refrigerator in the room. I only stayed for a night before heading back to California. Hoping for a restful sleep as I have 12 hours to drive back home. Annoyingly waken up by screechy floor and a weird sound..almost like a vacuum sound. It went on and on throughout the early morning. Most likely will not be staying here again.The staff was very helpful, provided me with some last month mite toiletries. Large variety of breakfast items. They had a free beer and pizza night which was nice. Rooms were a little cramped and we got "top floor" view of an accident lawyer billboard.Clean hotel, comfortable rooms and a small fitness room that's great to get your legs moving. I come to El Paso every week or every other week and I like staying here. The staff are very friendly, there is a shuttle that can take you to near by restaurants and the airport. I'm into fitness and sometimes it's hard to get away from work when I'm in El Paso so the fitness room works perfect. There are some cardio machines, free weights and a cable machine just to keep you active until you can get back to your regular routine. Free breakfast and wifi.Was I at a Westin, or a Comfort Inn? Since no one was falling all over me for a tip, I guess it was a Comfort Inn. That's about the only difference that i could tell other than not having a lounge. Oh and that the luggage carts are not exclusive property only to be used by the bell people, and only having valet parking available at 60 bucks a day.james y pretty much said it all.Best hotel for the price but prefer nobody else to stay here before the rates go up.Very nice - rooms are clean, hotel is 100% smoke-free., lounge area downstairs has a fire place... Will stay here again if the need arises. The ONLY issue I had was finding the blackout curtains - they are the same color as the walls & right up behind the sheer curtains so when you've been driving a long way & tired, you can't really find them. Like me. I finally discovered them about a 1/2 hr before my alarm went off.I Stayed 4 nights last week for business in the area.  The hotel grounds are nicely maintained with rock and gravel landscaping.  It shares a property with a Holiday Inn where you can use their pool (indoor/outdoor) and hot tub.  There is a neat bar with some entertainment in that complex as well.  The hotel is in a convenient location that is very close to the airport and restaurants.My room was clean and equipped with a serious air conditioner unit.  If you want the room cooler, you can make it that way in a hurry.  The bed was comfortable and I had good night's sleep.  Some of the light switches were in illogical places and it took a little time figuring out what switch lights what area.  The bathroom was a little cramped.  The shower had nice hot water and good pressure, however, the tub barely drained and I was standing in ankle deep water at shower's end.I will stay here again.  If it wasn't for the Choice Hotel points, I would probably try the 'sister' Holiday Inn across the way to compare.Great hotel. Service is great, room is comfortable. Happy hour and breakfast included. Safe area of town and close to the airport.Stayed here passing through El Paso. Arrived @ midnight. Check-in and check-out was a breeze. Staff was friendly and pleasant.  Woke early and continued on the road. Sorry I couldn't stay here  longer and enjoy the facilities. Hotel has modern decor and was pretty clean. Beds very comfy, scarce parking but great location next to I 10.  Downside was breakfast. Not greatest quality ingredients overall. Waffle maker was best part, eggs were synthetic tasting, sausage tasted greasy, coffee was good.This is a decent hotel and I would return for another stay. Would have given four stars if breakfast quality was a notch above.This is highly reviewed on tripadvisor. I'm usually skeptical of glowing reviews, thinking it must be some kind of racket. However, after looking at photos of other nearby hotels, this looked the most modern and chic (compare to the Marriott which is stuck in the last century). I'm glad I made the choice to stay there.Staff is courteous and attentive. Decor is modern, layout intelligent, and everything is sparkling clean and new. Price is low, I'm assuming because of nearby competition, but they don't cut corners. Rooms are comfortable, clean, and well stocked. I'm astounded at the value and can't possibly imagine you'd get a better room for the money elsewhere in El Paso.Slight negatives, it is near a freeway, so it's noisy. But same can be said for all the other hotels in the area, so consider it a minor heads up. It is also hard to access, so try to call ahead of time to get proper directions.The best Comfort Inn I've ever stayed at. Everything is new, convenient location off I-10, it looks clean, smells clean, and even has a good workout room with db's and a new cable machine. I would recommend this to anyone - business-person, family, or traveler.

For the price, it's not bad! It's not dirty or gross. The girl at front desk is friendly and helpful. The rooms have a microwave and fridge. Free shuttle to the airport. The one thing that does suck about this hotel is the very strong deodorizer smell. We tried airing it out, but it's way too strong. I gave this place four stars because it meets my expectations for a cheap place just for sleep.Pros: cheap, safe, quiet, nice front desk guy, overall clean. Cons: bed stand in middle of room, ac cover fell apart when we went to use it and had to reassemble to make it work, dirty towel left on other bed stand,But the worst was the TOXIC room deodorizer (?) or whatever nasty chemical used in the room.   We had to ask for another room because the first room was impossible to even be in.  It was like a mix of baby powder and cheap perfume.  Our eyes burned and we could taste it in our mouths.
