The front desk guy gave us another room and the chemical was there also, but at about 1/2 the dose.Great hotel clean room good size bed a few minor thing like tv chanels not enough and some you cant see another bad thing is that the room service started great until the last day they too like 4 hrs to even clean my room until we complained and the room up top too much noise like foot stomping but overall great comfy placeGreat value and convenient location! Enjoyed the clean rooms and breakfast in the morning! Staff was courteous and accommodating. Thanks Super 8!While driving a truck over the road I broke down in El Paso, was told it would be at least 2 days to fix, I was told by my company to find a hotel. I had my little puppy with me so I called Super 8 they said bring her on they accept pets. They sent a shuttle to pick us up from the mechanics. They arrived quickly, got to the hotel and was actually surprised by how clean it was. It's not a 5 star new hotel by any means but it fit the bill for a $50 a night hotel. Was what I was looking for. A clean, safe quiet place to rest up and relax while waiting on my truck to be fixed. The crew at the front desk were very polite and helpful. Check in only took a couple minutes and again like I said it's surprisingly very clean. Would have no issues staying here again if I had to stay in El Paso againI booked the room through Sams club travel and paid for the room there. We show up to the hotel and they said they need a card for incidentals. So we provided a card for that. Next morning we check out and finally make it home. We see there is a charge from the hotel for the cost of the room as well. They said Sams Club didn't pay them (there's a charge on the card from Sams Club as well). They said that once Sams club paid them they would remove the charge. it's a month later, we keep calling the hotel, some rude ass lady keeps answering the phone says we need to talk to the manger and the manger will call us back. We call every other day and still no manager. So now we're charged twice for a cheap ass room. Horrible customer service. Should've known better. STAY AWAY!!!!Excellent customer service. I got a spacious clean two queen bedroom with soft comfortable beds. Everything looked clean and the hotel itself looked safe and was well lit. I would definitely stay here again.The room looked alright, but I woke up with my shoulders, neck and chin welted with bedbug bites. Afterwards I saw two bedbugs on the bed.  The manager refunded my money later that day.  So I paid for the night with a couple week's worth of itchy bites; not worth it.Big Texas sized cockroaches up in here. Rooms are clean enough, but I swear that was the first time I saw roaches the size of rats.If I could give zero stars I would. The rooms are tiny and musty. The continental breakfast consisted of warm milk, stale bread, runny waffle batter and what I believe was suppose ti be frosty flakes cereal but was crushed dust. The maid was breaking up the bread and feeding the pigeons at the entrance to the breakfast area...which you know means pigeon poop on your shoes.  Don't stay here. Cheap but not cheap enough. I was quoted one price and charged a different price.  When I provided proof of their special offer, the Manager and a front desk clerk named Neil said "that isn't what they meant to quote me".It has a bed and we got a room for $41, so you can say it fit our needs.  Do not be fooled by the "deluxe breakfast" advertising,  unless toast and dry cereal is a special occasion for you. The broken water fountain made it seemed a little more ghetto than it actually was, but all in all it was alright.The staff was friendly, but the rooms could use some good cleaning. I had to switch rooms because the first had a broken TV and dirty pillow cases. The new room was slightly better, but had signs of neglect as well. Breakfast is more of a snack rather than a meal.Terrible the door to my room was broken and I got bitten bed by bugs don't stay here unless is an emergencyI really showed up here on a whim, grabbed my stuff up to my room, and shut myself in for the night, so I can't say that I got to see much of the Super 8 grounds other than my front facing hotel room. In this I mean that I didn't see any hookers, but that's because my curtains were closed and I left quickly the next morning. I can only give insight into how my stay went, so here's the dirty (er, actually the clean):One- the room was very clean and I had no complaints about the towels, tub, toilet, bedding, etc. In fact I was very pleased with my $40 night. Two- I experienced very little noise and I slept very well despite moving the table in front of the door because I was feeling a little paranoid (hey I'm a young, attractive female; it's what you do).Three- I was very happy with my complimentary breakfast the next morning of waffles, oatmeal, apples, yogurt, and toast. (I took extra stuff for snacks on the road. Shhhh!)Four- The attendants working the front desk were very helpful the night of my late arrival, and the next morning upon my departure. For a Super 8, I couldn't ask for more.However: when the night attendant asked me where I wanted my room, in the back or in the front, I asked which was a better location, to which she responded either. She did however place me in the front of the building (directly behind the main office), so I did not see anything beyond my front facing doorway. Could there be a troop of hookers roaming the grounds? Maybe, I just didn't see any.there is a bug in my bed, show head is on goodHorrible! Hooker infested hotel. We had been traveling from San Diego to San Antonio and it was getting late so we decided to stop over. Expedia had this hotel rated 4 out of 5 stars. Nothing could be more misleading. We pulled up and checked it. The front was old and outdated , but clean enough. We got our key and proceeded to drive to the back set of buildings. First thing we noticed was a group of "women" (ladies of the night) running around.. It was almost 11pm. My husband wanted to leave immediately. I persuaded him to continue on and check out the room. We never made it in the room- as we rounded the corner by our room- several intoxicated men were rolling around fighting in the grass area in front of our room. That was all we could take. Went back up to the front and asked if they had any other rooms in the front of the motel. They didn't and couldn't refund our money since we booked online. This is NOT A FAMILY motel. Disgusting. We found a much better hotel across the highway.decent for the money. But it is Super 8 and on the Eastside & right on I-10. A bit run-down but not bad for the price. Breakfast was actually pretty good. Can't complain, you get what you pay for.

We stayed at this hotel two nights last week, one on Monday and one on Friday night. The facilities are immaculate and the staff are incredibly friendly and helpful. We have used other hotels in the past(we travel for business) and continue to stay at the Fairfield Inn because of the great service. Great hotel!Just like Springhill they bake cookies with nuts and are not allergy friendly. However the front desk staff is friendly.I'm a platinum elite Marriott member and have stayed over 150 nights in Marriott's this year.  I have seen my share of hotels and I have stayed in all 3 Marriott properties here in El Paso. I think they all have different perks. This is a great and SAFE location. Walmart is across the street as is a Cinemark movie theater and a classic MUST VISIT Mexican restaurant, Leo's. Its on Tue west side of town which is a bit of a drive (for El Paso) to downtown, etc. You can take 54 through the mountains for a scenic drive or to avoid crazy traffic.The lobby is nice and clean, the room was not as big as others but clean. Bed is comfortable and its pretty quiet being very close to the freeway.There is a Spring hill Suites in the same parking lot if you're staying longer than a few nights.  You can't go wrong!!!Updated and clean.  Walked to a movie theatre next door.  Will stay here again as I love anything Marriott.Clean, quiet, professional and great location off the interstate however not so close that its noisy (granted I was on the north side of the building). I'm pretty particular when it comes to hotels. I prefer locations on the outskirts of the city where things are clean, newer, well maintained and close to dining. Fairfield as usual met my expectations with this stay. I highly recommend.I have stayed here multiple times. Very clean.good breakfast. Fitness center. A little loud due to being near a highway but that wasn't really an issue. Overall good experience. Lots of amenities nearby including places to eat and shop for necessities.Clean, nice and a great staff! Yummy breakfast as well.  Clean rooms and a great indoor pool.  There is a movie theater, good restaurants and Walmart within walking distance.  Very safe neighborhood!Ok well let start off as its in a decent/safe area the location is well lit and next to alot of places to eat within walking distances. The staff was nice when i checked in! They recognized my platinum elite marriotts and even gave me options to where i wanted the points to go! On the rewards or something from the market....sadly no beer in the market. It was starting off really good. Next was the room it was clean and roomy enough with a good view. Now here comes the bad which is sad cuz this was going so good cuz as of late staying at different marriott location have been a disappointment! So once again no lotion in the room i like the lotion in the room after a shower cuz i get dry skin. Ok no big deal im getting used to no lotion it seems marriotts cuts the corner there...now here is the biggest kicker went to the bathroom and put the toilet seat down and there was dried piss all over the toilet seat!!!! Lost a couple of stars for that one!!! Well that sucks next stop tomorrow will be Tuscon, az hopefully the marriotts there will be better!!!Pros:Friendly staffComplimentary breakfastLaundry facility onsiteFree wifiIndoor poolCons:Thin walls ( I can hear the person upstairs walk/stomp & hear the alarm clock from the room next door)Very very thin walls.  You can hear every thing in the other units, everything!  We have five of us in this hotel in five separate rooms.  Everyone complained about the noise thru the walls.  I could hear every foot fall of the person in the unit about me.  My wireless internet was crappy but my coworker said his was excellent although he did find a roach in this bath tub.  The breakfast was eh.  Belgium waffles, hard boiled eggs, English muffins and bagels, microwavable McMuffins and omelet pitas.  I stuck to the fruit.  Gym has dumb bells up to 50lbs.  2 tread machines and a elliptical.  No TNT on the tvs though.  Good location for restaurants though.  Jaxsons, Chili's, Famous Daves...all within 2 mins of the hotel.  Walmart accross the street is 24/7.  Movie theater next door.hmmm. where to start on this little gem. as ive mentioned before.. i travel a lot.. for work.. so ive stayed in my fair share of hotels.. my preference is Wyndham .. with the secondary being Marriott.. this trip my husband was with me, we pulled into town late on a tuesday and for some reason unknown to even the hotel staff in multiple locations.. many places were booked.  we finally found a room at the fairfield and booked the suite for 2 nights. for the room itself, i have little complaints. just the a/c was extremely loud and about a foot off the edge of the bed.. it gets annoying when its blowing directly on you while you sleep.  now for the good part :)  as a rule of thumb.. i NEVER indulge in the "free continental breakfast!!" no matter what place im at.. its just.. no. i cant. id rather have my shower.. get my starbucks and go get actual breakfast later... my husband.. :( well, he is not as strong willed as i when it comes to food. annnnnddd unfortunately, he had to pay dearly for it.  he ate 3 hard boiled eggs and some fruit from the lobby while i was showering... by the time i was done with my hair.. make up and getting dressed (2+ hours... vanity... i know.. shhhhhh!!)  he was laying on the bed talking about not feeling well.. very shocking from someone who will say hes fine when hes not! so i let him lay there and about 30 minutes later all hell breaks loose... i do not need to explain the details to anyone who has encountered food poisoning.. just know.. an hour later we were spending our day in the ER...  before checking out i went to the front desk and let them know what was going on.. got a sprite from the little shop for him and asked to speak to the manager... the manager was RUDE and almost made me act in a way i wasnt proud of when i tried to ask her was anyone else complaining about breakfast and the only possible way he could be sick was from that.. we were on the road.. so the only thing we ate the day before were chips!  she said its not possible it takes 24 hours for food poising to set in.. i told her.. she is not a doctor nor a food borne illness specialist so it was doubtful she was qualified to make that call.. she was hearing none of it.. so i just left it at that.. good thing is.. they got it under control.. despite spending 10 hours in the hospital and missing work... overall.. i will NEVER stay here again.. and for the money there are much better places with friendlier staff.. not once did the manager try to help in any way.. oh wait.. she did offer to call the paramedics. thanks b****. ill drive him myself..Great newer hotel on the west side of El Paso, TX that we hit up on our way into TX and back out of TX on a recent road trip.  Friendly staff, nice, clean, large-ish rooms, clean and quiet.  The morning breakfast area can get a bit nuts, but that is normal with these places and the "free breakfast".  If we are passing thru EP, we will certainly stay again.Stayed her for two weeks. Great rooms, recently remodeled. Some noise from the freeway, but not much. Breakfast was quick, good and service was expected.. Only downside was windows didn't open so tough to air out room and that the towels were old.Brand new place on the west side of El Paso (which might be a little bit on the outskirts of the city for some folks).  Honestly, we were super happy at this place.  The staff were especially friendly and gave us free cookies and good dinner advice.  Lightning fast free wifi in rooms and on free computers in lobby with free printer.  Comfy rooms with big tvs, Pantene bath products, nice beds, well functioning a/c, semi-lame sheets, and a great pool/hot tub.  Five star for its affordable price.  Four star if you're used to staying in fancy places.  The breakfast was more than adequate-- offered waffle machine, hard boiled eggs, cereal, oatmeal, jimmy dean breakfast sandwiches, juices, coffee, and bananas/apples.

hotel_name: Hilton Garden Inn  El Paso Airport
review_content: This is a very nice property.  I was a bit surprised.  Much nicer than the University HGI.  That statement is not based on location cause as you know this hotel sits near the UGLY view of El Paso.  Since you are not looking out the back window, I could care less about the view.  Its all about rest and cleanliness to me.  The room was clean, modern and nice.  The lobby and computer area, workout area all nice!  All Clean.  When I printed the computer's printed.  When I asked to fax something they obliged.  I didn't eat in the cafe but it looked much nice than any HGI that I have ever seen.  Oh, a nice touch is a nite light in bathroom.Hilton Garden Inn El Paso AirportThis hotel always seems to be booked and I don't get it.  The hotel is clean, the lobby is gorgeous, you get a fridge & microwave, and the staff is fair. But those are the only pros.  I had a tough couple of nights staying here because the bed I had was uncomfortable.  I know, you can adjust your bed's firmness.  I did and that still didn't do the trick.  Actually, it wasn't working.  It also didn't help that my king size bed was two singles put together.  Guess what? Sleep in the center of the bed and you'll end up sinking right down the middle.  Other issues I had was a weak Wi-Fi signal, treadmill was busted, parking is scarce, and the room's heater is loud.  Obviously, I won't be staying here again.  My advice, stay next door at the Homewood or across the street at the Hampton InnOne of the worst stays as 7 year Diamond HHonors. REFINERY! Smells and views are atrocious. Beds are not Hilton standard and are horrible and rock hard unless you change the dial and roll to the middle to sleep in a hole. Drawers from TV stand open in the night and the bed frame sticks out 5". GM, Adrian Perez spent his opportunity to make things right by holding his hand up in my face stating that the bed frames are HGI standard. HGI changed these beds out years ago.After 11 hours on the road we finally got at the hotel. We were very tired and I was travelling with a 10 years old and a 5 months old baby. When we made the reservations we asked for a crib for my 5 months old and they said it wouldn't be a problem. Well, there was no crib in the room. We asked for one and they brought us a crib that we had to put together. When we asked for help putting it together we were told to read the instructions. Well, we did! Then we had to call and ask for a bedding sheet. While assembling it we notice it was very dirty and with stains. We had to clean it ourselves. :-(Just very annoyed that they didn't have a clean crib ready.Don't totally understand why people are so negative about this place.  It's 5 minutes from the airport and has very easy access to the highway.  Room was exactly what you would expect from a garden inn and totally acceptable for a business traveler.Internet is free and decent speeds.  I would stay here again.I can confirm other reviews about the oil refinery. It is literally next to the parking lot.  Having never seen one up close before, I actually enjoyed the view.  If life gives you lemons, make lemonade.First impression Pros:  Hotel is clean.  I didn't try the restaurant or bar but it's nice to have the options available.  The hotel provided two complimentary water bottles and additional bottles are reasonably priced which was very appreciated especially considering the hot weather.  First impression Cons:  the entrance is confusing as you walk right into the restaurant section.  It's not easy to identify the check-in desk.  It took approximately 15 minutes to check in as the lobby desk was empty and considering the time of day and the number (4) of employees that saw us waiting, the wait shouldn't have been as long.  Room review:  the room was very clean and inviting.  It was my first time using the 'sleep number' bed system they have and I didn't care for it at all.  In my opinion, the bed felt too much like an air mattress.  The adjustable number bed crowd I'm sure would love it though.  The beds(mattress) and headboard are not a good match as the pillows kept sliding down to the peace between the mattress and wall.  I adjusted this by laying down further down on the bed, a taller person would probably have their feet hanging off the bed if they took the same step.  There is a single serve Keurig machine with plenty of choices (4) for coffee and tea.  Wish other properties also had one.I was quite disappointed with the level of service received during our stay. The accommodations were mediocre. My complaints are as follows:1. Room service was terrible. After waiting 40 minutes for a quoted 20 minute order time, our food arrived cold and our order was wrong. Not only did we receive an incorrect side on one of our orders, but we also received an entire additional unordered entree. After we explained the order was incorrect, the deliverer quite reluctantly returned the unordered dish to the kitchen, and then took an additional 15 minutes to return with our *somewhat* corrected receipt- though the unordered entree was deleted from our total, the percentage based service charge was not amended. Furthermore, they actually delivered a shattered ketchup bottle with our order, leaking ketchup all over the place. The staff was not apologetic in the least about any of these errors. 2. Upon check-in, my card was of course swiped for incidentals (the room itself was purchased on Price line). After being explicitly informed that there would be no charge and that it was strictly for liability purposes, I discovered a $49 charge that apparently "everyone" receives for incidentals that is to be returned upon checkout. This has still not been refunded to my account. 3. The refrigerator in our room emitted such a loud, high-pitched whining noise that it had to be unplugged so that we could sleep. Of course, this meant we could not keep any of our room service leftovers. 4. The thermostat in our room seemed to be broken. If we turned the AC on, it would not stop running. So, we were forced to choose between uncomfortably warm or uncomfortably cold. We chose uncomfortably warm. 5. The beds were quite uncomfortable.6. The morning of checkout, our key cards stopped working several hours before checkout time, requiring an additional visit to the front desk. 7. This is the first hotel I've ever stayed at that charged for breakfast. 8. Upon checkout, the receptionist, Jessica, refused to provide me with an itemized receipt displaying the return of the "customary $49 incidental hold." I'm beginning to believe that is because she is full of it and it will not be returned. So what can I say about our stay that was positive? Hmmm. Well, the staff was friendly, even if incompetant. And the coffee was good. I have literally had more enjoyable stays at Budget Suites. I doubt I will ever stay at a Hilton hotel again.I stayed here last night and it was super cool.  I usually stay in Hilton properties and this one is on par with the quality I expect.  We checked in late in the evening due to business, but the check in was smooth and I really liked the room.  The beds are adjustable for firmness - which was GREAT given the fact that the Hampton Inn over in Jurarez I'd stayed in the night before was rock hard.  Great breakfast, fresh coffee - works for me as a tired business traveler!Pretty sure that at $179, this was my least expensive Hilton brand option other than the suggested Hampton Inn in Juarez. Juarez? Thanks but no! It's not clear why El Paso properties are so expensive. It's not part of the oil boom like San Angelo. Standard HGI and I confirm that it is indeed off a weird service road. Have to wonder how many wrecks happen under the highway so be careful.I'd stay there again mainly to watch my expenses. Nothing wrong with it. Plus the Cal Poly football team was there too. (Yes, it's taken me from the beginning to the end of football season to finish this review...)This HGI is right off I-10 - and is a reasonably priced option near the airport. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms are updated and the lobby has the new HGI configuration.There is definitely a bit of freeway noise if you are on that side of the hotel but if you're blasting the AC, you won't hear it. The location is a bit weird to get to since it is on the feeder road near a street that is a two-way, which makes for a weird turn if you are headed in anywhere but east. The only other complaint is the breakfast area awkwardness - the set up of some of the large chairs is not very conducive for eating.Overall, this HGI gets a pass and I would stay here again if I was in the area.Have you ever wanted a sub-par hotel experience AND be threatened by the "El Paso Mafia"??? Well stay here and it can be all yours! If it was between staying here and cutting off my arm, I'd be a one armed man.Check in process was great, rooms were clean and modern, hotel interior and exterior were clean, staff was friendly, the food at the restaurant was not good, location was good and safe.This hotel is not quite three stars.  If I could give it a 2 1/2 star I would.  So let me start with the good:Newer hotel.Great room ratesQuite for being right off the interstate.Rooms are clean.Fridge and microwave in room.Not so good:Right next to a refinery...and I mean RIGHT NEXT TO.  Staff is not very friendly.WORST BED I HAVE EVER SLEPT IN.At check in we went to our room.  We got to the room and looked at the beds and one of the beds had a large lump (bubble) in it.  There is no way we could have slept on it.  The beds are adjustable for firmness and we tried to do that thinking that maybe that was the problem.  We were unable to fix it so we called to the front desk.  The front desk clerk sent the maintenance guy to look at the bed.  He was unable to fix it and had us call to switch rooms.  The front desk clerk told us to come to the desk so she could switch us.  When we got down there she grilled us like we had done something to the bed to make it do that.  (we were in the room for 5 minutes)  We told her the maintenance guy told us it was broken and she proceeded to tell us that he said there was nothing wrong with the bed.  I advised her he was the one that told us to switch rooms.  She was just very argumentative and annoyed that we needed to change rooms.  This made me very unhappy.  Anyway, we switched to a new room and the beds adjusted like there were supposed to but even the softest setting on the bed is horribly hard and uncomfortable.  I am not sure who decided these beds were a  good idea but all four of us in the room were very uncomfortable.  It is unfortunate because the rooms are nice.Don't eat the food!!! There was a worm in my salad, a hair into pasta and my cheesecake was warm and had a gross fruit sauce on it. Spare yourself the bad experience and eat at a restaurant outside the hotel... Don't even get me started on the splatter stains on the wall next to the bed... EwwwwThe badThis hotel does not participate in triple Hilton Honors points:-(It only has one cloths Washer and Dryer!The food is over priced and not very good.My toilet has a bunch of scrapes in it so it looks like there is always "poop streaks" in it, my pet peeve.No DVD player, limited TV channels, refrigerator is small and doesn't work well, myself and other co-workers have had to throw away food.Small room and below average for the price.The goodDecent staff, comfy bed, has a krueg with coffee given daily, clean room, close to a lot of things to do.Jelique Ayala the Asst General Manager is fabulous!  She took very good care of my extended family when we were in town for my father in laws funeral.  She knows her stuff!!!  I highly recommend the Hilton E Paso because of Jelique!The good: Friendly staff, Clean rooms, great breakfast. What more do I want right?The bad: It neighbors a refinery and your room stinks with what I'm sure are carcinogens. My whole family woke up in a stink room with sore throats.Who builds a nice hotel on top of industrial wasteland?Stayed here on a business trip.  I usually love the Hilton chains.  Boy was I disappointed.  I found a booger in my sheets and I was grossed out to say the least.  I complained to the front desk, they comped my room for me that is the only reason I am giving them 3 stars.Wonderful staff! Nice clean rooms, excellent breakfast and overall a nice stay. Will definitely come back when in town!No Bible in the rooms. Freeway noise. Air conditioners run fan non-stop. Only one washer/dryer for entire hotel. One-way street is awkward. Great Internet connection. Nice breakfast. Excellent staff.
review_content_20: No one wanted to serve me breakfast.The room was clean, the night clerk was excellentGot up in the morning wanted breakfast, was willing to pay the extra $11 for breakfastSaid good morning to the desk clerk and who I thought was the breakfast hostess.  The hostess ignored me and kept watching tvGave up after a few minutes waiting on someone to come make omeletteTold desk clerk I guess they didn't want my $11When i came to check out, she said the hostess said no one was thereI guess I was invisible or the tv blinded herAnother awesome room and fantastic service. Jolique at front desk is the best.

hotel_name: La Quinta Inn El Paso East Lomaland
review_content: This review is from the Southern Cali.Truck Driver-Robert.. Pay Attention y'all because staying in motels & suites is  what I do while delivering loads to different cities in the U.S.A!!! First of all- This is 1 of the Best suites I've stayed in thus far!!! It deserves ALL 5 stars for its Value-Location--Cleanliness-Comfortness-and amminities!!!! Flat screen T.V.-Iron board&Iron... Micro & Fridge...cold A.C...and a bed that you Won't want to get out of!!!! I must mention the Great service that I got from (Janet) at the front desk..very Professional & Courteous she was so "Big Ups to her for a Fantastic job"!!! Had NO problem parking my big rig ONLY 2 doors away from my room & that's also Thanks to Janet!!! I must say that for the LOW price for the room that I received A really Great Value & I will DEFINITELY come back to stay at this location again very soon!!! So people if you doubt my review- Call Janet& reserve ur room& IF you don't TOTALLY agree with my review then I WILL PERSONALLY REFUND ur money!!!! Look for further reviews from ya boy!!!! ...Peace&I'm out....I have always liked staying at La Quinta hotels. So as I am traveling across the country 8 months pregnant, I felt if I booked La Quinta for all my stops I would be comfortable. Unfortunately not this time, this is the worst experience I've had at any hotel. I am wondering if they are individually owned as this doesn't seem to be the La Quinta standard I am used to. My husband and I took our dogs out and when we came back to the room our keys didn't work, went up to the front desk 3 times before being told it was the door and we'd have to wait for the manager to arrive and fix it. So we ended up waiting a good hour just to get in and handed 2 more keys, that's it. Now if I am a manager of a hotel and have an issue like this with someone, I would be doing my best to make it up to them so they continue to stay. Nothing was done or offered, feeling pretty bummed about that. I have 4 more nights of traveling and La Quinta hotels booked, I have canceled tomorrow at La Quinta and am going to try someone else. So whether you're a fan of La Quinta or not, I'd recommend staying away from this one. **Update** Upon checking out this morning my husband was told there would be no charge for our stay. Thank you La Quinta for restoring my faith in you!We stayed here based on the good reviews this place received. I'm an avid traveler, so I've stayed at A LOT of different hotels, from shitty to BALLER! May be I'm just pampered by Hamptons and HI's, but this is one of the lower end LQ's I've ever stayed at. I think the best thing about this hotel is it's proximity to shopping and eateries. Pros: Off I-10, so you can jump on the highway. My bed appeared pretty clean. Cons: AC didn't work in first room. AC BARELY worked in second room! Was ignored TWICE when I approached the front desk by the hostess. No hand soap provided. Found a razor blade on ice machine within a child's reach by pool.If you don't really give a shit and are gonna be in and out, fuck it, stay there. If you're used to a higher level of comfort and service, move on down the road to a Hampton or HI Express.We stay at LQ a lot in our travels and chose this location as it was the highest rated in the area. We were traveling with two teenagers so opted for the two room suite. This establishment far under exceeded what we have come to expect from this company. The hallway and room was worn. The only way to our room was a narrow steep staircase- a challenge with heavy bags and an ice chest. There were no linens for the couch bed and no rollaway bed available. The bathroom was cramped, short on towels and had a small single bottle of shampoo. In the morning, the very small breakfast room was completely crowded, barely stocked and had lines down the hallway with seating for only a few. The price at under $100 per night for this size room was good, but ewww....so not worth it. On our way back, we'll find another option.Good stay here. Room was comfortable. I was happy for the price. Good location to base and the airport and lots of food places.If we needed to, I would stay here again.{Great price for a decent room! Ask for a discount if you're military. Allows pets, no fee.}Comfy bed, clean sheets, clean room, and bathroom. Super quick and friendly check in. Decently quiet rooms on a weekday night, besides freeway traffic. Seems like a safe location to me. Conveniently located off freeway, near shopping and food. Few restaurants within walking distance, too. Great wifi connection; I had no issues uploading/downloading files and no spotty connection. Points off: Towels are thin and rough, water takes a minute to warm up... but for an overnight stay for $60 - it'll do. Wouldn't stay here more than 2 nights to be honest. No areas for dogs to go to the restroom besides the back strip of rock along the fence. Mini fridge is loud. For some reason this place made my chest tight and made me cough. I'm not asthmatic or sure sensitive so I'm not sure why! Makes me wonder what's in the walls.The room is clean and their customer service is excellent, as it should be. It is outdated, looks sketchy and run down. Beds are comfortable and the flat screen is adequate. Mini fridge and microwave in the room and is adjacent to a Denny's. Definitely not for light sleepers as it is off the interstate and has some idling Semi's in the wee hours.  But, for the price & the cleanliness, worth it.For around $70 you can't beat this. It's very clean and comfortable inside. If you're looking for the most bang for your bucks, this is the place! Room had TV, 2 beds, microwave.This place is absolutely horrible. Horrible service and horrible room!! The toilet was broken throughout the 4 days I stayed!! I had to continually tell the desk to fix it, and they never did.What a horrible place to stay. My husband and I were here over the Labor day weekend and there weren't any people when we checked in. That soon changed as the sun was setting. Once we got back to the hotel the pool was crowded with people including kids. Loud Spanish music was playing on a huge boom box with the bass turned up all night long. A barbecue grill was setup along the sidewalk with large pots of what looked like menudo. It was like a college frat party. We were expecting a good nights rest. We awoke at 4:40 am and there were people right outside our door speaking loudly and still partying. No respect for those who might still be trying to get some rest. I cant believe hotel management would sllow this yo go on past a rrasonable hour. The room itself was very old. We moved the night stand to plug in an extension cord, and it looked like it hadn't been moved in months. The tv was plugged into an outlet that was not functional. Maintenance is completely lacking in this hotel/ dump. If you can drive away a few miles to stay at a decent, clean place...do it.Reasonable prices and rooms are what you would expect for the price. All staff was friendly and helpful including the manager. Breakfast was great!! very clean cafeteria and food was fresh. Our stay was short lived but first impressions mean the most. Def staying here on our next trip from C.A to Houston.Great location since its on our way to San Antonio from LA. Has mini fridge to store ur road Trip snacks and drinks. Microwave ,closet and small table in our double full comfortable beds. Room #141.Great dane friendly without weight restrictions or quantity or deposit.Not much of a place to let them relief themselves though.Small bathroom but ok if it makes up in the room size . Heated pool though outside its @ 20 degrees.Price for us on Saturday was 65 w/out tax. I'm impressed and will come again next time! Free wifi and free brkfst too! But if u miss breakfast  Denny's is in the same parking lot for a quick walk on over to save you on gas. Show your room key for  20% off your tab.Meh. Typical slightly rundown interstate hotel experience. Small, pretty dirty, but served its purpose. My biggest gripe is that our AC didn't really work. Even set to full blast, the thing would turn on for 60 seconds, off for 20 minutes. That is surprising to me because it still is in Texas and it is still warm in February. Oh, we also had to hold down the toilet lever to get it to actually flush and the shower would not get above mildly warm. Yuck. I would not stay here again.Not a five-star hotel but good for the price.  I'd say average for a La Quinta.  The room was clean except for a purple stain on the carpet.  No smell of cigarettes like another reviewer reported.The late-night front desk guy was super friendly.  Pet friendly.Slight noise from the highway and the A/C but wasn't bad at all.This place was a bit rundown, but it was cheap and did the job if you only need a place to stay for the night.The room was adequate, it served the purpose. I was a little concerned about bugs and fortunately there weren't any. I'd stay again if I were in El Paso.Very pleasantly surprised by this location! The room, pool and breakfast area were very clean. No funny smell in our room and the staff were very nice. Not that I normally care, but I did notice that our curtains and bedspread were updated for a more boutique look. Pet friendly, even for large dogs, but Like someone else said, itty-bitty potty area. I say a fair trade for the price!This was our stopping point on the way to California. Room was clean, a/c was decent. It would get a higher score, if not for the un-clean shower (strange hair, gross).Very surprised.  I didn't have high expectations from what I heard about El Paso but the hotel and even the city itself has really grown.  The hotel was very clean and pretty modern.  Free parking and even breakfast!  The location is a bit hard to get around places but with a GPS it isn't a problem.  Also, it is outside the downtown area so if that is your destination, it may not be the best place to stay.However, very affordable and clean are what makes this place worth staying!Went out of their way to make our stay amazing after our van broke down. We appreciated them so much!
review_content_20: The guy at the front desk is pretty retarded but the manager lady was pretty friendly, wtf do you expect at a La Quinta. Pet friendly! Always a plus.I wasn't expecting much since but we didn't need much....just a clean room for a night as we made a cross country trip from AZ to FL.  Unfortunately, I didn't even get that.  When I walked in the first room we were assigned, the smell of cigarettes nearly made me throw up.  I asked the guy at front desk if it was non-smoking and he said it was but that people break the rules all of the time.  Fair enough, he can't really prevent that.  He was very nice and switched us to another room.  It appeared to be much better....had a slight musty smell but nothing I couldn't deal with and seemed clean.  However, when I took a shower the next morning, there was a lady's razor in the shower and clumps of long black hair along the shower walls. BLECH!  I cleaned it out the best I could and showered because it was 430am and we needed to get on the road but it grossed me out.  I told the front desk when I checked out that they needed to do a better job cleaning the rooms in the future.  Let's hope they do.This hotel is the very definition of a find that will make the deal-hunting travel planner salivate. My party of four got a room with two beds for $52 each night - for a Friday and Saturday night! Very conveniently located along I-10 for the east-of-airport section of town. The room was extremely clean, and though I can't vouch for the quality of the beds (I yielded them to my companions of more discriminating tastes and volunteered to rough it on an air mattress), all other aspects of the room were Aaron tested, Aaron approved. The cable scarcely provided us with 25 channels and the archaic room keys were punch-hole cards that looked like they could snap in half if carried in one's pocket, but the continental breakfast waffles were bountiful and the front desk amicable, so huzzah for this economical gem of a motor-hotel!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express & Suites El Paso West
review_content: Very nice hotel clean quite and cheapbreakfast was good for free Coffee tea cookies downstairs all free Front desk guy was very nice and friendly Very good really enjoyed staying hereEverything in the room seems brand new. I was unaware of their military discount until their staff mentioned it. So they have a big thumbs up from me, haven't had the breakfast yet but it seems promising. Nice lit parking lotNew, clean, great beds, and pillows and friendly staff.  Highly recommended and only 20 min from the airport.My husband and I stayed here on 9/17 for a night on our road trip from Tucson to Austin. I am very particular about cleanliness at hotels and this Holiday Inn passed the test. It's not fancy, but it was comfy and clean and brand new which is all I needed to break up our road trip.  The front desk and house keeping staff were friendly. We had the continental breakfast before we hit the road again and filled up on toast and cereal.Usually I stay at Hilton properties but due to the extraordinarily exorbitant rate at the Hampton Inn next door I stayed here and was not disappointed. The hotel was nice and clean and fresh. I had the opportunity to stay in three of their rooms over different periods and all were very nice. The reason there is a missing star is because of room 409. For some reason all of the outlets turned off when the entry light switch was flipped off. This included the light on the night stand between the beds and the tall stand up light in the corner. Ridiculous that they made the room that way. It is not right and they should know it. So don't get room 409. The other rooms that I. Was in didn't have that issue and were finest I think it is a single room issue. The treadmill was tired and worn as it would surge and pulse but there is room to run outside. The local neighborhood with the trail can be run creatively to get a 5k or for the more adventurous you can run to New Mexico and back for a 10K.Wow, staff is Terrific!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Nice and clean! Good breakfast! Really close to the big outlet mall!

Let's start with my favorite part, breakfast. Scrambled eggs with ham or just scrambled eggs, biscuits, gravy, sausage links, fresh fruit, yogurt, bagels, bread and some mexican dishes as well. Coffee was on the weak side though. The rooms were good for a 2 star hotel, had to get a King size room at the beginning and it was a little small, I'm traveling with my wife, son and boxer. The next room was so much better with two queen beds, however the toilet had to be unclogged once, it was flushing very slow.Parking was good, they have cameras everywhere. The pool was also good, well at least my son enjoyed it. The tv reception was not all that great and the free wifi was good but a little unreliable. The staff was absolutely great. We will definitely stay again, but have to tell you to reserve your room quick because they sell out fairly quick.Room was wonderful. I spent four days there, before and after the Bataan Memorial Death March, and was really impressed with the low cost (reserved through ChoiceHotels.com); large, soft, and comfortable bed; nice bathroom; and proximity to LOTS of food options. Would definitely stay again during my next El Paso trip.This is the loudest motel you can find to stay in. All the airplanes landing and taking off fly above the rooftop just a few yards. The roads in front and to the side are always filled with the loudest vehicles with the loudest mufflers. Walls are poorly insulated to deflect the sounds. The shower in room didn't drain very well and requested it to be fixed, with no luck a week later. An error between housekeeping and front desk allowed for some strange innocent people to barge into the room late at night, waking me up and not to mention scaring us. However, the room is clean and the rate was great. Everything else is just overriding the quality of this not so quality inn. I will never return here to stay after this job ends. Not my best stay at a usually great motel chain.GIANT roach on ceiling!! Gross!Doing a cross country trip and arrived super late and was leaving early so just needed a place to rest our heads. Would never stay here otherwise!!!Was in town for a family event. Was pleasantly surprised at the room cleanliness and the size of the room. It has all of the basics I needed and was satisfied with the value. It seems to be older but is well worth the cost for the traveler who doesnt need to stay at a Hilton.Was really impressed! I was skeptical of this stop, due to previous reviews; but I was splendidly surprised! Room was super clean, ac worked and lots of towels. A bit of a misunderstanding with our room, but not hotel's fault. We went down to breakfast at 8:30am and ending time was 9:00. The buffet was full and they were still setting out more. Great service, great rooms and so affordable!5 stars?! WTF was that reviewer thinking?! My colleague booked this room and when we pulled into the parking lot i seriously thought I was staying at the Bates Motel. The place was uber shady. The door lock looked like a monkey with a pogo stick could break in. I could actually see the light from outside through the side crack in the door. I was totally skeeved out and even cut short my trip after one night. The "breakfast buffet" consisted of menudo and no tea. Not my cup of tea even if they had any. I would never stay here again.The room was clean but need a little repair. Great breakfast with a wide variety of choices from maneudo to pancakes. The staff was also very friendly.Stayed overnight in El Paso and, while I was not impressed with my experience in the city in general, this Quality Inn location definitely worth spending a few more dollars than at the Travelodge down the road or similar. Friendly staff, clean room, and the breakfast buffet was pretty impressive for what we paid for the room.

Ah yes...this place. Where to begin. Well..let's start with the first thing anyone looks for in any hotel: decorum.To the manager's credit, these people were very open and upfront about their multi-million dollar renovations which are still currently ongoing with an estimated completion date of November 2015. I found it rather humorous the way they ostensibly threw in the term "multi-million dollar" in front of renovations. Made it seem that much more epic...as if to suggest this place is destined for greatness. And perhaps it is. I just kind of looked at like this: they most likely got taken over by new management who, at some point said, "this place needs a major makeover!" ...and the rest was history. Because judging from whatever was left of the original decorum, this place VERY MUCH needs a renovation. Having said that, they should not even be renting out rooms right now...not until the renovations are complete anyway. But with an ECD of November '15, I sort of understand why they are anyway. Everyone's gotta make a paycheck, after all.Ignoring the aforementioned, let's talk about practical amenities. Now, it was mildly annoying the way they had to sporadically shut off the water for brief periods of time during the day due to said renovations. What was far more inconvenient was their shoddy WiFi service. Seriously, this signal made 3G look like fiber optic broadband. I was honestly searching the room for an Ethernet connection (since I carry a cable with me everywhere I travel), but came up empty. So I was stuck suffering with intermittent WiFi with a token which had a 24 clock on it; which meant you had to inexorably renew your pass for their connection. This may seem like a minor thing to complain about. But when you take a minute to consider how many dealings we conduct via the Internet (I.E. bills, important emails, signing digital documents, organizing other finances, etc..), this becomes a major show stopper! I shouldn't have to walk across to the local IHOP to obtain a decent signal.Speaking of computers, I should throw out one caveat: there is a business area where you can print documents as needed...but there is little to work with. Firstly, you'd better not have to print any documents which require download, because thanks to their security settings, you are not permitted to download anything. At all. Not even a PDF. Also, the printer isn't even wireless...which means you can forget about printing anything from your smartphone. These guys might want to consider renovating that business area, too.Finally, let's discuss the room really briefly here. The A/C unit was loud as hell and honestly felt and sounded more like a swamp cooler. We had the thermostat set at 65 the entire time, yet the temperature never got lower than 74 degrees. The room had two sections. So the bedroom felt nice and cool for the most part, whilst the living room felt like there wasn't any A/C at all. I honestly didn't know if one of the filters was clogged or if we were literally just working with a swamp cooler.Interesting side note: I'm actually traveling for business related purposes and had to move my family in the process; hence why I needed such a large room. When the opportunity came to seek more accommodating pastures, we packed up our stuff like a family on the run and booked out of that hotel ASAP and proceeded across the highway to go stay at the Residence Inn (expect a review on them in a week or two). As for the El Paso Suites..The suites themselves are actually decent...they resemble very modest studio apartments, which is putting it lightly. I like that there were two sections, though that part could have been executed much better. I detested the fact that such a room only had one tiny bathroom. And we won't even discuss the fact that their toilets had very weak water pressure...as did the sinks. Overall, let's just say I'm glad that I didn't have to pay full price for the room. I'm also eternally grateful that certain circumstances made it possible for me to check out early. Because quite frankly, if a hotel is undergoing heavy renovations the way this place is, they should not be renting out rooms until complete. Let me paint the picture for you all: would you want to stay in a hotel that features no complimentary breakfast because they have less than half their lobby in tact, has a giant tarp wrapped around the part they're doing construction on despite being able to see it all through the transparent elevators which creak each time you use them, and the subtle grains of debris from said construction at the bottom of a pool that probably shouldn't be open to the public at such a time? Sounds about as appealing as staying in an abandoned crack house. Do yourself a favor if you happen to be in the El Paso area seeking a large suite: stay in one of the establishments ran by the Marriott.This is a very nice and affordable old hotel. I liked the big room with lots of counter space and courtyard views. There was a small leak in our room that didn't bother me as it dripped right into the sink. My husband went down stairs to get us some breakfast, but he was stopped in his tracks- wasn't allowed to bring the food upstairs. The kitchen "guard" literally took his plate from his hands. Seemed a bit unnecessary and rude. We're not slobs. Other than the sucky breakfast bar and leak, I liked the old hotel.Think twice about this place. We used Expedia for any hotel on El Paso and they gave us this one. This place is going through major renovations and no one should be allowed to stay there. We went through two days of no hot water and the outlet in the vanity area not working. We made numerous complaints but no fixes. It was nothing but a nightmare and ended up leaving prior to our week being up. We scrambled for another hotel and luckily found a Hyatt close by. The hotel staff at El Paso Suites Hotel was courteous but were unable to remedy our problems, I don't find them specifically at fault. I will NEVER use Expedia again. The hotel should have never had any rooms open during the renovations and Expedia should have never pushed us towards this hotel.I would have given this a ZERO if i could have! Anytime you have roaches coming out of the vents!!!! Run!!! I don't think it was the first time they had been told.this.either because.other.than a #sorry we got.nothing no call and i.left my number and.expexted a call i.made sure to.take.pictures also. Disgusted and appauled never in my life have I had to.deal with roaches in.my hotel. We left.immediately and.it was 6am.Stood here for a night even though reviews were not the best. LOVED IT...The guy in front did not want to honor military discount as I'm the spouse, but when he found out I had drove from Los Angeles with a 2 & 8 year old boys....he said he would give to me. The room was beautiful. Breakfast was good.Staff was helpful....The reason why it's a 4 is the room had no way to keep door locked. There wasn't a stopper. My 2 year old kept opening the door. I had to move an ottoman in front of door.Other then that, it was clean, beautiful, all up to date. Would stay again.Very outdated, and dirty. Also very loud. As of this posting, major construction was going on. The hotel's website indicated a complimentary breakfast, but because of the construction none was provided.Is there anyway you can give a place negative stars?1. Please find another front desk person. This guy was rude and could barely speak english. The guy in front of me was also pissed and I dont even know why2. Rooms are old and smell like cigarrete3. They havent done any maintenance since 19944. They dont care about service or guest's satisfaction5. Dont order dry cleaning service they will mess up your clothing6. I could go on and on. Please dont stay here... Dont be fooled by the 3 star rating on priceline... It is not 3 stars!Do not stay here. Priceline rates this hotel 3 stars but its not even a 1. The exterior looks bad and the area looks shady. The courtyard looks ok. I was happy when I seen the size if the room compared to the 4 star we recently stayed at. Then it went downhill from there. We didn't get any hot water, followed by an alarm where we had to evacuate and now no air conditioning. We are still here and can't wait to check out tomorrow!My wife and I stayed here for two nights while visiting family after securing a great rate via Priceline. We were both very impressed by the convenient location, spacious rooms, beautiful atrium, and the simple, but welcome perks (complimentary happy hour & breakfast). I'll get the few negatives out of the way first. The El Paso Suites is not what I'd call luxury lodging. The technology in our room was a decade old or so and it's not a place where you go to be seen. (remember you're in El Paso, not Scottsdale)What it is, however, is a fantastic property for the price and more. Here's my breakdown:LOCATION -- easy on/off freeway access with shopping/restaurants/gas stations a very short drive away...it's basically just off the frontage road of the interstate, so you'll be driving most everywhere you go, not taking romantic strollsLOBBY/EXTERIOR/ETC. -- The beautiful atrium is the star of the property...very impressive, especially for a hotel of this value...though a bit old school, all the public areas we saw were spotless with tasteful decorROOMS -- This is a full-size suite with two big rooms in each room...the TVs were circa 1995 and the view was of another motel parking lot (from our second floor location), but the beds were comfy, bathroom was clean and efficient, and, again, there was plenty of room to stretch out. POOL/GYM -- Too bad this isn't an outdoor pool as it might be a bit more appealing to soak in some El Paso sun...it's an indoor pool usually occupied by kids though, so we chose to skip it...the gym was small and a little warm, but we put the cardio and weight equipment to good use and were very satisfied.PERKS -- TWO free drinks per person per day is their complimentary happy hour...yeah, it's Franzia box wine or Miller Light, but if you don't mind a blue collar beverage in a blue collar city, then it's a very nice touch...the free breakfast was surprisingly good...not just a stale continental breakfast, the eggs were cooked to order, salsa was excellent, and the lighter fare (yogurt, fruit, etc.) was well maintained also.STAFF -- Everyone we interacted with was friendly and we saw constant attention to keeping the public areas clean and tidy. We will certainly look to stay here again during our next visit!Rooms are absolutely huge for the price!!! Although they are severely outdated, TV is outdated, bathroom outdated, lamps outdated. The hot water was fine in my room. BUT BE WARNED if you like ice cold hotel rooms DO NOT STAY HERE! The AC says its at 65 degrees but it feels like 75 at least. Tempted to go buy a box fan... Although, I would stay here again for the huge rooms for the good price.Former Embassy Suites when 1970? The rooms are horrible, rented two rooms based on photos, very deceptive. Rooms have old window doors and front is all windows anyone could break in. Balcony door was taped closed could hear traffic all night and don't expect to get air in winter, only heat. shower took forever for hot water then would not turn down. This is a negative 5..Horrible. .oh they do have a creative Web person...Did not sleep well here at all! Record hot day and they conveniently withheld vital information: the air conditioner system for the whole place was TURNED OFF for their renovation! Wasted time and energy and valuable sleep waiting for it to kick in. The breakfast was lacking in portion size and NO SECONDS! In summary, this place chooses their bottom line over your comfort. Avoid!I Realize this is an old hotel, but since the rates ate still high, it should have kept it's standards up as well. NO WIFI, even if they claim to have it. Breakfast was blah, and I called housekeeping for 30 mins before anyone would answer, then when I finally got someone, I had to GO get my own blankets and pillows from the front desk. ... yeah. I hope along with the renovation, they renovate the staff as well.Terrible hotel. Sheets were stained and the entire room just felt dirty. Was supposed to stay two nights. Checked out early. I travel for work VERY often and never felt the need to write a bad review.These reviews are ridiculous! For $85 you get a king size bed, an extra room with a couch and fridge, a beautiful view of the city and complimentary breakfast. I have been traveling from Seattle and have stayed at 3 hotels all for the same price range(actually more expensive) and I could only afford days hotel and travel lodge. This place is in that price range but it is a much better deal. These reviews are from snobby people who should have spent there money going to a five star $300+ resort.We got a deal on priceline, and it picked El Paso Suites. The Hotel is old, rooms need updating. But It's livable. What I didn't like is the breakfast. Wow. They give you a ticket to get food. You wait in line with all the other customers. I waited 15 min, my parents 20 min. The breakfast wasn't worth the wait. It was also very little. Go to IHOP next door, and I hate IHOP. I don't know why they don't have a buffet. Are they afraid of people eating too much? Come on. Eggs are cheap folks. Raise some chickens if you must.They need to: - Refresh the hotel: Carpets, design, TVs- Get a breakfast buffet like other hotels.My wife, son, and daughter were just turned away from this property at 11:00 pm, after trying to check into a prepaid room. At first I thought there was a language issue with my wife, but my daughter's English is perfect, and so it was definitely not a misunderstanding. The debit card they used was "declined" for a charge of $50. My card had been declined earlier in the day as my bank thought the charge to be suspect. The plane was late and it was after hours for contacting the bank. My daughter had $300 cash and they refused to accept any amount, instead keeping the prepaid Priceline fee and sending them away. Any business that feels that it is within their rights to take their customer's money and refuse to provide the contracted service will not last long. If their policy is that a cash deposit (more than double) is unacceptable, the right thing to do would be to provide a full refund. To the person who turned away my family, remember, it's the customers who fund your paycheck. Nice job, probably get your name on the plaque again next month.WARNING!!! do not stay at this hotel!!! I just got back from Staying there in El Paso and I had the worst experience. This USED to be the Embassy suites, BUT the quality has gone down to a Big fat ZERO!!! When I arrived, the room that was assigned to me 327, had a serious electrical shortage when I got up to turn on the AC at 3:00AM a loud noise followed by sparks and smoke ensued...it was the most frightening experience ever. But wait, the hotel never bothered to check it out. They just moved me down stairs to room 120. The room I moved into had cockroaches, the AC did not work properly, the cold water in the shower came out very hot!!! the TV in the living area did not work, the pillows were as hard as a rock and the room itself was gross dirty. The Treadmills did not work properly and the work out room was very hot - air con, And El Paso can get very hot in the Summer...And last but not least, OMG the "free" breakfast was horrific!! a doughnut and coffee would have topped their crappy food... Not at all like the Embassy suites it used to be!!! Had I not gotten a good deal with priceline.com I would have checked out in a heart beat. But I did not have the time nor money to stay elsewhere as I was there for a graduation.Oh and be warned!!! if you have a problem, they will tell you that they cannot help you because you went through a third party to book the room...WHAT the hell...but I picked that hotel. And never did management call me to see how I was doing after that terrible fire shortage. This place is a royal dump!!!And when I called priceline to inform them of my ordeal, they called the hotel and the hotel idiots denied everything and anything-unbelievable!!! Priceline is still trying to follow up and see if we can get some sort of compensation...This management is in the wrong business. They think they can jack people around and still make money -NOTRumor has it they are selling out within the year and the new owners will be converting it back to the Embassy suites-Awesome blossom!!!! Otherwise these bozos are going to go out of business real soon!!!! YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!This has to be the oldest Embassy Suites I have ever being in, the exterior sign was faded, and basically everything was outdated. The TV in the living room was a flat screen but the one in the room was the old ones. Normally the manager's reception offers more than chips, and pretzel mix with the well booze but this place sets the bar at the minimum. The only thing that saves it from the bottom is the fact that the internet speeds were pretty good, and even though the shuttle was suppose to only run at the top of the hour the staff called the driver, who has other assigned duties, and she gladly came down to drive me to the airport in the morning.As mentioned in other reviews this hotel, mainly the rooms themselves, is not up to what frequent travelers equate to the Embassy Suites name. Yes, the rooms are suites. They are in badly need for a renovation though. TVs are out dated, AC is noisy, and the carpet is older than the dirt on it. In my opinion my room was clean. Then again, I'm a bachelor and live alone so my opinion may be suspect.Also, I am guessing this is one of the older Embassy Suites as it doesn't have a bar/restaurant and a rather small Breakfast/Manager's Reception.I didn't have an issue with the staff and room service was decent. So I think a quality renovation could bring this hotel up to snuff.(On a side note: I would like to thank the staff for having the 4 bikini clad young women sun-tanning in view of the Exercise Room while I was working out.)
review_content_20: I'm am a huge proponent of "you get what you pay for".  Only want to pay 90 dollars a night to stay in SF = Travelodge conditions with a sharps container in the bathroom.However, for Embassy Suites...it is definitely not worth it.  We paid almost 200 dollars for a king + sofa couch.  NEVER opt for a sofa couch instead of two fulls.  Like everyone else said, this hotel is old.  The card key would never open on the first try, the whole hotel reeks of cleaning chemicals, and we were missing a remote control.Perks: the complimentary breakfast and cocktail hour (which we missed).  Don't be tricked by their marketing antics to lure you in.  Hilton, I expected more from you.Where to begin? Awful, just awful. All I need out of hotel is: NO bugs, working heat, hot water and working refridgerator. Those are fair requirements, yes?Day 1: I called earlier that day to let them know I would be checking in late because my first flight was canceled due to mechanical issues. I arrive and someone canceled my reservation. Mind you, my job handles all my travel plans and that late in the evening. The office is closed. So that added to my frustration. The front desk clerk "R", was an inconsiderate... Anyway, as soon as I mentioned I would go to the Radisson my reservation was in the computer and I was in my room within five minutes. I get to my room and see the 20 year old TV's. I hate that, but sometimes those are the cards that are dealt. After 12 hours of flying/layovers I am ready for bed. Thankfully, I didn't unpack that night. Day 2: I woke up at 6am and went to the bathroom. I see insects scurrying around the bathroom when I pop the light on. It's time to get another room. I am greeted by very accomodating, apologetic, pleasant staff. Unlike the not so gentlemen "R" from the evening before. They move me to a room where at least one of the TV's was an LCD. I look around for any tell tale signs of insects. All looks good. Time to go eat my made to order breakfast. "Hi, do you have any boiled eggs?" "No", the chef responds. There goes my breakfast. Later, but before I go to the grocery store. I stop and ask the clerk on duty if it would be possible if I bought a dozen eggs if the kitchen could boil them for me. "No", she says. I bite my tongue, an amazing feat in itself, but I am thinking to myself. "Made to order my arse!"That should give anyone an idea of how the rest of the stay went. I haven't mentioned the consistent rudeness of "R" throughout the stay. It's already well liquor served. They have to water it down too? The fridge that didn't work. The hot water that got room temperature. The heat that worked when it felt like. The not all the way sealed windows/doors that could have only been caulked by kindergarteners.The one year and three months overdue elevator inspections.The peeling wallpaper.The water stained ceilings. Frankly, Hilton should be ashamed to have their name attached to this location. I've stayed at many lesser name hotels in my travels that were better than this. I have informed my office about this hotel and we will no longer be staying at this location. I recommend the same for anyone looking to stay in El Paso.I had to call 5 times for a shuttle to pick me up from the airport and waited almost an hour.  The hotel is only 5 minutes away.  The service was terrible, the location was awful, but the rooms were clean.  I booked on Hotwire and it said 3.5 stars, but 1.5 is more accurateThe hotel had a urine odor, I think from the indoor pool. When we got into the room it was outdated. The blanket had a few holes and the sheets were stained *gross*, there were clear wrappers on the floor and the shower curtain was on the dirty side as well...That's what happens when I don't book where we stay!Seriously underwhelming experience for the amount of money paid. WiFi is $6/day for crappy signal and paltry bandwidth. Shower never got above lukewarm even on full blast. Property is sandwiched on an asphalt swath between an insurance cube farm, IHOP, and a LaQuinta. Bottle of water at gift shop=$3.50; walk 200 yards to Circle K, same bottle=$1.19.Cooked to order breakfast? The only cooked to order item was an omelet. Want pancakes, sausage, or bacon? Some grossly undercooked rubbery substance is pulled out of a chafing dish.Cocktail hour however worked well. Beer, wine, well drinks, and soft drinks with a big bowl of bar mix.Do not leave anything in the "living room" part of the suite. It is clearly visible through the thin gauze covering the wall to wall window/door.Staff was polite and cheerful, but they seem overwhelmed with the fading starlet quirks of this hotel.This is by far the worst experience our family has ever had!! We had 4 of us staying in a suite because we were in town for a funeral, on the website to book the room it wasn't easy to find where to put how many guest were staying. Little did we know that upon check in they would charger per person after the 2nd guest. When we asked if they could still honor our rate the manager said no and the human resources lady was quick to say they will cancel our reservation if we want to go somewhere else. WOW! Since we had no where else to go that would accommodate 4 of us comfortably we were stuck in the El Paso Suites Hotel situation. We decided to check out the "managers reception" where they had only miller lite and red or white wine, cheap vodka would be $2. No appetizers that a normal managers reception would have. Continuing on, our second day they did not have hot water starting at 10am, they put a notice on the door at 9:30am and weren't expecting hot water for several hours. I feel a phone call to all guests would have been necessary for this, a note 30 min before is just not adequate enough. 2 out of 4 of us were able to have an actual hot shower and when we asked if they could credit us, again the not so friendly human resources lady said she would see what she could do...we got our bill and nothing was done, not even a phone call. It's obvious this use to be an Embassy Suites, it urgently needs a modernization remodel. The rooms are terribly outdated. I will not be coming back to this hotel again and I will not be recommending it to anyone.Very friendly staff during the week. Drivers are helpful and friendly (Julio rocked!) Great Managers Happy Hour! Gym left some to be desired, pool always had kids in it but calm during the day. Prices were reasonable - cheaper on weekends. Thank you!!We stayed in August '11 and was VERY disapointed, especially for the price.  They gave us a very subpar room the first night but when I complained they gave us a little better room and completely comped our 1st night.  So they did try.This hotel is not as awful as some people claim. Yes, it could use some renovation but I did not have a bad experience here.Can someone queue the Adams family theme song? Cause that's what you will feel like when you stay here. This is probably the most outdated embassy suites with a creepy haunted house feel to it. Even when you enjoy your complimentary breakfast hope you like eating in the dark.   The suites have a store front feel to them which is great if you want to pretend you run a law office but otherwise I like my hotel to look and feel like a real hotel with some privacy.Very sub par Embassy Suite, especially for the price.  Outdated facilities.  Manager's reception was decent.  The bartender makes a decent bloody mary.  Saddest breakfast I've seen at an Embassy Suites.  My room wasn't cleaned too well either.  Dirty clothes from the last guest were still in the room!  As unsatisfactory as this joint was, and the fact this was in El Paso, I can't believe the price...$150!This is an old hotel with no on site restaurant or lounge. Rooms are really not that updated and some may find the glass room doors less secure than the usual wood doors. Work out room is pretty decent and the free breakfast and Happy hour is nice. If you're a Hilton points collector, you may eat to check out the Homewood Suites just down the street. That's my plan when I return to El Paso.Helpful front desk.  Nice breakfast.  Nice happy hour.  Room was dirty, filthy sheets, piping hot, extremely loud because of the highway, and jammed pack with border patrol, Army units, etc.Place needs an update.  Sliding glass doors on balconies are "glued" shut so they cannot be opened.  The noise from the interstate comes right through the worn balcony doors as does the wind. New closely located hilton properties are much nicer.

review_content: The rooms were pretty standard. Not brand new, but clean and with the amenities I wanted, including a coffee maker and mini fridge.I didn't use either pool or the fitness room. They also were nothing special, but looked fine.But the stay is a winner based on service. The staff was friendly. The shuttle driver gets you back and forth to the airport super fast, and will also take you anywhere within 3 miles. Then you also get a full breakfast (from the menu to your table including chorizo and egg omelets and such) and happy hour daily. Happy hour is chips, salsa, popcorn, and your first two drinks. (Beer, wine or soda.)And the location is great for the airport. It's the closest hotel not on the airport property. Of course it's not a location for walking around town, but you can take the shuttle to a restaurant and back.We were in Hawaiian embassy suite by Hilton last week and comparing to that hotel, price is fair. Room is clean and there is everything that you may expect for $80/night hotel. However, there are couple of issues that makes me not to come here again. - finding parking spot at night is difficult. - breakfast service is TERRIBLE, TERRIBLE, and TERRIBLE. Only 2 waiters for 115 people. It took 1 hr for us to get what we want. Even if you like the environment stay away from this hotel if time is important for you.Just a weekend in town getaway with the wifey and kiddos. So far it has been pleasant despite it being practically filled up, its been quiet, pool was empty and clean, same for the jacuzzi. Nice and relaxed. Forget that I'm still in El Paso. Friendly staff, professional and courteous. Bed is extremely comfortable. Received complimentary breakfast tickets as well. Highly recommend for any out of towners that looking for a quality hotel that wont break the bank. Very reasonably priced for what you get. We like to stay at hotels from time to time. Just started being a tradition, kids love it and we don't have to worry about picking up after ourselves.I have stayed at this hotel 3 times on business, and I have to say that it holds a special place in my heart. The staff exudes warmth and friendliness and appears to truly care about all of their guests. I must mention a few people in particular: Janie at the front desk overheard that we were celebrating the birthday of a colleague, and upon our return to the hotel after dinner had arranged for a plate a desserts to be waiting for my colleague at his room! Not every person goes above and beyond like this, and we really appreciated the gesture. Lyka greeted us with such genuine warmth, and enthusiastically recommended a place for our birthday dinner. Eddie was the shuttle driver who patiently drove us to shopping and our dinner location with patience and warmth. Thank you for a great experience every time I come to El Paso - you offer a uniquely warm service.I'll just lay out the Pros and Cons for you. PROS: pretty sure it's walking distance from the airport, unless you're lazy as shit, or have a disability or 500 bags,then hop on a FREE Shuttle.complimentary Happy Hour!! Friendly employeesClean roomsFree breakfast. Not some crappy continental breakfast either. A legit, order what you want off the menu and they serve it hot, breakfast.Several Wi-Fi optionsI LOVED the shampoo & conditioner they provide in the rooms. We had dinner here and the food was DELICIOUS!CONS:those Wi-Fi spots can be iffy.A basic tub/shower that seems kinda small. I recommend this place if you have to stay in El Paso.We celebrated our 24 year Anniversary here and had a Great Night. The Bar and Grill was awesome. We had the wings and beef nachos. Excellent drinks. I had several including the Irish Car Bomb and the wife enjoyed her Blue Azteca. We received two free breakfast tickets and the breakfast was great we had the omelette. The servers were Great and very nice . We had a 4th floor suite which was Awesome. Only issue there is no ice machines on the 4th floor and the 3rd floor machine was outta ice. Awesome time with my Sexy Mrs's.Beautiful looking hotel, nice rooms. Feels clean and fresh. But for work, this place was a disaster. The wifi was free, but I couldn't even connect to a single webpage! Worse than dial-up. I ended up using my phone to search for a wifi coffee shop.Again, nice place to stay but not for business.Poor customer service is beyond infuriating. We checked into our room 2 AM in the morning to find that the toilet wasn't working. The next morning the stopper for the bathtub wasn't working also. When we checked out we informed the receptionist. She advised that we should have informed the front desk the night before about the issue. Really? At 2 AM when undressed, the last thing you want to do is to get the toilet fixed or move all your stuff to another room. The room should have be pre-checked by maintenance staff and we should have got a voucher or some token discount for the inconvenience. Instead we are advised to contact Priceline. How is it their problem?I really liked this hotel. In fact I give them 4 stars only because the walkways to and from the terminal aren't well marked which made what seemed like an easy walk to the airport a little less easy.Still, the hotel was clean and the staff friendly. Gym and pool were a little dank and dark though. Restaurant was pretty amazing (try the Fajitas!)Not much else within walking distance. I think there was an applebees or a chilis next door and a few gas station convenience stores down the street but thats about it. Still between great rooms and a great restaurant this one gets an easy 4 stars from me.Horrible, simply horrible! We had charges to our room we did not make. Come to find out, someone bought tons of drinks at the bar, and charged them to our room. If that wasn't enough, they forged my boyfriend's signature. How did they know our room number and boyfriend name enough to sign it similar to his? Spoke to management, and there was no sense of urgency. We were advised we needed to wait until tomorrow. Very unprofessional and horrible taste in hospitality.Love love this place so convo eminently located.  I recommend or bucks when booking you'll save .  Military discount too.  Very nice request the rooms with the glass doors they are nice .Hotel is very close to the airport; you can see it from the pick-up area.  A shuttle came and picked me up.  The driver said they had 24hr service and would take you anywhere within 3mi of the hotel but I just used them for the ride to the hotel.  There is an Applebees and Cattle Baron restaurant in the same parking lot.Room was clean, spacious, and the bed was comfortable.  I didn't spend much time on the free WiFi but it was usable on my tablet.
