Free made-to-order breakfast was included but didn't stay to try it.Accommodations were a great value almost as nice as the $200/night hotel I stayed at in Austin the follow night.I've stayed here a few times.  Hotel is nice and clean and well updated.  The staff here is what really makes this hotel shine though.  Almost everyone here is very well trained and know their job and it shows.  Comes across as the kind of service you'd expect a much more expensive hotel.  The staff at the front desk might be the weak point in the chain though.  They're nice enough but don't seem have that same level of training everyone else does.Other things I like about this hotel:-The free breakfast is made to order and several options available.-The complimentary shuttle does more than just airport runs.  They'll take you to local restaurants and pick you up.  Great if you're stuck here without a car like me.-Evening happy hour.  Complimentary beverages and snacks.  Two drink limit and chips and salsa or popcorn as the snacks.  They do it every night which is good.Hotel has a contract with Southwest Airlines I believe.  Several pilots and flight attendants can be seen eating breakfast everymorning I've been here.The most comfortable Radisson Monkey ever stayed in...This place was great. I had just gotten in from an all day drive and not only did we get a great deal from Expedia but the lady at the front desk recommended a great Mexican food place which I will not forget. Simple as that. Close to the airport, I'd say middle class neighborhood and I definitely felt safe.THE WORST HOTEL EXPERIENCE EVER. When my sister & I checked in at 9 on a Sat. night there was no restaurant, bar or room service open.  The half witted young man at the front desk then "dropped" my credit card (that he demanded for "incidentals" altho with no mini bar in the room and no restaurant bar or room service what could those be?) down a "hole" and said he couldn't find it.  He told me I could come back down and get it whenever he found it.  Two hours later he said he hadn't been able to get it.  He hadn't called maintenace because "they didn't have a maintenance crew."  He refused to connect me to a manager.  When the manager eventually called me she said they did have a maintenance crew and she had "just called them."  She brought the card to my room in the middle of the night.  This morning there was a mysterious (fraudulent) $50 charge on it that the rude young woman on the front desk refused to remove claiming it was for unexplained "incidentals" -- what incidentals?  Terrible service.  Idiots who work there and rude to boot.Convenient, clean, quiet, big rooms, and very close to airport.  The staff was excellent, the amenities top notch, and the service was on par with higher end hotels.  The gym was one of the best gyms I've ever seen in a hotel.  There were indoor and outdoor versions of everything (pools, hot tubs, sitting areas, etc.) so the hotel was great for all seasons. Although not quite a resort, you could do everything you needed to do without leaving the premises.The beds were very comfortable.The building is obviously a bit on the older side and the bathrooms are fairly plain, but everything was clean and the service was great.I brought a large group to this hotel, contracted the rooms, and was very pleased.  The manager catered to our needs and I will definitely come back here again, with a group or by myself.The free breakfast (open from 5 AM to 10 AM) was to-order off a menu and the food/service was good.  They routinely messed up the orders, but I honestly didn't care when all was said and done.There are large meeting rooms and a large atrium for social events.You can walk to the airport from here.  And Applebees and the Cattle Baron (steak restaurant) are in the parking lot.Even though I'm convinced I saw a ghost here (feel free to message me for the details), this hotel is a great option for business travelers, families and casual travelers.  For starters, the location is amazing. It's literally 200 yards from the airport, but situated in such a way that somehow you don't really hear any noise from the airplanes. Perhaps it's because it's a small airport so there's just not that much traffic? Not sure, but it's never been a problem for me.  Because of the close location, the shuttle takes less than 5 minutes to arrive and has always been staffed by a friendly driver, eager to provide recommendations on local hits.  The shuttle will also take you anywhere within a 3 mile radius, which includes numerous restaurants, 2 different malls, Target, Costco and Walmart!Rooms are big and well-maintained, each equipped with a flat-screen tv, nice coffee maker and independently controlled thermostat.  Most rooms also have a fridge and microwave (you might need to search for it- sometimes it's hidden in a closet). All stays come with a complimentary breakfast which is prepared just for you in their restaurant. You get a choice about about 10 different entrees, which include an awesome omelet and really good steel-cut oatmeal. Coffee, juice and soda are also included with breakfast.  The hotel has a daily happy hour for all guests which includes free chips and salsa, popcorn, and 2 complimentary drinks (draft beer, house wine, or soda.) It's a nice perk at the end of the work day. The Radisson has both an indoor and outdoor pool and hot tub, both of which are clean and well-working. The 24 hour fitness facility is also a great perk!  All the beds are Sleep Number, which contrary to popular belief, I've never found to be that comfortable. No dig on the business, I just don't like the beds. Perhaps you will :)And free wifi. For your entire stay.So as I sit in my room typing this with no Internet service or television you may be able to sense what the tone of this review will be. Apparently there is a cable service provider problem which I fully understand happens. What I don't understand is how they deal with the issue. Let me start from the beginning. Attempt to check in at the Marriott next door but was turned away because they were full. Marriott front desk staff courteously called the Radisson and inquired about rooms. They informed me all they had left were "deluxe" suites at $198 per night. I felt stuck so I took it. What was strange was when I arrived to see a fairly empty parking lot and not much activity in the bar and lobby. This was confirmed also the next day when I overheard the front desk staff offer a "regular" guest room to someone checking in to be closer to another guest. This is when I discovered the Internet and television were out. I had to leave the hotel and work from a Starbucks all day to get done what I needed. I then returned hoping all would be well, not so. I figured the front desk would be amenable to a reduced rate but when I inquired they looked at me like I had 3 heads. I believe the response was "we pay for the service  and its not our fault it's down." Guess what, I agree its not your fault. What is your responsibility is to insure an excellent customer experience. If that means a rate reduction when you can't meet your commitments so be it. Am I way off base here? This property could have turned lemons into lemonade all by how they addressed this problem. Let it be a lesson to all of us in customer service.WON'T BE BACK!!!!!!!My third stay here in 2 years and time to express my feelings.The staff are great. The facility and its maintenance are horrid.My first room (had to get moved due to lack of water thanks Notre Dame football team) had a toilet that didnt flush, hair dryer not working, and half the lights in the room not working.I then got moved to a "business class room:", bigger but with a poor thermostat. temperature swings didn't allow sleep. by the time, I turned on the TV, there were only 12 stations, half in  Spanish and nothing outside of networks. There's a a Marriott next door that will get my business next time.
review_content_20: We checked in on what (in my opinion) was the worse night/morning of the year...it was 3 am and snowing in El Paso...who knew it snowed in Texas?!?! Anyhow, we picked this Radisson because it looked nice and was on top of the airport. The room was clean and up to date with a flat screen TV, free WiFi etc. Remember, I said it was snowing so it was very cold and the room was about 60 degrees when we walked in...once I realized it took more than my lame college education to figure out the thermostat I called the front desk...did I say we checked in at 3 am?...they sent maintenance he managed to turn the heat on and as soon as he left the heater started knocking...as in loud knocking...repeatedly. I was too tired to called the front desk and managed to sleep through it. Other than that it was about what you can expect to stay in a hotel as such.Hotel was nice. Service was excellent. They will take you anywhere in a 3 mile radius. Sleep comfort bed only had two settings. Hard or soft.  Heat was set at 71 but went up to 85.  I woke up drenched in sweat.  A little on the old side but it was convenient to airport.Wow! I have been to El Paso for 4 different visits over the past 2 years and this was my first time staying at the Radisson.  I sure wish I had tried it on the previous visits...I wouldn't go anywhere else.  The accommodations and service are wonderful. The sleep number beds are very comfy, the bedding is luxurious. We were in a small (not deluxe or lux) king room since I booked at the last minute...but, it was still roomy enough for hubby and I, super clean, and nicely appointed. The complimentary drinks and breakfast are fun as well as yummy.  All of the  staff is top tier all the way from the desk to the services.  Finally, the gym is truly awesome for an airport hotel...Outfitted with commercial quality equipment.I was there for a 2-day trade show. The staff was very friendly and helpful, especially the banquet staff. The food was pretty good. We had a "box lunch," which was delicious and fresh. The first night my group arranged for a reception. The appetizers were really tasty and flavorful. The bacon-wrapped shrimp was a huge hit. The hotel hosts a Manager's Happy Hour giving every guest two (that's 2) free drinks - Woo Hoo! The bar staff was very and fun too.The rooms were nice. I only stayed one night and didn't spend much time there. They have those adjustable beds where you had to pick a "sleep number." The control to my bed didn't display the numbers. I thought I had made the entire bed as firm as possible. Nope. One side was firm and high, the other side was ultra-soft. I rolled over and there was a noticeable drop. After I stopped laughing, I fixed both sides to be equal and slept very well.The only thing I didn't like was the check-in time became a moving target. I arrived at 10:30am, knowing my room wouldn't be ready, and was told I could get into my room at 1pm. Well, 1pm became 1:30...1:30 became 2, then 2:30, and finally checked in at 3pm. Not sure what caused the delay. If it's supposed to be a 3pm check-in, they should've just told me.They have an on-site restaurant and bar.  Breakfast was good. It's table service with hot breakfast cooked to order from a select menu. There is a full menu available too. From what others told me, lunch was good as well. There is plenty of parking in the back, and the hotel is really close to a lot of restaurants and some shopping. I'll probably stay here if I'm ever in El Paso for another overnight stay.9/12/1010I ordered dinner in the bar while watching football. The Philly Cheese Steak sandwich was small compared to the $10.95 price. Go elsewhere for meals.They promptly picked me up at the El Paso Airport with one phone call. My room was on the first floor, with a French door opening out to the outdoor pool / jacuzzi area. It was very nice. It had a King-sized Sleep Number bed, which was interesting. When I laid down on it, I realized it was nothing more than an expensive air mattress with a lot of padding on top! I won't fault the Radisson for it, but a Tempurpedic would have been much more comfortable! Despite the hotel's location next to the airport, my room was very quiet. The Manager's Reception in the bar was a blast; you get two free drinks (beer, wine or soft drinks). They serve a full, cooked-to-order breakfast in the morning (included). The hotel has beautiful architecture and public spaces, and all of the staff members I came into contact with were friendly and helpful. The Radisson El Paso was so nice, I wished I could stay longer.

review_content: This was the second time I have stayed at this location.I was upgraded to a King Suite.  The room was very spacious and the bed was really comfortable.  The staff are friendly, helpful, and seem to enjoy what they do.  The breakfast is the standard I see at all Holiday Inn Express hotels.This location offers chips with homemade salsa and soft drinks in the lobby at 5:30.  The salsa is FANTASTIC .I usually stay at The Doubletree on my trips to El Paso, but it was all booked up, probably due to the visit from Il Papa.  My secretary put me in the Holiday Inn Express instead. Not bad...not bad at all. The furniture in the room was a little weird, but I got used to it and it was very functional.  It appeared to be pretty new. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was a clean as a pin. What impressed me the most was the lobby (recently updated, it appeared), and the breakfast area.  It was super clean, modernly appointed and decorated, and the food was actually pretty decent...they had the egg omelette thingys that were pretty good. Great coffee. The staff were very nice. This hotel was walking distance to several decent bars. Overall, not a bad place to stay.I have stayed at many 3 to 5 star hotels, most in California. This hotel took much pride in their customer service. My stay was exceptional and everything i needed to a microwave, at no charge, even to providing the dolly for my luggage was brought to my room. I even arrived at 11 o'clock in the morning and they provided me a room by 11:30 My stay was on February 20, 2016 .I did not get the name of the gentleman that answered the phone every time that afternoon and evening but hands-down he was the most pleasant and accommodating staff member I have ever spoke to on the phone. I was treated like royalty! I must've had one of the renovated rooms I was on the ninth floor and it was a very nice room for an extremely low price. Shuttle service to the airport was also provided which was FREE!Its like a mash-up of the St. Frances Motel in the movie Big where Tom Hanks cries himself to sleep and a real Holiday Inn Express. - Room's carpet and paint were still off-gassing, I kept my door open for a hour to reduce the smell- Halls and stairwell look like something from a procedural crime drama, scary- Thermostat in the room was 72 degrees or off.  Take it or leave it- Lobby and room had been recently remolded (++)It could get two more stars with a little more training and completing the renovation.  I will try it again in a few months.The hotel is in a great location with parking close by but the rooms are outdated. Some of the rooms are updated and nice, make sure to ask for the renovated rooms cause the old ones should be discounted.Something I just realized: I'm a lot like William H Macy in 'The Cooler.'We're both kinda ginger-y, we both show signs of premature aging, and everything we touch breaks or mysteriously reaches a state of disrepair. It's a gift really. I came here, checked in, took the elevator up to my room, tried to come back down and it was broken. I brought some leftover back to my room, wanted to put them in the mini fridge, it wasn't working. I start fudging with the mini fridge, trying to get it to work, then not only is it not working, but it also starts making an internal noise that sounds like there's a little man inside sandpapering the icebox. Le sigh. Or as some would say in El Paso, 'El sigh.' The hotel itself was fine, I think I just got a lemon... which is what usually happens to me. The staff were beyond friendly. Truly. Hats off and 5-stars to them. Richard, the shuttle driver, was just about the nicest man ever. He was exactly the kinda guy you want to pick you up from the airport when you've just spent the last 5 hours on 4 different flights and could use a little cheering up. When I arrived the woman at the front desk (who the sign told me was the general manager) was no different. Just as sweet as can be and she even let me check into my room 4 hours earlier than the regularly scheduled check-in time.  I loved that the hotel had a shuttle that'll take you to/from the airport or anywhere within 2 miles of the hotel. And I know normally when hotels say that the shuttle is almost always mysteriously unavailable when you want to use it, but that wasn't the case here. In fact, I saw my previously shuttle driver (Richard) in the lobby the second day of my stay and he practically chased me down to see if I needed a ride. I was actually kind of sad to say no and that my friend was actually waiting out front for me. The hotel is pretty run of the mill otherwise. They have a really small outdoor pool just off the lobby, though it was closed for winter during my stay. My room overlooked El Amigo Bail Bonds and I could see all the way over to the famous Juarez 'X'. They have a continental breakfast in the morning that I never woke up in time for, but on Thursday evening I got back to the hotel early in the evening and their was some sort of left over buffet set up in the lobby. Most everything had already been ransacked, but I did manage to gank a cookie... that was burnt but in the good way. I wasn't even hungry but I couldn't help but scarf it down. The have free wifi and the TV had basic channels, a few cable one likes MTV, VHI, and all the other ones that used to be educational but now only show ridiculous reality shows, and HBO. The little paper slip that had all the channels and numbers on it was pretty badly stained with something yellow. That was kinda gross, but of course I still picked it up and put it on my nightstand because my love for TV is stronger than my gross-stuff gag reflex. What I didn't enjoy was that the elevator (that broke basically as soon as I got there) wasn't able to be fixed during my entire stay. They still had one other elevator, but it was so slooow having to wait for every floor and everyone else staying at the hotel PLUS, all the construction guys were using it so you basically had to take the stairs unless you had an extra 10 minutes to wait, and wait, and wait. And what I REALLY didn't enjoy was being woken up every morning from the sounds of my room walls shaking and the sounds of drill and buzz saws and other noises that make it impossible to sleep, work, concentrate, etc. Not ideal. Also, the shower head and water pressure suuuucks but I'm also kind of a hotel water pressure snob so it might be fine for others. This isn't my first choice of place to stay when I come back to El Paso, but it's in a decent area, within walking distance from a few cool spots and ranks as a solid 'OK' in my book.We enjoyed this hotel tremendously. 1. The staff is extremely focused on Customer Service2. AWESOME pool (nice and warm3. INCREDIBLE free BreakfastIt would be 5 stars, except there were NO towels at the pool! What else is new? This is a typical problem at these hotels... NO FREAKING TOWELS AT THE POOL!!!!!There are old rooms and new rooms. make sure you get a new room. the showers are weird but other than that it's a nice hotel in a good location and the staff is very helpful when they want to help.I believe this was my first ever Holiday Inn Express experience, so maybe the rating is more out of uneducated expectations.  Let me give the positives first; free breakfast and wi-fi and girly bath and body works amenities.  The negative, I was scared out of my mind by a homeless man in the parking lot on the way in (not hotels fault) which gave me an unsafe feeling from the get-go.  The furniture in the room was beat up and the gym equipment barely functioning. The omelet that I got out of the breakfast buffet was frozen.  And lastly, it is across from a bail bond building.  I would give it 2 stars but felt the staff was too nice for that.Nice hotel clean comfortable. Good transportation to airport and convention center. Rooms nice clean, big TV, small pool but its downtown so its cozy. A little loud from the highway, but only outside at pool. Inside no nose from outside. Good nice access to and from all areas. Staff very pleasant, helpful, and asking how everything is for you very nice.The location is amazing and right off the highway. The building itself is much older. I'm glad they finally fixed the elevator, he had been broken for months. The breakfast bufffet is simple and tasty. I do like that they have soft/hard pillow options which I don't see anywhere else. I will stay again for convience off the highway and price.So you're heading to El Paso and most of your budget is for great Mexican food and tequila!  You're on the hunt for a budget hotel and this HI Express will meet your need very nicely.* Clean rooms and a solid housekeeping staff to keep them that way.* Speaking of staff; everyone here is super friendly.* Like every HIE, free breakfast.* Nice location. Downtown is two blocks away.* Free airport shuttle.* Lots of deals on the room rate with many folks getting way under $100 night.Save some $$ by staying here and you'll have enough to try that crazy Texas-sized one gallon margarita!I felt bad giving them 4 stars instead of 5 because really we had such a good time and the staff was so nice. THEN to top it off, i read that Anson mother-effer's review, and it's clear to me that he's a racist douchebag, so to make up for his bias, i am upping this to 5 stars. Don't listen to a guy who says condescending things about spanish speaking people.and anson, maybe if you hate trying to communicate with people who speak spanish, you should stay away from el paso. i'm sure they won't miss you.Breakfast was one of the best "free" continental we have EVER had. Great variety, fresh and always stocked full. Rooms were nice. Our room always felt a little damp and the even with the air the coldest it could go never got cold. Pool was closed so couldn't use it but was very small. The work out room isn't much of a workout room. Had 2 tredmills, 1 elliptical and 1 bike. The elliptical wasn't a very good one do be careful not to hurt yourself on it. One day around 6 they had chips/salsa/nacho cheese and cans of pop in the lobby for people to snack on. Not sure if they did this every day but it was nice of them. We were here for a bowling tournament at the convention center about 7 blocks away. Free shuttles were available from the hotel. The walk wasn't bad we usually did that. As soon as we got our luggage at the airport I called the hotel and with in 15 mins Cruze (the driver) picked us up. He was very nice and gave us some info and restaurants and things to do around town. I would stay at this hotel againHotel is fine, but we have a room on the 7th floor and the wi-fi signal is balls slow :(that being said, great continental breakfast.  They have a little shuttle outside that will take you anywhere within 2 miles of the hotel.  We went to a Mexican restaurant down the street.   The Holiday Inn  has some computers in the lobby that have full speed internet which is what I'm writing this review on.  Free newspapers and Repubican Fox news on blast in the lobby which makes for good jokes and commentary while you're eating breakfast.  Warp speed elevator gets you where you need to go promptly.  The premises is well maintained and clean.  Free coffee in the lobby.  Small work out facilities w/ treadmills and elliptical (no weights).   If they could fix the slow Wifi in the hotel rooms, this would be a perfect holiday inn express.  $50 a night.....  pretty good value.Becoming a fan of the Holiday Inn Expresses.  Maybe the Gypsyhawk tour hotel for 2013???Budget hotel done right. Comfy beds a la Westin's Heavenly collection and dogs welcomed. A hot continental breakfast will greet you in the morning and USA Today slides under your door for a homerun. Thanks Holiday Inn.Terrible. Terrible. Terrible. I would use the term shit-hole but need to maintain my credibility in this review.  I worked a substantial amount of time in the hotel industry. Over 10 years with Marriott. And for the longest time only stayed in Marriott owned properties. Over time others have tried to convince me that I should try other chains. Repeatedly I have been disappointed with anything bearing the name of Holiday Inn. Every time the property has been hanging by a thread between being approved by building inspectors and condemnation. This property must have paid off the aforementioned building inspector. You can tell the outside of this property and lobby have been remodeled but the budget ceased there. The rooms are still old with low ceilings, dingy carpet and walls, and everything feels slighty musty and sticky.But at least in the morning I was going to be able to have those delicious cinnamon rolls. Wrong. Wrong. Wrong. Wrong. In the morning there were no cinnamon rolls. None when I arrived and and the breakfast attendant informed me they were terminado and there would be no mas. This was an  hour before breakfast was over. I would have attempted to complain but my espanol is limited. This will be my final stay at any property owned and operated by Holiday Inn and I suggest you do the same.PS. I tried to come up with some whitty quip about "dumber for staying at a holiday inn last night" in mockery of their baseless commercials. Nothing clever came to mind, but you can eagerly anticipate an addition to this review when one does.Cheap hotel right downtown. It's nice that we could have walked anywhere. The front desk guy was nice. The beds were pretty comfortable and they even had cable on tv! They have a lot of free amenities like shaving creme and toothpaste, which I took advantage of since I didn't bring any. The next morning, we had breakfast in the lobby which was alright. Small hotel, small dining area. I did like that they have an automatic pancake maker! Made it real simple even though it took a while to make a pancake. They were really nice since they had someone serving everyone their eggs and sausages. They even had gravy! They had a pretty good selection.It sucked that I tried walking down the stairs to the lobby, but it only went to the second floor or outside to the swimming pool! I had to walk back up to the second floor just to take the elevator... wth? Our room did have a nice view of the freeway and the light up star. Awesome!The customer service at this hotel goes so far beyond what you would expect!  My husband & I arrived in El Paso after a very long drive from CA only to find that our rental home wasn't ready. We were traveling w/our two dogs and had to find a hotel quickly. The hotel staff booked us in for the night very quickly and we had a very comfortable nights stay. That should have been the end of it, but the rental still wasn't ready the next day or the next after thst!  The staff was so accommodating  allowing us late ck outs everyday until we could find out if we could get into our home then extending our stay each night when we couldn't . They were real lifesavers!!! I say staff and I mean it everyone was just fantastic!!!Outdated - in need of refurbishing.  LOUD if your room is facing the highway - Terribly loud traffic noise.  Ask for the opposite side which faces the county courthouse and Amigo Bail Bonds.  The breakfast is OK, but the coffee is incredibly weak - like brown-tinted water.  One of the two elevators was out-of-service, had been that way for quite some time.
review_content_20: I am currently staying at this hotel and I have not come up with any concerns or complaints. Sure it's not the newest hotel in town, but they seem to take care of it well. The staff has been friendly, helpful, and courteous. As this is relatively close to where I'm working, I would not hesitate to stay here again. Also, the review by Claud Q is still accurate.This hotel rocks! I traveled to El Paso for a week on business and didnt really know what I would get at this HI (they are all kind of hit or miss) and here is why I really liked my stay:1. First of all, I found a great sale on Orbitz, under $100 a night2. FREE Everything: WiFi, Breakfast (limited selection but whatever), rooms come with a microwave and refrigerators (neat for a week-long traveler like me), VERY decent gym, a "library" you can just check out like dozens of cool books, and they have a little afternoon 'happy hour' where they offer chips and salsa and soft drinks. And my fave: you can do your own laundry there VS paying for expensive hotel valet laundry service that costs an arm and a leg. 3. The staff is Sooooo nice, they went above and beyond at all times and they are genuinely friendly and professional. 4. Free shuttle to/from the airport5. Located in the heart of Downtown and very close to the trendy areas near UTEP and Downtown. PS to the first reviewer, by the time I checked out this week they were installing brand new carpeting throughout the entire hotel.The exterior and lobby appear to make this look like a nice hotel. Don't be fooled; my room is very dirty, see posted photo. For 120 a night I would hope my toilet lid would hold it self up, the shower head would not have green mold on it, and the tub and sInk would  be clean.

review_content: Comfortable stay, clean rooms, complimentary breakfast, and right off the freeway. It's kinda nice staying at a place like this when you're a road warrior. It has some of the creature comforts of home - - a fridge, microwave, dishwasher, table, and microwave popcorn just waiting to be popped. Bed's pretty comfortable. One suggestion: when checking in, ask to stay on the side opposite the freeway, so you don't hear all the traffic. There's a TON of trucks and stuff on the 10.I have some mixed feelings about our stay here. I appreciate their military family rate as we are here to visit my husband activated to Fort Bliss. What I like about their suites was the option to get a suite with a bedroom door that closes and separates you from the pull out in the living area. This has allowed us to have some private time . The hot breakfast is pretty much what you would expect from a hotel, as well as the rooms. However the accommodations aren't what I would expect from a Hilton. Nothing special about the bed or bedding, not your typical Hilton quality. The wifi pretty much never works in our room. When I have called about it I just got a response that no one else has complained, it might be the wind, and they will try and reset the router. Been here a couple of days now and have yet to have an instance of it steadily working for more then 10min to a half hour without the service going in and out. The network won't even always show up and never has more then 2 bars of signal strength. Perhaps having wifi wouldn't be a big deal as I'm not here to work, but the tv channels are slim with little programming options appealing to my 3 year old. I will probably look into other options for our next visit but with the good rate and privacy may stay again.Ok place to stay, but its time for an update.  Furniture and finishes in the room were old, beat up and in need of replacement.Great hotel, rate was awesome, very clean, we loved the layout of the rooms, bed was comfy too! The only thing that I considered a drawback was trekking all over hotel for vending machines (they don't have them) so I trek all the way down to the front desk to buy some out of the little "guest shop" only to be told they are $2.50 a bottle. Why must these hotels try and make a killing off water??!! Breakfast wasn't that appealing either...they don't serve waffles anymore and I didn't see any fruit or yogurt.Stayed there two weeks in August and the service was ok.  The hotel was clean but when I got to my room there was hair on the bathroom door and in the tub.  Once that got cleaned up the stay was as expected.  The only real concern is that this is a pet friendly hotel (which I don't mind) but hearing a dog barking throughout the night as you're trying to sleep is a big setback, but not the hotel's fault.  The Breakfast was ok for a small hotel, not a lot of variety.I am not warning anyone away from this hotel, but if you are the type of person who reads yelp reviews before reserving a hotel, you will find some issues with El Paso Homewood Suites. The hotel is fairly worn - we had significant spots on the carpet, slight smudges on the wall, some mold in the bathroom, and the bathtub drained very slowly. But the room was clean and generally habitable. Also, I think the hotel should hire a few more staff. Everyone was professional and friendly. However, they seemed to be stretched.Great hotel, the staff is friendly and the rooms are clean.  There is free WiFi (slow)  fridge, stove, sink & microwave.  If you want quiet don't get a room facing the interstate.I stayed at this hotel for one week for business. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay. The staff was very courteous and friendly to all guests. The rooms are excellent with a kitchen, full size refrigerator and dishwasher. There is no need for the kitchen because the hotel provides an adequate breakfast and dinner to all guests. They even provide wine during the dinner happy hour. Nice hotel with all necessary amenities within 1mile. If you have an extended stay in El Paso stay here.I stayed at this location since I was in El Paso for 5 weeks on a work assignment. I'm a fan of Hilton properties so I was glad this is where work chose to book me. I also appreciate the ridiculous amount of Hilton Honor's points I earned for my weeks here. The hotel staff was friendly. Room was comfortable. I really can't complain. While I hope I never have to spend so much time in El Paso again (sorry Texans), this place made the stay tolerable.Homewood without a Fitted Bottom Sheet?Shower was lethally slippery.IH-10 noise a constant.But it is after all, El Paso!I stayed when the hotel first opened and really like my stay (3 months). The food was good. Breakfast was the normal eggs and a meat. Dinner was something that was a meal (Meat, 2 sides, salad, bread, and drinks)(Even if I got in late I could call ahead and a plate would be in my room). Laundry right next to the gym so drop your things and get on the treadmill/bike.I stopped by on August 1, 2014 around 10pm at night, because we booked a reservation through the Hilton Honors Points customer service phone line.  We specifically told them that we need a hotel that accepts a small dog.  When I arrived to the Homewood Suite in El Paso, Texas, the front desk customer service agent was not helpful in regard to my small dog.  She wanted to charge us $75 for our dog, but we told her that the Hilton Honors Points customer service agent did not tell us their was a fee for our small dog to stay, and the Homewood Suites front desk customer service agent did not care that their partner company mislead us.  She said we still have to pay $75 if our dog stayed.  I told her that we didn't have the money in our budget for the $75, and our only option is to wake up early to get our dog from my car, before it gets hot.  I told her that I had a baby boy, and we are all tired so late at night from driving across country in Texas.  She did not care that I had a baby boy too at 10pm at night.  She was a ruthless uncaring front desk customer service agent!  We decided to stay somewhere else.I found the hotel adequate.  The rooms were too big in my opinion.  And the walk to the rooms seemed kind of long.  Lots of highway noise on the highway side.  The bed was too soft.  And the light switch fan thing was confusing.

The Ritz it ain't. So if you're looking for some fancy hotel, this is not the place for you. However, if you're looking for a very reasonably priced, simple, clean, friendly, and did I mention-- cheap-- place, then this is it!My family of four stayed here thanksgiving week to visit with my son who's stationed at Fort Bliss. We arrived earlier than the check in time, but Hazel was very accommodating. She said our room would be ready in 10 minutes, and invited us to enjoy some beverages while we waited. She was vey friendly and professional. We stayed in a two room King suite. The room was modest, but clean and spacious. The room had a separate sitting area with a couch and small dining table. It also had a small refrigerator, microwave and coffee pot. The bathroom was very large, and the shower was a full-spray (no water saving here!).  Yes, the toilet did plug up. Housekeeping was very quick to bring us a plunger, and we kept it on hand, just in case. ;)The continental breakfast wasn't the best I've had, but there were quite a few options to choose from.  The hotel also boasts a pool, fitness center and computers for public use. The staff was very friendly throughout our stay. They made us feel right at home. We will definitely stay here again. :)I can't figure out how to delete this. So I will correct my self. I'm at the other locations in the west of El Paso.Stayed here a couple days for a wedding. Clean, large rooms. Shared a king bed and slept great! Breakfast is good. Our party took over the breakfast room each am and stated past breakfast closing time. And staff was super friendly and even left the food and drinks out for an extra hour.Only downside is occasional noise from nearby airport.Would recommend staying hereWe have checked into this hotel a little over 3 times.Love the hotel,the breakfast and the gym in the lobby area.Definitely worth the price and the stay.I have to travel with work so I stay at a lot of motels. This room is the nicest I have stayed in without spending twice the price. After reading the reviews I have to wonder is this the same place. I stayed 5 nights and had a great stay. The only thing I did not like was the eggs in the hot breakfast, but they had plenty of other items to start off my days. My room layout: full bath and sink in bathroom, 12' x 12' living area with couch and bar separating the bed with a frig, microwave, coffee pot, and sink. My room had the king sized bed. Internet was both wired and wireless. If you are looking for a place to stay in El Paso then I recommend the GuestHouse Suites. You won't be sorry.I reserved my room through Orbitz and arrived a day early without any issues.Absolutely amazing! When we arrived in El Paso February 2013 we were so amazed at the service, complimentary breakfast, and I am not talking about fruits and bagels, I am talking about waffles, bacon, eggs! And they even have like a happy hour at 5PM where they serve popcorn, wine, sodas, nachos, it is the all time favorite. The staff is WONDERFUL!! Quick and speedy service.Which brings me to my family leaving El Paso, we are back here again, and we are in a different room, and despite that our room doesn't have the flat screen TV or remote control, we are so grateful for the continuing service that GuestHouse Suites has provided for us. We now have a son and he sleeps in the pullout couch with all the room he wants. It is just sooooooo great to be leaving El Paso at the BEST hotel in town!! Great job!Uh... This place sucks 2 mins ago I was just plunging my own toilet in my hotel room. Everything is very old decor. I actually use to like this place up until the moment I asked to switch rooms because my toilet was clogged. The lady working the font desk just brought me a plunger... Sweet...Aside from their random TV placement (directly facing the pony wall that separates the "bedroom" from the "living room"), I'm a big fan of this hotel. Airport hotels are generally lacking all things comfortable, but not this one. The beds are comfy, the AC blows COLD, there are 2 outlets AND light switches by BOTH bedsides (cha-ching!), fast free wifi, and has the kind of continental breakfast Europe wouldn't be embarrassed to have named after them (we're talking hash browns and real -not instant- eggs). All rooms have a wet bar with fridge, microwave and coffee maker and a pull out couch. Party time! ...?Note for the light sleepers: not only is this hotel inside the airport boundaries, it also has train tracks running through the front lawn. While I've never been awoken from the local transportation, I've also slept through several earthquakes so I'd suggest you pack your earplugs!The bed is horrible, you would be about as comfortable on the floor. The bedding is awful, as are the pillows.  The Internet service is sporadic at best and often didn't work at all.  The only response we got from the manager was  that she had never heard those complaints before. (right ;-/).   We did finally get a $50 dollar refund on our $550 bill.  The only good things I can say for the place is that it was clean and the continental breakfast was adequate.  We moved on to the Radisson for the rest of our stay in El Paso.Do not stay here.  The walls are paper thin and you can hear the conversation of the next room.  In my case the people next door were drunk and I believe they were participating in the services of a lady of the night.  THEIR was awoken at 1 am in the morning by loud and raunchy conversation.  I'll spare you the details.  Lets just say it was so weird and scary that I requested that I be moved to another room.  I won't stay here again

We checked in at O'dark 30 after traveling all day. Maria was so very nice! Its not the Ritz, but our room was clean, smelled nice and was warm. What made this a 5 star review?  Maria and her customer service. PS: they give a Military discount.This place does not even rate a start.. My room was not made up.. They tout renovated rooms but the hotel is run down and the room are bare bones with old beds.. My bathroom light was cracked with a big hole in the cover and the ceiling stucco was falling down with holes in the ceiling.. I would not recommend this place to anyone.No microwave or fridge,  no coffee pot, wifi and cable sux, i wont stay again... room was clean though  lolI read the reviews so I have to say they redid  the place very updated modern look. Smoke free hotel now. At least a 2 1/2 star hotel. They have  flatscreen TVs in every room now. But some rooms don't have microwaves or refrigerators like mines but it has a nice pool. Staff was friendly and help me out when one of my sinks did not drain. They try fixing it but traded me rooms. So over all I liked it. Oh yea it's a Pet friendly hotel so it bump my rating up. I love my dog!I rarely stay at Red Roof Inns, but I was told by a friend that they don't charge an additional pet fee like most places, so I decided to try it out. Upon arriving, I asked the (not very friendly) clerk if any of the outside rooms were available, he said that he "didn't know" and that he would have to check if any were ready. At this time most people get on a phone or walkie-talkie to contact the housekeeping staff and inquire about the rooms. Instead, he told me to "come back in a half of hour," so that he can check. Really??? I was too tired and travel weary to go seeking another pet friendly hotel and I liked the location of this one so I chose to wait. I just walked my dog around the parking lot. When I went back in he said that he had a room ready, but neglected to say that there was no fridge or microwave in the room, items that come standard in most hotels. When I went to the front desk to ask, he told me "the king size rooms have them, but not the singles." Since I planned to stay only one night I didn't see it as a big deal, but it would have been nice to know. Another thing he forgot to mention was that there was no wifi. When I learned this, I went to ask the front desk and encountered another clerk, ruder then the first, and he told me that "the wifi has been down for several days." I asked for the location of their laundry facility and he told me they did not have one. I told him it would be nice if the check-in clerk would have mentioned these things and he just shrugged his shoulders and went about his business as if I wasn't there. The next morning realizing I needed to stay in town one more day and not wanting to load my car just to unload it at another hotel, I chose to stay in the room I had. When I went to the front desk to extend there was a female there, I asked her about the Internet and she said "that side of the building doesn't have any." A different answer from the night clerk and just as ridiculous. I asked how could one side of the hotel not have Internet and she said that "they have tried but haven't been able to get a signal on that side." What??? What kind of archaic Internet are they using? All they need is a router extender or an additional router placed in that area so guests can pick up the signal. It's not complicated. While I was talking to her the television on the wall was playing promotional adverts for Red Roof Inn and one of the promises for guests was "wifi in every room," well, that's false advertisement. I told her they should change that and she mentioned that another guest said the same thing.As for the room, very basic, and very much in need of an upgrade.  The furnishings were old, stained, and in some cases ruined. The tub & sink was cracked and stained. The small round table in the room and two chairs were old, dirty, and scratched. The dresser was ruined on the bottom and the rug looked like it hadn't been vacuumed. Speaking of, there was hair, not mine, on the bathroom sink and toilet. The towels could use replacing, they were old and dingy. The shower head was covered in mildew, the vent in dust. On the dresser there was a room service menu that when I picked it up I regretted it instantly because there was a black, sticky substance on it. The room made me glad I travel with my own towels and blankets. I did like that the beverage vending machine in the lobby had a debit/credit card option for those who don't have change or cash on them. Though, when I went to get a water, there was another clerk on night shift duty (second night) and when I entered the lobby he had his head down so I walked up to the desk and said hello and he glanced up said a monotone hello and put his head back down. So rude! For all he knew I was a newly arriving guest coming to check in and he didn't bother to ask me if I needed help, he pretty much ignored me. I don't know what the hiring process is for this hotel, but evidently the ruder you are, the more desirable you are. Personally I think if you're not a 'people person' you shouldn't work in the hospitality industry. Overall, if you're not picky and just want an inexpensive room to shower in and sleep for a night or two, then this isn't horrible. After all, it is close to many things, such as the highway, stores, restaurants, and the New Mexican border with a beautiful view outside, and best part, no pet fee.  If you want somewhere nicer and more updated with a friendlier staff this is not the place for you. I know I will not recommend this place, and if this is an example of all Red Roof Inns, I won't be staying at any ever againI always choose this hotel when I come through El Paso. It's priced right and the rooms are just fine for a night. I like to walk over to the Mexican restaurant or Cracker Barrel.Better than expected. Cute room and pool.Don,t believe the yelp's on here this place sucks, noise, freeway,T V , bed ,room this place needs to be remove as a hotel I CANT SAY ANYTHING EXCEPT   RUN FOREST RUN  AND DON'T STOPThis place was really a dud. Well for $60, on the side of the freeway, what should you expect? Microwave buzzed all night, room was very loud with freeway noise, and toilet ran. TV was 20 years old and room looked to be 30 years old - at least. Best part was that you could book last second.If you're looking for a 4-star (in hotelese) hotel, this is not it.  This hotel is clean and the staff is very friendly and helpful.  Vickie was the desk clerk when we checked in and she went out of her way to get us extra bedding so that we (2 adults & 4 children) could stay in the same room.  Getting 1 room for our family has been an issue at many other hotels.  Also convenient that it's right across the street from Walmart.

I loved staying here! I like how they are so clean and the beds were so comfortable! It was the best hotel ive stayed in. The breakfast is free & great as well compared to other hotels that have breakfast. I would definately recommend anyone to stay here. Had no problems at all. :)Very nice & cozy!  Friendly front desk staff. I stayed here for one night while on a business trip. This hotel is conveniently located right off I-10, with direct access to shopping, gas, site-seeing and restaurants. I was very happy with the location & overall feel of the hotel. My stay was very pleasant & the room was very clean. I like that there was a fridge & microwave in the room and that there was an indoor pool & jacuzzi. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because of the bathroom. It's a little outdated and the way the door open is a little awkward.  It is right in your face if you're sitting on the toilet & you can't push it back, as there is a stopper there to prevent it from hitting the tub. Also, the lighting in the room is extremely dim, which was a bummer for me as a female trying to apply makeup. Overall, very nice hotel. I would stay there again but they need better lighting.This place gets a solid 4 star rating. It's one of the nicer Choice Hotels offerings not too far away from UTEP. It's really not that far away from a 5 star but the little things wrong do add up. On the plus side there is good water pressure, working ice machines and the rooms aren't old and stinky. The mattresses are so-so but the suite I had was spacious. The WIFI however was pretty crappy and as a business traveler that is important. Plenty of good channels on the TV and being right off Mesa there are plenty of decent places to eat nearby. The people working there were very nice and there was no hassle when I had to extend my visit by a day. Parking can be a hassle. The floors and ceilings tho are as thin as can be. I haven't been to many hotels where the rooms directly above can make so much noise. Be prepared to hear your upstairs neighbor loud and clear at whatever hours they keep.Very clean. Staff is friendly, helpful. Only one negative: Wi-Fi is spotty at best but that's normal for most hotels. Good enough for basic web browsing, but that's about it.Clean and comfortable.  My so and I are driving back to college.  After a 10 hour day of driving it was a relief to find such an affordable, clean place to stay!This was a very nice hotel - probably one of the nicest I had been in awhile. The staff was very accommodating and helped resolved a billing issue very quickly. Well worth the money and we would definitely stay here again.I originally had booked a different place to stay but when I saw the reviews for the Comfort Suites on YELP I cancelled where I was booked and decided to here.  It was the right choice.  This hotel is clean and the people are courteous.  Breakfast was had some nice additions like hard boiled eggs, already peeled!  :-)We usually try and stay at Embassy Suites and I think we will change and start to stay with Comfort Suites more.  We are a large family and it accommodates us fine.  AND the high speed internet is included, which is not at Embassy.Keeping in mind that this is the Choice Hotel chain and not an upper level, high end resort chain, this hotel deserves 5 stars. My family and I have done extensive cross-country USA travel the past few months and  compared to other properties in the chain, this hotel is at the top! The rooms were very clean and adequately spacious. The staff was helpful and efficient. The hotel furnishings, decor and hallways were nicely updated. The rooms were quiet, Several things stood out above other hotels though: Multiple pillows were on the bed and were identified as firm or soft!Four complete sets of towels were available in the room at check in! Not the usual 2. The bed linens were of good quality and made the bed feel almost luxury level on the pillow top mattress.The breakfast room was spacious and had many seats and tables. Breakfast included the usual fare plus more. Cooked eggs, not just hard boiled, whip cream and strawberries for the waffles. Fresh grapefruit halves!The lovely indoor pool included a jacuzzi which is unusual. The fitness room was small but had plenty equipment. The lobby was well appointed. Plenty of free parking.This place was clean, clean , clean!There were a few negatives: mattress was a little lumpy on one side, the pool had no emergency phone, the pool was too hot as though it was spa temperature. I highly recommend this hotel for any traveler. For only $10 more than our preceding night, our stay was 100% improved! And that was a comparison to another hotel in the same Choice Hotel Chain!When back in El Paso we will choose this hotel again!This is one of the nicer roo.s I've had including at Springhill and the Fairfield hotels.  I have to say it is also quieter that both forementioned hotels and very clean.One of the absolutely nicest hotels I've stayed at especially for the price I stayed in room 302 and everything was excellent including the free breakfast. The price of the room was $116 for a double queen after the taxes. The room was very clean and spacious. Most definitely would stay there again.

hotel_name: Days Inn El Paso Airport East
review_content: Stayed here on business for a few days.  For the price I was not expecting much however what I ended up with was a 5 Star experience.  Mr. Pedro Garcia & the entire front desk staff were so amazing & hospitable.  They would go above & beyond their duties to accommodate me & make my stay enjoyable.., & always with a happy & pleasant attitude. Breakfast was v good & Housekeeping does a excellent job as my room was spotless everyday.   VG location w easy access getting onto I-10 .  A big plus for me was that this place is literally surrounded by a number of good restaurants all within a 5 minute walk which allowed me to have some wine w dinner & not be concerned about driving.  Also there's a Super Walmart behind & to the side of this hotel which I used twice during my stay.  Having stayed at many Hotels in El Paso over the years, I would have to say that this place is one of the best deals in town.  I'll be coming back.  Thank you to the staff!!!I wish I could give 0 stars bc this is disgusting. I'm aware it's low on the totem pole for hotels but still? For $75 for 1 night I expect cleanliness at minimum. The pics I posted say it all.Overall, not bad. My buddy and I were looking for a decent, cheap place to stay while looking for houses and this place fit the description. The rooms are clean and the beds and pillows were more comfortable than I was expecting. Recommend this place if you're looking for a cheap place to stay.Stayed here before and it was ok, this time around it seems that quality is slipping. Room has no fridge or microwave, apperantly this is a specialty  item, and the manager will not allow a staff member to get one from an empty room. This is our second room and don't  want to move again.Nothing too fancy about this Days Inn, but the prices are pretty decent. The beds are clean. The room smelled of too much carpet cleaner, but otherwise it was okay. They did have a microwave and a refrigerator in the room (wow you usually have to pay extra for that in your room)! Good news is that it's pet friendly, even though we don't have pets. Laundry available. They have a free breakfast and it's not just a continental type either. They had scrambled eggs, sausage bits, gravy, biscuits, toast, cold cereal, milk, and juices, but they should also have water available too. Free wi-fi, cable tv (didn't watch any), just a place to lay our  heads for my Dad and I's trip from Houston back to San Diego. Good halfway point to our trip home. Easy freeway access. Located near the East end of El Paso off Interstate 10 Freeway. The place has three floors so if you're handicapped, make sure that you state that before booking a room as the only elevator they have is located near the front center of the building. So if you have a room in the back and you can't walk up a few stairs, then you need to make sure you make arrangements.My true test of if I like a place is would I stay there again? My answer is yes! That's my test for places to eat too. Would I eat there again?The price was right.  We really just needed a place to crash while in El Paso for a funeral, and we weren't expecting luxury accommodations. Rooms are reasonable with a standard TV, fridge, microwave.  Our remote didn't work properly, and neither did the buttons on the TV, but I figured a way around it.  The vanity light over the sink was glitchy.  Beds were fine.  Shower had good water pressure.  Staff was nice.  We arrived on a Thursday, and the place was a ghost town, but Friday night the place was hopping and they sold completely out and put up the "no vacancy" sign.Yuck. Dirty bathmat that had dirt marks and a hair on it and small, very thin bath towels that were also dirty. Hotel is old and needs remodeling. The only saving grace is the warm breakfast and the fact that the beds were clean. If all you need is a bed, a lock and some breakfast then this is your place. Don't expect much else.I wasn't expecting much, but needed a cheap place to stay the night during a cross country trip from California to Alabama. I called ahead with a reservation and paid in full (non-refundable). When I arrived, I informed the front desk woman (Ira) that I had a reservation. She looked in her antiquated computer system and simply said "no you don't". She then told me in the snippiest way possible "YOU need to call the reservation company and work this out". I called, and the reservation company apologized and put me on hold to call the front desk. I could hear the whole conversation. Ira was rude and unhelpful to this woman also. Finally when they were able to fax over confirmation that I had in fact reserved the room and paid in full, Ira showed her superior customer service and let me know that the room I reserved was not available and in fact, no smoking rooms were available. She also appeared to take pleasure in letting me know that the room was not refundable. It wasn't until my husband came in demanding a refund that an off duty hotel worker came in to the rescue and gave us a room that was non-smoking but was already smoked in. He promised we could use it as a smoking room and informed us that this booking issue has been happening frequently.After a 14 hour drive, the last thing I want is a rude, ignorant woman talking down to me and taking my hard earned money without giving what I paid for. When I complained the next morning, the GM called and said I should check in next time I am in El Paso and he would "make it right". That was a nice gesture, but I wouldn't deal with that woman even for a free room.The room itself is what you would expect for a $52 room. Old, worn down, but clean. No roaches or horrible stains. Just shabby motel room, which I have no problem with. I just hate dealing with rude, lazy, people!We had been staying in Days Inn whilst traveling across the country and they were ALL terrible, terrible places to be. I had prepaid this Days Inn (otherwise, I would've looked for a hotel elsewhere). However, this Days Inn was refreshing in being what you would expect from a cheap motel.It wasn't amazing, but it was clean, safe, secure. It was within walking distance of a Walmart, and some delicious food (including an amazing Texas Roadhouse).Bottom line: I would stay here again if I were passing through El Paso. Good location, comfortable beds, and pet friendly.For a quick stop for a nice cat nap, this is an okay place :] I'd first like to stress how absolutely kind the lobby receptionists are. Jonathan, who I believe is the manager, and Delilah were very kind and helpful :] Their amazing customer service is definitely 5 stars. The cleanliness of the hotel is 4 stars. The only problem was the old cigarette smell. Not too huge a deal for me. The comfort of the hotel.. 3 stars. You pay what you get for though, ya know? So I'm pleased with it altogether :] A few extra goodies:* PET FRIENDLY :D !! I have my little girl with me, and love that I don't have to sneak her in like I usually do :ahem: she's spread eagle on the bed right now :D* Complimentary Continental breakfast 6-10am* Free wifi* Ton of cable channels with good reception.* Right off of I-10 :] * laundry roomsThere is a pool and an elevator. Only one elevator, so that's kind of a bummer. Ps.... Majority of the people around this area.. Not the people I typically surround myself with.I stayed here 1 Saturday night in nov 2013 . after nogationing with the man behind the desk I got him to lower the price to $ 58.70 including tax. I didn't  like the hotel at all. loud noise from the I 10 and the elevator. the first room the air condintioner didn't work . he said the plug might be out . I said I checked the plug . so he finally gave me a new room facing the I 10 . the second room the door wouldn't open . he said the door handles were installed upside down so I have to push the door handle up. I should of remembered my 3 stooges movies when curly said you have to use stratatoogie. . dirty room . you need the coupon they give you at check in to eat breakfast or the breakfast Nazi will grab you  by the neck and throw you out the restaurant and into the street  you free loading bums. the nerve of me to think I could just waltz in and eat my free breakfast without going through check point Charlie.After traveling across the country and staying at multiple Days Inn, I was expecting pure failure.The room was clean, although smelled of dust...Overall, nothing was stolen and we slept well after a long day on the road.The staff was great, there was free wifi, and pets are not a problem at all.If you're traveling and need to stay off the highway, I wouldn't look any further.I would like to give 3.5 stars. However, since I can't I will be generous.The nice thing about this hotel is it is right off the freeway and a parallel street with a lot of restaurants on it. Unfortunately, this means you can hear the freeway and street from the room.The structure is 3 stories and has an elevator. The halls that face out to the parking lot can be very slick when wet or icy so be careful. The room was good-sized but not fancy. Inside there was a mini-fridge, microwave, and coffee maker in the room. The internet was pretty quick and no-hassle. They have a continental breakfast that is pretty good but not remarkable.

Very spacious rooms, clean, all the amenities you need, and you can walk to it from your flight. Staff very courteous eager to please. Gym better than most, and plenty of sidewalk if you wants to run outdoors. The swimming area well that's could use some TLC but not much will get it there.After a while my anger has subsided a bit.I feel like no one will take a long review serious.So I've cut it down. I wish there were negative star options but one will have to do.This hotel provided me the WORST experience I have ever had and that's all that needs to be known.Stay here at your own risk, just know that you don't matter to their staff. They are a poor excuse of a company and I am surprised they've gotten this far.This was the worst hotel!!!! Ever!!! Horrible staff Very dirty we ended up just leaving an hour after are stay I had to just file a claim with my bank, because they refused to refund me after we had seen roaches and bed bugs save your time money! And a headache and drive down the street! Yuck yuckJust passing through El Paso and had a great experience at this Hotel. We had been driving for 10 hours straight and this was the only hotel that had a hot tub. The rooms were very nice and spacious and the hotel staff was extremely accommodating. If I am ever in El Paso again I wouldn't pick anywhere else to stay!Would be five stars with new carpet and new upholstery furniture.  The restaurant and breakfast included in my package were above average.  I was here has a business traveler, there are lots of other amenities, like a water park, that I did not experience.Gym equipment is broken. Rooms smell musty and old. Find another hotel. Hotel isn't kept up well and everything seems to be on the verge of breaking. Elevators don't work with key access. Internet continually goes out.Stayed at the Wyndham Airport recently. It was a very average hotel. Comparable to most others I have stayed at in El Paso. The location was good for me. It is right next to the airport and close to Fort Bliss. Had a couple issues with the air conditioning in our room. Maintenance looked at it and it didn't cool off so they moved us to a different room. They were very nice and apologized for the inconvenience. Both of the front desk employees I worked with were great. The pool was decent. Bigger than all the others that I have been to in El Paso. The breakfast was also decent. All in all it was an average experience. Nothing about the hotel will wow you but it is solid for the price.Our next time through El Paso we will surely stay somewhere else. This hotel is dated, worn and filthy.  The front desk staff was lovely and very accommodating when moving us out of our first room which smelled so strongly of cigarettes it made our eyes burn. And the maintenance staff came quickly to our second room to resolve an issue with the lamps not working, so kudos to the staff. Sadly their efforts could not erase the holes in the ceiling, stains on the bedspread, mold in the shower, filthy carpet and worn out furniture.Our overall stay was horrible. The carpets are incredibly dirty, and the furniture is dated. Kimberly at the front desk was really rude and not helpful to any of our needs. The pool was nice but there were a ton of people, leaving trash and towels everywhere. We will definitely not be staying there again. Ever!Stayed here for a conference. Granted the temperature this week was between 108 and 105, but when we walking into our room around 5pm the room was at 77 and the temp was set to 53. There were also 2-3 very large stains on the carpet that were not very nice to look at and made us question the cleanliness of the room. I assumed the air conditioner was just frozen so I turned it off for 15mins then set it back to 68 to cool the room off. I called the front desk before we left to eat, asking about the air conditioner and they said they would have maintenance look at it.  My family (wife and 3yr old) and I got back to the room 3 hrs later after dinner and a meeting and the room was still around 77, with a note saying it was working fine and they changed the filter. I called down to the front desk and the guy said it was a swamp cooler and it was just doing the best it could with 108 temps. I was not expecting swamp coolers in this quality of a hotel, but I know they have refrigerated air in the main lobby! Swap coolers? Really?I asked for another room and of course they were completely booked. I then asked for a fan to be sent to the room because the room was hot for me(much less my 3yr old daughter and wife). They said they would send one up. The fan never arrived that evening and it took until 3am before the room reached 73 enough for me to actually fall asleep after taking a cold shower to attempt to be remotely comfortable. (Btw: only like warm water, not really cold). I finally went down and picked up the fan myself for our second night and still no offer for a new room. I visited a few other rooms from friends and colleagues attending the same conference, and they had no problems with temps in their rooms and their rooms were actually much nicer with larger rooms and much newer furniture. I felt like a was being treated as a lower class and the hotel had much differing room qualities that you will probably never know about. I'm not sure how to ask for a room with newer furniture and much more room and larger bathroom, but both of these rooms were the same cost and both a single king bed.I will not return and  will ask for some kind of refund. It is obviously close to the airport and the food was not horrible (over priced, but typical of a hotel, but a hotel with this companies name, I've come to expect better quality.I am back, my work choses our hotels. I am staying in quite possibly the dirtiest hotel in our system. The pillows are so old and smelly I couldn't sleep on one. The bedding is so smelly and old I had to pull it off. The smell in the room was so bad I sprayed air freshener. I went to my co workers rooms to see if they were all like this....they are.  I had a non working coffee pot. I called down foe a working coffee pot, they brought one in a plastic bag and said it was new, it had old dust and dirt all over it. I had to go brew in another room. I called down and let the front know about everything and was told they would "log" this in. This hotel is going to require a complete overhaul and redecorating. New bedding are necessary and any management in charge of this hotel can see that. I am sitting up in a chair praying I leave soon. I hope I never come back here.Nice lobby and hallways. Ordered a pizza with anchovies. Out of anchovies. How hard is it to pick up a tin of anchovies at the store? Really? I also asked the bartender if the pizza dough was fresh. "Oh, ya it sure is! We even have a pizza oven in back"  Pizza comes out. Frozen pre packaged dough. It was like pizza toppings on a giant cracker. Ugh. Rooms are ok.  . Bar..outdated and sunken below ground level. Decorated in Miami Vice tv show style. Framed beer posters on wall. nice touch.Photos to follow.-Coffee pot in room inoperable. -Shower doesn't drain (2 work orders submitted-claimed to be fixed, still floods)-Cable port dangling from wall-Door frame to bathroom not connected to wall and missing large pieces-The waterpark as advertised was inoperable and the slide had no water flowing through it.-ATM in the lobby was double charging cards-Strongest Wi-Fi connection was 2 bars and at dial up speed-This Wyndham does not live up to the name brand associated with it.Not very impressed with the hotel for the price I paid. It's look outdated with a few updates done. The lobby was nice, however the rooms need some more work. Wasn't able to try out the water park slide, but it did look fun. I didn't like that the plazas were all separate and not connected. Overall, it was fair.Had a great stay at the Wyndham El Paso.  It's A-OK in my book and I'd stay there again.  Not wanting to rewrite the numerous previous comments I will attest that the service was in fact great, location to the airport...none better, good happy hour running to 8pm with complimentary food, and slept like a rock in a comfy bed.Also, The exercise room is located in the pool area.  The running and elliptical machines worked great, they had dumbells and one bench (functional but in need for recovering) with fresh towels provided and nice big TV going to keep you entertained in case you forgot your ipod.They have three internet desktops for guests close to the front desk, but if you'd prefer to lounge in the lobby area they also equip a few of the coffee tables with Samsung tablets.Room had a good fridge, microwave, and coffee maker, but in the morning I found it easier and tastier to just walk to the lobby and grab of complimentary cup of Starbucks coffee in a provided "to go" cup. Breakfast buffet was good.  Depending on the room price you negotiate your room may come with breakfast coupons.  ...but here's a tip: if you pay for the buffet request and they'll make you an omelet to your liking.  If you have the breakfast coupon you're going to be eating the scrambled eggs with the rest of us....and for business or web surfing I almost forgot: in your room get ready to kick back in a bona fide HermanMiller Aeron chair.  Who'd a thunk?Yvette at front desk is extremely unfriendly & unprofessional. No regard for previously confirmed rooms.Friendly staff, but it's so inconvenience to go anyway if you don't driveThe staff is soo friendly. Especially Karen Polanco, Sales & Marketing Manager, who helped me with all my questions and needs.Was in El Paso for business and the Wyndham is one of the newer/nicer properties around.Literally about a football field away from the airport, you can easily walk over.Setting is nice, staff is friendly, property is really cool, with pool and water slide in the middle, giving it more of a resort vibe with the layout and courtyard in the middle, with lounge chairs and fire pits all around.Rooms are decent but aren't as modern as you'd expect from a new resort, rates are fine.Bar and restaurant is pretty cool, too.I like that it is close to the airport, but that is also a detriment as you can and will hear airplanes at all hours.  Here are the fails:roaches in the room, not the tiny ones, but the industrial sized ones.rooms are old and in dire need of a face lift.  lots of dust flying aroundleaky toilet that didn't flush oftenPros:bar with fantastic pricesstaff is attentive and works to resolve issues (my first room did not have a working AC, but I was transferred to a new room immediately)I probably won't return, but it is a live and learn world...
review_content_20: Writing this from my hotel bed at 6 in the morning. I work afternoons and am in town on business. Why am I up at 6:00am you ask? Because I just felt something crawling up my arm in bed. Flung it off, turned the light on my phone on, and saw an inch long cock roach on the floor. Second one I've seen in less than 2 days here.Yes, it is right here at the airport, but I'd suggest a hotel with better reviews over convenience. The need a pest control service for sure.great location - literally in walking distance to the airport so no waiting on a shuttle to come get you. slept very well - bed/ pillows are super comfy. breakfast buffet is reasonably priced & offers a wide variety of good food. staff is friendly. hotel shuttle will take you to the mall nearby.The advantage is that you can walk right from the ELP airport right to the hotel.  I like the outdoor space around the pool.  The staff are friendly and helpful.The rooms are spacious, but look tired and in need of a face lift.  What bothers me is that other than needing a face lift, is that not all of the guest room building are secure from outside access.  Outside doors do not require a keyed entry, which means anyone passing by can gain entrance.They should call this hotel Wyndham on the tarmac! It is so close, you could walk there from the airport if you wanted to! The hotel itself is pretty nice with large rooms with nice amenities such as a flat screen TV, a microwave, and a small fridge. The facilities are also very nice. In particular, the hot tub is amazing. It is large, very deep for a hot tub, and very powerful. By far, my favorite part of the stay! For the kids, they also have several water slides, The fitness room is more elaborate then some with both elliptical, free weights, and several other strength machines. They also have a nice outdoor area which includes a fire pit. Overall, nice place, not outstanding, but still above averageGreat place to stay.  Fantastic for business stays...literally a stones throw from the small El Paso terminal...One of the best prices in town too...booked through orbitz for under $100 / night.  Might find it cheaper on priceline.Nice, friendly staff...ready to go above and beyond at every request.  They upgraded me to a suite so I might be a little bias in my review.I stay in a lot of hotels during my travels so this place is surely a gem.This was the WORSE experience of any hotel I have ever had.  Please don't waist your time and money. They were ALL every rude and seemed to be put-out by having to work. I had a knee and back injury and asked for a ground floor, close to the pool, over a week in advance and called 2 times to confirm, when I got there, they put me in the worse room for my needs. I met my 3 grandchildren there, they lost their wristbands to swim on the first day, I went to the front desk to ask for new ones for the 2nd day. I was told my grandkids could not swim any longer in the pool...(???) I told them my suite # and explained the kids had thrown away the old wristbands when they took baths that night. I was told "TO BAD, NO WRISTBANDS, NO POOL...PERIOD".  I told them I had paid $285 for 2 nights there, and my grandkids had a right to swim in their swimming pool.  I had to get the hotel manager involved and FINALLY got them into the pool. And this was also the very smallest suite I have ever seen, we could hardly turn around.  I have had better rooms and have been treated better at Motel 6.We stayed here for the water slide - not working. Unhappy kids, unhappy parents as a result. Our nights stay included free breakfast - but nothing is offered you have to ask..so overall I'd just say not upfront with values, and we stayed here for the pool and 4 story water slide which doesn't even work. Fitness center also not available and not working.Gross. The rooms felt dirty and more like glorified college dorms than hotel rooms. Yeah, it's right by the airport. You can easily walk to the check-in desk from baggae claim. Is this a good thing? Overhead plane noise...lots of traffic...questionable travelers looking for convience over quality. I guess there's a bar onsite and a pool. After checking into our rooms and calling the front desk for the refrigerators they promised us, we decided just to leave. The couple on the other side of the paper mache thin wall screaming at each other convinced us to get rooms at the nearby Hyatt, which actually turned out to be cheaper and WAY more comfortable.Great for business travel. Right next to the airport. I actually walked to and from the airport. Very clean and affordable.This hotel is VERY CONVIENENT (spelling?).  After I had a delayed flight from Chicago coming in at 11 pm, we literally walked across the street and there was the Wyndham.  I had signed up for the loyalty program before my trip, so I gave them my number.  When I entered my very spacious room, I had a plate of fruit, a 1/2 bottle of wine, and bottle of fancy water waiting for me.  The room itself had a living room, small bar, bathroom, and large king size bed.  I guess there was a patio, but I never opened my windows.  There is a free hookup to internet and $10 wireless charge.  Two TVs and nice work out room.  Overall pretty great hotel for the price.

review_content: This is my absolute favorite hotel to stay at when I visit El Paso. I like the bistro and bar. The little store is so very convenient. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. The staff was very friendly. Very pleasant conversation. We felt very welcome and comfortable. There was these two staff members in particular, Mary and John. They were very professional and gave us light please an conversation. We enjoyed not only our room but comfort of the lobby. We relaxed and had quite a nice evening. Highly recommend hotel!!!Super easy to find. Has its own little ramp off the Boulevard coming from the I-10. We walk in, the lobby was very clean, and the decor was inviting.
