There wasn't anyone at the check-in counter so we had to wait a few minutes. As soon as the front desk person comes out, check-in process was so quick it made up for the wait. We get the 3rd floor, and a room with a sleeper sofa in it since we are a family of 6. Entering the room, it had the same clean and modern vibe as we felt entering the lobby. Only stayed a night, but twas well-worthed. The importants were clean (bed and bathroom), beds were comfy. Good enough. My only gripe was that the room was so darn cold. It was already freezing outside, and now it was freezing inside. We couldn't find the temperature control in the room? Fortunately, the blankets were enough to moderate the coldness I felt. None of my other family members were complaining, so maybe twas just me?!?Anyway, checking out was just as efficient as checking in. Ample parking. There's lots of lobby seating to hang around, a snack store, think there was a bar too or some sort of cafe? Very convenient location. I will note that I did hear the person in the next room from us coughing early in the morning. Walls are pretty thin, I'd say. The carpets could use some steaming as well. Overall, I'd still return especially if you are only stopping for a night and need a place to just crash.An average Courtyard.  Rooms are small and sparsely furnished.  Noise from the hallway comes right into the room when people are talking. The bathroom needed some maintenance.However, the staff was really nice.  The bartender in The Bistro was especially courteous and made several recommendations for Mexican restaurants in the area.Not the best Marriott, but it's comfy, clean, and right off the highway, which makes it convenient for those traveling through town. The pool is outdoors (boo!), but no one is ever there so we've got it to ourselves. They provide free business services, including printing and faxing documents (helpful in a pinch). The food place is definitely overpriced, but still decent. The pizza is lacking (clearly frozen), but the breakfast is actually really good. The French toast is a favorite. All in all, not a bad option when passing through el pasoWonderful place to stay! Super clean and extremely friendly and helpful staff!  Great stay!  Room was quiet, had my own balcony overlooking the pool to step out on for a cigarette and to enjoy the beautiful weather!  Beds were comfy! Water was hot! The staff helped set me up with transportation during my stay!  Free shuttle to and from airport!  Enjoyed my stay and will be returning to this hotel for my future trips!Pro: Clean, simple, free parking, easy access. Nice staffCon: I almost gave it 2 stars for this--the TV is at the  side of the bed! We drove 8 hrs stopped for an easy night , to rest and watch TV . We had  to watch TV over our right shoulders -- our necks hurt. We stayed in this same hotel on the way up-- same thing.The front desk girl was nice but the rooms are totally outdated compared to most courtyards. The carpet needs to be ripped out! Our room reeked of musty, mold smell and the pillows were rather old because the filling inside had turned into balls and the pillows themselves were yellow (yes, I took them out of the case). Lastly, there was an man going in his room with a hooker in broad daylight and even though I know there's little the staff can do about it, but it's completely gross and maybe if they raised the prices they can make some upgrades and keep people like that out! I just have never experienced anything of the sorts from a Mariott chain hotel ever and I've stayed in tons! Do yourself a favor and look right behind this place and go to Fairfield inn and Suites its brand new and about the same price and less that 2 miles away you can thank me later.Stayed here for a few nights. Very clean and great customer service from the staff! The room was pretty decent size. The bed was not the best but comfortable. Had a good night and peaceful sleep. Overall, my stay here was great and thanks to an excellent and friendly customer service from Mary! I will definitely stay here again.One of the worst Marriott stays I've ever had. I travel quite a bit, and always stay at a Marriott property. First, when I walked up to the front desk to get a room, he wouldn't give me the military rate. The "best he could do" was $10 off. I did a quick check on the Marriott website, and the military rate was $100 less! I even showed the gentleman (Arthur) working, and he said he couldn't do it. I had to book online. Second, they put me in a room facing the highway, and there is nearly no insulation. The freeway was louder then the TV. Third, when I went to take a shower, the faucet was sideways, and the shower valve was broken. Took me a solid five minutes to make the shower head work. I was just passing through, so I can't speak to the quality of other properties in El Paso, but this is one I'll never return to.Very clean and great staff. The alarm was set for 4am by previous guest, so thanks for that.  And the breakfast doesn't start until 7am on the weekends. A little late for an early rising traveler to benefit from.I have stayed at several marriotts locations and as a platinum member have gotten different perks. But the customer service at this location is absolutely amazing!! They have me my choice of floor and a kind bed! It was clean and spacious! Would definitely stay here again!!!I'm a platinum elite Marriott member and have stayed over 150 nights in Marriott's this year.  I have seen my share of hotels and I have stayed in all 3 Marriott properties here in El Paso. I think they all have different perks. This is a solid option close to the freeway. I've always felt the "west side" of El Paso is a bit more safe but haven't had any issues the few tines I've been here. Its very clean but a bit off the beaten path.  There is a nice mall and the new Fountains shopping center very close by.  Its right off the freeway an minutes from the airport so a great access spot if you're working all over el Paso. The prices can be a bit higher than other Courtyards and its both a step above average but overall a great property.My family and I booked a double queen bed room and it was very spacious and clean! I felt very comfortable although in our room, there were not that many outlets. (I forgot to bring my power strip, boo!). Free wireless internet, pool being open until 11PM, and the gym being available 24 hours were definitely all pluses. No complimentary breakfast or coffee though! The lobby area's decor was contemporary and had many amenities for guests. There was a little convenience store, a cafe, a lounging area, as well as easy access to the pool and gym area. I would definitely stay at the Courtyard El Paso Airport again for my next visit!This Courtyard was an OK one.  I'm a gold Marriott rewards member, so I've stayed at a lot of different Marriott properties for both business and pleasure.  I usually like Courtyards because they are fairly reliable in quality.This one dropped the ball a bit in my opinion.  CONS:The room was quite cramped for a Courtyard, I thought.  I could not roll my suitcase in the gap between my bedside table and the tv stand.  The water pressure was NOT good, and the shower curtain was not properly hung.  I feel I should explain that - they use the bowed curtain rods to give more space in the shower so the curtain bows out in the middle.  Except they mounted the bowed rod so that the outermost part of the bow was actually even with the INSIDE of the tub.  I barely had room to shower without hitting the curtain, even when standing sideways to avoid it. There were no outlets next to the bed for charging my laptop or phone, which is something I almost always have at a Marriott property.PROS:Clean, well taken care of property.New lobby and mostly updated rooms (a few years ago I think).Room service was prompt and did a good job.Food at the Bistro was as expected, not stellar but standard.I know I sound like I'm nitpicking here, and I am!  But when you travel half your time on business and have to live in hotels for a week...you start to get picky.  Because these places are HOME as often as home is.When I returned two weeks later, I stayed at the Residence Inn nearby (much superior).As far as Marriott Courtyard properties go, this is one of the best I have stayed at.  They offer a free airport shuttle.  Just give them a call and they will be there in 10 minutes.  This Courtyard has been renovated to the new Courtyard style.  Staff is super friendly and willing to accommodate you.  Rooms were fresh and clean.  My only complaint is that I called for a 6:30am wake up call.  Next day I received a wake up call at 5am.  Not fun, especially when you can't go back to sleep!I'll stay here again while on business.  Very convenient to the airport and Ft Bliss.I stay at a lot of Marriott properties and rarely get disappointed.  But, like any chain, some properties are better than others.  I lucked into finding this hotel because the full service Marriott at the Airport didn't have any holiday specials - e.g. breakfast included in a reduced price room.  This is one of the cleanest and nicest Marriott hotels I have stayed at.  Service is first class.  Rooms are spotless, and the entire property is clean.  We had a room facing the freeway - but due to great sound dampening and acoustic control we couldn't hear any highway noise - very nice!  We will definitely be back on our next visit to El Paso!I stay in plenty of various chain- hotels..... and this Courtyard is totally fine, as far as Courtyard standards go. Like many other El Paso properties, it's located just off the busy 10 freeway. Which is convenient... although some pretty noisy traffic. When checking in, ask for a room furthest away from the freeway. The staff was totally fine at check-in and friendly. I even checked in earlier than the arrival time, and my room was all nice and ready for me. They even had my specific requests of "feather-free" pillows, since I'm allergic to practically everything. Room was comfortable...everything again, was your basic standard Courtyard-fare. Complimentary WiFi...complimentary parking... and complimentary coffee in the morning.And 24/7 gym with some great Life Fitness treadmills, elliptical, and recumbent bike. Few weights.I've been here less than 24hrs, I like the staff Alejondrea was working the front desk when we checked in. Very friendly courteous and helpful staff make it a great location. It is very clean has a pool and jacuzzi and is close to Fort Bliss. We have 2 rooms here and I'm paying half the price. Thanks to my great friend and brothah RT.Not much is nearby, but this is a great Courtyard.  Great front desk.  Small food, coffee, beer available in lobby.  Clean, new rooms.  Outdoor pool.  Free internet.  Free parkingGreat hotel. It was kept very clean. The beds were comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful with the local area. The hotel was close to everything.. The airport, fort bliss, the zoo.. I would stay here again!
review_content_20: Great location for what we were in El Paso for. Convenient to many of the things you will want to do while in town.Kudos to the hotel for all of their special attention. They were very accommodating when it came to special storage needs that we had and for fixing a corporate screw up that indicated we were to get an American breakfast with our room rate. They promptly arranged a buffet for all the guests on Saturday and Sunday. They clearly went out of their way. They get what customer service is all about. Without exception, every staff member that we came across was simply first class. Looking for a great place to stay in El Paso ... make it the Courtyard El Paso Airport.We are certainly glad we did.I stumbled on to this courtyard due to a traffic jam, must have been my lucky day.  Front staff, Romo, was the nicest, most professional kid I have met in a long time!  We were in our room within a few minutes!  Room was very clean, comfortable, and the a/c was cold.Romo had the shuttle driver give us a ride to dinner, nice touch!  Eddie the driver was also super nice!Five stars for sure!Let's start with the staff. They are so unhelpful. They have a Starbucks in the lobby, except they were closed on Sunday morning at 11:30. I spoke to a worker there and she said they reopen at 5:00. When I spoke to the front desk the next day about it, they said they are open all the time, just have to ask the front desk. Whey didn't they say that the first time! Then there's coffee in another part of the lobby, empty! Rooms don't have fans in the bathroom, so steam from showers will linger. Elevators super slow. The staff were sorting laundry sheets in the lobby when we came in for a late night check in (kinda weird). The beds are comfortable though, and it's better than a motel 6, but I got a $59 special price so can't be too picky I guess. Rooms overall are clean, and newer interiors with modern decor. Just don't expect any help from the staff, because they will look at you like you have a 3rd eyeball!

review_content: Hilton Garden Inn. Probably my favorite hotel chain. ive stayed in them all over the country. This one in particular is really acomodating. They are always asking if you need something or just checking to make sure your ok. The bar/restraunt is open all hours of the day unlike some of the hiltons around the nation. There are a lot of local business and restraunts within in walking distance. Its a good crowd lots of college students. If i ever decide to come back to el paso this will be the hotel i stay.After much thought, we picked this place instead of the Double Tree downtown because Hilton Garden Inn's restaurant was open until later and we were coming to town on Christmas Eve and wanted a sure dinner if all else failed. Double Tree restaurant was very non-commital about closing time. This is a clean hotel with a restaurant that serves good food. But the service is very spotty. Depends on who you get. The young woman who checked in us would be let go in any other place. She was absolutely nonchalant and non-interested. Every Hilton property we stayed in during this trip upgraded us due to our Hilton Honors status. She didn't despite the availability of suites. The first room we were given did not have any cold water at all. And so we had to be moved to another room. She couldn't care less about that either. We had to call and follow up multiple times. Whereas Carlos (the one on the front desk the next day) was incredibly gracious and helpful. If not for him, I would have given only two stars. Give him a raise. And Andrew, the shuttle driver was wonderful too. He gave me and my son a ride to the movie theater and took excellent care of us. I guess if you are visiting the university, Nice things about the hotel1. Good restaurant: Excellent cheesy green chile, don't order the pasta primavera. I should have gone with the quesadilla. The pasta was flavourless. 2. Carlos and Andrews3. Nice cucumber waterCons1. Spotty service2. Faulty maintenance (wouldn't you check the water before you assign a room?)3. Poor value for moneyLast business trip to ElPaso this is not where I stayed and quite frankly I would not prefer to stay here again. During my week stay it was mediocre at best. First the good this is that the staff are all friendly and attentive. Here are the reasons for my displeasure during the stay: The bed and pillows were so uncomfortable I woke up with my neck and back sore a couple nights. The water pressure in the shower was low and overall dated. The towels were hit or miss as far as the thickness.  The air conditioner sounded like a freight train coming through when it clicked on and off. The breakfast if you are not getting no it free from being a HiltonHonor Gold status member is like $15 bucks and not tasty at all. The restaurant in the hotel.... Well the service is soooooo slow and the food looks great when it comes out but doesn't taste very good. The hamburger was "okay" and the salmon was "okay" for the prices it should taste better. During half of the week one elevator was broken and when both were operational they still operated slowly. I was on the fifth floor and opted to take the stairs down rather than waiting that's how long it took. Literally guest would sit out on the ottoman in the hallway waiting for it to arrive. The fitness center is decent a couple treadmills, stationary bikes, ellipticals, free weights and a weight machine. One treadmill was broken, I informed the front desk but it was never fixed. The pamphlet outlines how the business center has office supplies at request. I needed a notebook and didn't feel like driving to a store... Needless to say they don't have anything so don't ask just go to the Walgreens four blocks down the road. The university is on the same street so is the hospital so the streets are always crowded with walkers, kids scooting around or on bicycles. Lastly, they tested the fire alarm one afternoon which was posted but one night the alarm just started going off for no reason for the longest time....Stayed here for a 2 night stay to attend the Sun Bowl. Arrived in the evening on Christmas...after checking in went to their restaurant/bar to have a late dinner/drink: the waitress was not trained well -- didn't even know if they had a full bar... Food below average: think canned pears on flatbread. The first room we had was noisy and shook every 2-3 minutes due to the 'compressor'. The 2nd room had dirty sheets AND no maid service for our second night ... Overall not what one expects from a hotel with the Hilton name.Booked this hotel on accident. I actually wanted to stay at the Hilton Garden Inn located near the airport.  But I don't regret staying here one bit.  This Hilton Garden Inn is one of the bigger ones that I've stayed at.  Just the decor alone sets this Hilton Garden apart from the other Hilton Gardens out there.  Because this hotel is located so close to UTEP and downtown El Paso, there's obviously a ton of restaurants near by within walking distance. I didn't partake in any of these restaurants...just saying.  I did, however, took advantage of their room service.  I'm so use the Great American Grill that most Hilton Gardens have as a restaurant. So, I'm also use to their food.  My opinion, this Hilton Garden's food is pretty damn good.  I had their Crispy Salmon and it was phenomenal.  As for the rooms, I thought that my room was just your standard Hilton Garden type room. It was clean, spacious, and the noise level was low. Based on my initial experience of the hotel's facade, lobby, restaurant, bar, the decor, and even their large hallways, I expected a huge room.  Nope...all I got was your average Hilton Garden room.  Not a big deal at all. I still had a great stay.The hotel was ok, nothing special.  The bathroom sink drained very slow and the hot water was limited. The room condition was ok, older but taken care of. The breakfast was ok, but not at all special.  I opted to pass on the 2nd and 3rd nights.  Location was good for my travels.  Starbucks is very close which is a plus.  This is not my preferred location for future visits.This review is based solely on this hotel's bar and food. Otherwise the actual hotel and the rooms are great.I DETEST being lied to. If your menu says you serve a certain dish and your business even goes into detail as far the menu is concerned, then stick to it. If you can't because...oh I don't know, you run out of ingredients or something foreseeable like that, then at least BE HONEST with the customer and not only the customer but the poor server who has to endure dealing with the unsatisfied customer. The service as far as the waiter is concerned, is great, and I would like to commend him for the great way he handled it, especially since he is the only one working! I ordered the salmon Caprese which is listed in the menu as having smoked salmon, mozzarella, olive oil and pancetta. The pancetta - which is NOT regular bacon people, was missing, along with the olive oil. I was understanding and went to ask, you know because it's a Monday and everyone forgets, so what does the "chef" give me? Regular vegetable oil and no bacon, because, well..you see it was frozen and he couldn't unfreeze it. Excuse me, what the nuts?No. Just no. I don't know about the rest of their food, but this turned me off.I travel to El Paso on business several times a year and had previously always stayed at the nearby Doubletree - I didn't realize this property was here.  I ended up here after the Doubletree was booked solid and the Hilton Honors program offered to find another property for me.  SO glad they did!  I really like this place.  It's more centrally located - there's a Starbucks about 2 blocks away (be still my heart) and several shops and places to eat within walking distance (but I'm not the walking type, my rental gets me there in seconds, though! lol) I also really liked in in house restaurant - I had a hamburger when I first arrived and it was seriously tasty.  Yep - this place is my new 'home' away from home when I'm in El Paso - I'm glad to have found it!This is a mixed quality hotel. The location is great and there are many dining options within walking distance. The front desk and housekeeping staff are professional and did a great job checking me in and preparing the room.  There were a few hiccups....  half of my bed had some serious sag (probably from previous football players that stayed at the hotel) and the linens were aging.  The restaurant and bar in the lobby was a nice addition, but the grilled chicken on my salad was charred and dry (I'm talking desert dry).  I also ordered a martini and was given (and charged) the top shelf alcohol even though I didn't ask for it.  Hmmm....Bottom line, this is a convenient hotel though there are some details that drop the quality of the stay... and when you are the road frequently, the little details make all the difference.This may be the only Bhutanese architecturally-designed hotel outside of Bhutan!What does a girl do who is visiting family, and the family rents a guest apartment with no air conditioning, back to back with the high rise's exercise room, across from the elevator and resident entry door and stack of stolen Albertson's carts for residents to roll around, with a window facing the busy street and a hospital whose a/c unit sounded like a factory starting up every 3 minutes???Well, after 2 insufferable nights (can't open the window because of the noise, so it was rather stuffy!) and waking up in the wee hours to an annoyed husband because of all of this, we convinced his family to let us move a few blocks over to the Hilton Garden Inn, which did not cost that much more but had all of the things we wanted: air, quiet, and distance between us and noisy things.We did great!  Friendly service, got a high floor, comfy bed, working a/c, easy parking, walkable to all of the family we wanted to visit, next to UTEP, and of course - Bhutanese architecture!Check out Wikipedia's entries on UTEP and Bhutan.  They are cross-mentioned and this hotel is even mentioned regarding the architecture.  Bhutanese monasteries are rather southwestern in appearance and fit right in!  and there is a nice full bar near the lobby.  One night we sat there and had a few drinks, chatting with the friendly bartender and another hotel guest.Free wifi.  Stay here!Pros:Location is great close to a lot of restaurants! Staff is friendly, accommodating and courteous.The rooms come with a mini firdge & microwave.There is plenty of parking.They give you mint chocolates!Cons:The rooms smell kinda funny. The towels that are supposed to be white are not white ( they should wash them in hot water & use some bleach)!Found hair in bathroom upon checking in & asked to switch rooms. Restaurant closes early for food orders (I'm a night owl).I honestly have never stayed at a "Garden Inn". I was absolutely happy with the stay. I reserved the room via hilton honors and it was a 1 room studio. I pleasantly found that the room was very large much larger than some of the 2 room suites that I have stayed in before.  The staff was very friendly and I would absolutely stay here again.  One thing to be prepared for is that the breakfast is $11.95 for all-you-can-eat.Hotel stay = decent.Food in hotel = Out freaking standing!I had the Green Chili soup with my dinner. It was unreal! I could have consumed a bucket of this stuff!Stop in and try some ..So many things I was disappointed in so I'll write them in short sentences.Attempted to check in early, no luck; hotel full. One of the treadmills didn't work for me although the TV worked. I checked the cord, checked the emergency stop, everything. When I called Carlos at the front desk, all he said was maintenance would not be in until 8 am (it was 5:30......). No compassion until I remained silent then he gave a pitiful "sorry". So I ran my 4 miles outside in the cold, hoping I didn't have to exercise my ninja skills on some crazy person. Why isn't breakfast free?? It costs $12.49 for an omelet and a bowl of fruit with water! It was not worth it.The guy at front charged my business partner more than the reserved rate because he didn't think to check the group reservation. An unnecessary issue.The creamer in the room was SOLID. Expired...The network data port is so loose, your computer can't hold the internet connection. When you call for help, they send the janitor....! And when they need the janitor, they tell him to leave because it's probably your computer....Gee, really feeling the love now.The waitress Sylvia treats you with an awkward kindness at first, as if she's distracted with other thoughts, but when you go to pay, she ignores you, reaches for your card without telling you the price, then when you ask her the price, she snaps back to reality and turns her mandatory customer service skills back on. I gave three stars for the decor, the cleanliness of the room, and the fitness center which served my needs minus the treadmill issue (it worked the next day). I deducted two stars for the staff and high-priced food.Very pleased with my stay here. Super friendly front desk staff, they even remembered who I was when I would come get my morning bottled water before heading to work. Room was clean, hotel has nice amenities. I look forward to staying here on my next visit to El Paso.This is most prob the best place to stay in El Paso, if only for the Bhutanese arhitecture, which lends itself to it's relationship and proximity to the UT El Paso campus, which is growing by leaps and bounds. I mention this as an important footnote that there is road construction on University Ave. right now, so we had to merge back onto the freeway and back-track a coupla miles to access the hotel from Mesa Rd.The tasteful interior design matches the tasteful architecture, and it is built with a subtle, yet grand scale. The hotel is a step above your typical Holiday Inn, so they have full-size kitchen service and hence charge for breakfast, which is to be expected.Room was big and clean.I will have to say, though, the woman at the front desk, whose name I forgot, lacked interest or empathy for customers. I can kind of understand this since she seemed to be a 20-something college student, HOWEVER, there is no excuse to have absolutely no customer-facing skills. We asked for directions, asked her questions about security, etc. and she always looked face-down, mumbled all of her answeres, and didn't seem to care about us at all. In fact, I am sure that she couldn't wait for us to leave, and for the day to be over.Sorry, but some of us travelers are super tired, and would appreciate a kind smile to brighten our days. Not to mention, when we pay for services, we are also paying for customer service.Wow! Excellent customer service. I got a spacious clean two queen bed one bedroom suite with soft comfortable beds. Both times I called for more towels and blankets they were dropped off within minutes. For the most part we stayed in our room because we were tired from driving so I can't say much about the pool and other amenities but everything looked clean and the hotel itself looked safe and was well lit. I would definitely stay here again.There were many good things about this hotel but one thing ruined my stay: despite having specifically asked for a quiet room, I spent a very sleepless night due to the extremely loud elevator electronic beeping and electronic room doorbell sounds that were going all night. I was in room 507, not close to the elevator, so it must have been even worse for those in rooms close to the elevator.Worse, when I politely asked about the noise the following morning the man at the front desk said indifferently that those noises are out of their control, which is ridiculous! On no account stay here if piercing electronic doorbell sounds through the night will bother you.On the positive side the room was lovely and  it was nice to have a real bath with hot water. 4 or 5 stars for that, but zero for my lack of sleep and their indifferent attitude.Better than the average HGI (and I stay in them about 50 nights/year).It is a good location - right on the edge of UTEP campus.  I think because of the locale as well as the niceness of the property, they command slightly higher rates than other Hilton properties in the area.  Parking is free and there are plenty of good restaurants and bars within walking distance of this property.The thing that made me write this review is they go beyond the typical HGI breakfast.  For those who stay often, you know the drill in the morning with the American Grill.  This location has more stuff like Corned Beef Hash and giant sausages - yum!Very disappointing stay. People are nice, but untrained and inept. We had three reservations, and they screwed up two of them. It took several hours of our weekend to fix the problems. Food at the restaurant (we only had breakfast) was horrible. If they can't even do breakfast, so glad we didn't try to have dinner there. The only good thing about this hotel is the shuttle drivers. They are friendly, helpful, and knowledgable. This property would run much better if they turned over management to the shuttle guys!  Also, got locked out of the rooms several times due to faulty room key system.
review_content_20: This hotel was a mixed bag for me.  Stayed here 4 nights:Pros:Great location if you're business is with the university.  Also within walking distance to several restaurants.Great shuttle service - they will even take to or pickup from airport.  About a 15-20 minute trip.Easy friendly check-inThey honored my preferences in terms of room location.Cons:My room wasn't too clean.  Hairs in bathroom.  Duvets stained.  Some kind of stain even on the notepad.  Carpet stained.ESPN channel didn't work.No free breakfast which I thought was standard at Garden InnsAll in all I was disappointed with the cleanliness.  An immediate turn-off on any hotel.I'd blocked a group of rooms for my wedding guests and I'm giving two stars for the good things they said (nice lobby, good rooms, great location). My new husband and I, however, didn't get to experience this hotel because they don't honor late reservations past 1:00 a.m. We arrived after 2:00 a.m., still clad in our wedding garb, and were informed that we couldn't be checked in until 3:00 p.m. because it was technically the next day. I asked if there were available rooms and the night clerk said there were but that we couldn't have a room. It was truly an awful experience and I will never stay at this hotel. I still don't understand why we couldn't spend our wedding night in an available room, especially since we were still charged for it. TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE, period. Don't expect any special treatment for any reason and be sure to abide by their rigid check-in (starting at 3:00 p.m. and closing at 1:00 a.m.) and check-out (12:00 p.m.) times.Very good location! Me and my friend Dottsy Z were in town to take care of some business and we were able to secure a room at this Hilton. From the time we arrived to the time we left, everything was great. Upon arrival, we commented about how cold it was in town (we had just arrived from sunny and warmer AZ) so the front desk manager sent us up some hot chocolate and cookies to warm us up. How cool was that? The rooms were clean, the beds were comfy and the breakfast was yummy. (Thanks to that staff for staying open a little later to make fresh breakfast for us!) The downside was their internet service needs some serious work, but otherwise it is a great place to stay and near just about any and everything. If you are in the area and need a good hotel to stay at, definitely check out the Hilton Garden Inn!The hotel, lobby, hallways and rooms were very clean and well appointed. It is adjacent to the UTEP campus, which was a great place to walk everyday. The staff was very friendly and helpful as well as professional, a really nice combination. I especially enjoyed the cold fruited water they had available 24/7 in the lobby. It was infused with limes or lemons and was very refreshing and gratis. I probably drank a gallon or more over the course of 4 days and it was much appreciated. They also have some type of healthy cookie/bar available in the evenings, like a late night snack, which my husband tried and enjoyed. The outdoor pool, which we meant to get into but didn't, is actually heated. And while the website doesn't mention it, they also offer a free shuttle to the airport and other destinations around El Paso. We took the shuttle to Tabla, which is a wonderful restaurant located in the downtown area of El Paso, and after dinner, we just called the hotel and they sent the shuttle to pick us up and bring us back, it was really wonderful! There is a restaurant in the hotel lobby, but we ate out for all meals so we could explore El Paso, so I cannot offer any reviews on the food, but the breakfast prices were a little on the high side, that much we observed. I would definitely stay here again if we make it back to El Paso, it was a great hotel and I would highly recommend it to anyone going to El Paso for any length of stay.Stayed here for a mini staycation. We are from El Paso so we know the area. Hotel was nice size and for a nice price. There was a few stray hair in the shower but nothing to drastic. Room and bed were clean. Came with a microwave, mini fridge and Keurig coffee maker. Was a good experience abd would probably recommend it.Clean hotel, great location right next to campus and friendly staff. Everything you need is within walking distance of the hotel. The only thing I didn't like was 50 emails after my stay asking me to take their survey and become a HHonors member.Centrally located, clean. And Greg, the man at the front desk, was great!I actually lived in this hotel for a couple of months in 2008 (it's been open since at least November 2007) and really had a nice time.  It may be the only Garden Inn with a bar, I don't know.  But that was a great place to unwind and watch a game after work. The food is so-so, although the breakfasts are pretty good.They give you a free El Paso Times.  I love that. Highly recommended if you want to be on the west side, have business at UTEP.  Easy-ish access to the freeway.Hello Mr Adauto. I would like to start by saying I never take the time to write a review, However this incident forced me to do so.  We had just arrived in El Paso from Las Vegas and due to the time change thought we still had an hour to get something to eat at the Grill in the Hotel Lobby.  We arrived at the restaurant and to our surprise it had just closed it was actually 10:05pm.  The Restaurant supervisor Adrian explained to us that the cook had left but he would try to see what he could do.  To our shock, Chris the cook had returned to the restaurant to cook us in his own words "whatever you like" and he proceeded to make us a fabulous dinner.  I cant tell you how much we appreciated that warm delicious food after our trip and being tired from a long day. My wife, daughter and myself really appreciated both Chris's and Adrian's superb customer service and that step above service they provided us.  Thank you againEd DeAndradeWe were on our way to Santa Fe from Austin and decided we needed to stop in El Paso for a break so we decided to stay at the Hilton Garden Inn. Upon our arrival I was very impressed with the hotel itself. Since it's fairly new, it's very nice and clean. My favorite part about our stay was the breakfast!! The service was spectacular. Our waiter Carlos was the best and was very attentive. The food was good but the coffee...the coffee was delicious. I would definitely recommend this place for a stay if you're traveling to El Paso or passing by and need a break.Great hotel! Super location-right by pretty UTEP campus which makes for good running to start the day. Excellent personnel-friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. Clean, modern atmosphere. Best HGI I've stayed in around the country!Nice Place. Well maintained, clean, and friendly staff. My only complaint is that the buisness center is ill- equipped. The scanner was never connected to the network to email documents and the printer wasn't working.

hotel_name: Staybridge Suites El Paso Airport Area
review_content: Nice service.   Free breakfast 7 days a week consists of scrambled eggs or omelets.  Each day they rotate the sides: bacon, hash, potatoes, biscuits and gravy.  Free Dinner is three nights a week, with a self serve draft beer and wines.Very clean, love that it's pet friendly. Breakfast is full breakfast & offered a large variety of items. Staff is courteous & customer focused. We were concerned with highway noise since it is located tight off an extremely busy highway. We did not hear traffic & slept very well.The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. Our room was very clean and comfortable for our family of 4 and 2 dogs. They have a laundry room, gym, business center, movies, games, delicious breakfast and during the week a nice social hour with free beer and wine. They are also located right off of the 10 freeway.I have a great idea. I'll buy my own beer and the hotel joins the 21st century with better internet connections for its guests. Avg. download is 48 Kb/s. When I checked multiple times during my stay.I appreciate the kitchenette but I don't use it. The breakfasts are nice too. The bed is good. Be sure to operate all of the bath fixtures before unpacking.  But that applies everywhere, right?I was really impressed with this hotel. It was clean, comfortable, quiet and the staff were great from the moment of check-in to the check out process! The morning breakfast was good! And they even had complimentary beer?! What the heck?! That was a nice surprise! Overall, if I am ever in El Paso again, this will be the place to stay for us! Thank you for the great accommodations!Good hotel and nice full separate bedroom suites with kitchens - close to freeway and cool amenities like a DVD library that you can check out and watch for free. Laundry is free and the soap is only a $1-2 so they don't even try to take advantage of the convenience factor of buying it on site. Breakfast is free and decent in morning considering they do all items in a oven I was kinda impressed and it always got me though the initial part of my day. The gym is clean and new equipment and being next to laundry makes it kind of perfect for a Multi-tasker.  The Pool- spa was clean with no issues - even had free beer certain days with weekday evening socials. Staff was polite and efficient- doing everything right and accommodating when something was asked of them - good job and a well deserved reviewTypical Staybridge quality. It's clean, nice people and the food is good. If I ever come back to the area I will stay here without a doubt.Amazing 5 night stay! Breakfast was great each morning. Only had dinner one night, but ate so much I could not move. Dinner also came with free beer and wine. The hot tub was a steamy 103 degrees and the pool was 90 degrees in December. Great stay! Would recommend to anyone!I can't say enough great things about my recent stay at this location. From the time we were picked up by Valerie from the airport, the staff was nothing but friendly. We soon met Stephanie and Eduardo who knew us by name by the end of our stay.We stayed a week and the location was 10 minutes (or less) from the airport, downtown El Paso, and all our shopping destinations.They offer a week night dinner along with beer on tab or wine! The menu is listed at the lobby and also posted on your fridge so you prepare your belly for what's cooking during your stay. Continental breakfast offers everything from scrambled eggs, omelet's, bacon, sausage, fresh fruit, yogurt, waffles, bagels, something for everybody. They offer complimentary laundry mat, no need for quarters, its FREE!Take a dive after a long day in their pool or just relax in the jacuzzi.This hotel received a 3 star rating from AAA. Maybe it should be 4 stars. They are not a full service hotel but it is such a nice hotel. My room was super clean....not a spot on the carpet, gleaming bathroom and kitchen. It smelled clean when I opened the door. The bed was heaven and I slept very well. Mattress was very very new. The staff was professional. The only cons I could see were minor- the hallways smelled funky and the sliding glass front doors were open at 5:30am when the sign says they are supposed to be locked until 6am. I really enjoyed my 1 night here and will definitely stay here again should I return. Better than.many 4 star hotels I have stayed in.We had lots of choices of places to stay but the price and ammenities here really made it our #1 choice. Pool, jacuzzi, free breakfast, social hour (free evening meal + beer and wine 3 nights/week), clean large rooms and the best staff ever. A must if you are visiting El Paso.Terrific stay. We were here 4 days, welcoming my son home from Afghanistan. The family shared a two bedroom suite. Very cozy and comfortable. I usually don't sleep well in hotels but this was an exception. Really nice breakfast selection. The items in the Pantry are waaay over-priced so bring your own snacks and drinks. Still one of the best hotel experiences I've ever had.

Good nights rest w/ complimentary breakfast in the morning, hell yeah! Yelp check-in offer of 25% off the first night? Even better. Conveniently located off the 10 fwy. I was passing by on a road trip.Nice looking pool and jacuzzi. Didn't get a chance to try. =\Free wifi!!!! =)Beds are standard spring, but comfy enough for this guy to sleep well. Requested a doubles room1st stay; room 110 was great. Strong a/c, nice view of the pool. No issues.2nd stay; First room smelled like urine (111) Notified front desk and they apologized and moved us. Second room had a weak a/c (121) and I slept warm =(I was too tired to care so I didn't complain They NEED to wash their carpets, in and out of the rooms. I was walking barefoot and it seemed like I had been walking on asphalt. They got some things to work on, but overall a good place to rest your weary head.Before booking a last minute stay at this hotel, I wished I had thought to read current Yelp reviews.The first issue I have with this hotel is the back door I used to get to my room does not lock. Literally, anyone can walk into the building. The back door's key lock looked like it was broken off and no one ever bothered to fix it. I'm traveling with my children, so I felt unsafe.The building is in need of a major renovation. Upon entering the building, I noticed first floor bedrooms and a conference room with a glass window are covered with bed sheets. The walls, floors, ceilings, and stairs are dusty and dingy. There are a pool and jacuzzi. Both are closed for the winter; however, I wouldn't risk putting my toe in either one.The hotel is dated and can use new carpeting, furniture, linens, televisions, heater/AC units... New everything! A free breakfast is offered, but the selection is small. I asked another guest how long she's staying at the hotel and if the breakfast is normally this bad. She's been here 3 days, and yes, the breakfast is normally that bad. We decided to go to McDonald's instead. Thank God I didn't see bugs, blood, and other disgusting things other Yelpers did. My room is dusty (see the picture of the tv)and aggravated my family's allergies. Overall, the next time I'm in El Paso, I won't stay here again.This is my second night here as a result of some mix up in moving houses. The first night was fine, but tonight we got a room with a broken door lock, then they reassigned us to a room with two double beds instead of a king we reserved. Then, the room is LITERALLY CRAWLING WITH BUGS. ROOM 121. I laid down and flipped over the pillow and a number of small aphidy looking bugs were all over, as well as some small beetles the size of ladybugs. The more I looked, the more I found. We also killed two small roaches in the bathroom. Perhaps that's what I get for booking a budget hotel, but this is disgusting. I'll be making some other calls on this too. Priceline.com was kind enough to give a full refund, though, so kudos to them.This is the filthiest hotel I've ever been in. I had booked this place for 5 days. 1 day is enough to make me want to vomit. I will never stay here again.Do not stay here! It's full of bed bugs and blood stained sheets. The rooms also smell of chemicals. This place needs to be called America's worst value inn!I decided to give this property another try after the new owner had a chance to do some "fixin' up". The property is now in my top 2 list for when I stay in El Paso, and I definitely recommend it. On my recent stay (June 2014), I noticed many neglected items had been fixed/repaired. Our room was very nice, clean, and a great deal in terms of price paid. Do make your reservation on-line to get the best rate, though. I stopped in and tried to book a room in-person, and it was about 15 bucks higher than the internet rate, so I plugged my computer into my iPhone and booked on line ... I am a very happy customer! I would like to see a few more breakfast items added and would be willing to pay a bit more, but not sure if other people feel the same way.This place is a true dump. It was dirty, unsafe (back entrance security door was broken and my own room door lock was broken), and basically rundown. My room was supposed to have a microwave and fridge and had neither. Drinking glasses were not individually wrapped and were just styrofoam cups upside down on the bathroom counter. Light globes were missing, light fixtures were loose, the shower head squealed loudly, and the bathroom was plain dirty. the maze-like hallways were dimly lit and depressing. On the plus side, the bed was ok and the sheets seemed clean. The room was very quiet. This motel is many years past time for a renovation.For the cost it was the perfect spot to lay my head for the night. It was within walking distance to several restaurants and bars (including The Hoppy Monk). It is nestled between I-10 and office building complexes, never felt unsafe.The hotel was probably really nice when it was first built, but the age and neglect are showing. If it was renovated the price would definitely rise, so complaining might be counterproductive. I would definitely not book the conference room for any event. The smell of chlorine was everywhere. It gave the illusion of cleanliness. It seemed clean enough, but hard to tell since everything is so wore down. However I did find what appeared to be blood stains on a towel. Check your towels if you're here. The sheets were stain free though.The bed was firm, the shower hot, free wifi, and cereal for breakfast. Basically all you need to lie down comfortably and have a good morning transition. Stay away from the coffee because coffee it is not, and it leaves a terrible after taste even with one sip.Staff was nice and price was right. I would stay here if I was passing through again. Would probably bring my own towel next time if I planned it out.I would recommend it for an overnight stay if you're traveling and need somewhere to rest before you get on the road again. It has all the basic amenities you'd need - tv with many channels, iron, fridge, lock box, and breakfast in the morning. The staff was very friendly and we got a room (with a 20% yelp discount) very easily. The rooms themselves are a little old and need to be updated. Again, if you're just staying for the night, it's fine for the price.Had a comfortable stay here. Indoor jacuzzi was cool and make your own waffle station for breakfast was a nice addition to a traditional continental spread. Overall great avlue. Would stay here again on my next trip to el paso

Solid place to stay | Can't help the location$My friends and I come to El Paso only to climb at Hueco Tanks once a year. We're doing this as an annual thing, too. Last year we stayed at another motel just blocks away from this place, but this year we decided to try another spot. This was a better decision.Front desk is friendly, they remodeled the rooms, lots of parking, and lots of rooms. Our room had two beds, a tv, a bathroom, wifi, a small fridge, and a microwave. Those are all the basic things we need on our trips so no complaints there! I think because they don't have a table with lounge chairs, it makes the room more open. Location IS good since you are minutes away from the El Paso airport and close to Albertsons and other places to eat.No complaints with this place. I will note, however, during our stay there was police action that occurred behind our building. Someone who was staying at the place got in trouble with the police. It is important that I say the owner was not tied to any of that, it was just an unfortunate thing that happened during our stay. We had a completely good experience here. Just keep in mind that Juarez is only a couple miles away.yeah...so the Lone Star closed next door.I went for a brisk walk last night...DICK POE parking lots and car sales are all around.There's a Kmart and BigLots closeby/ side - by - sideand the price was right around 50 bucks a night.my room was big, I had a microwave and little fridge. a king sized bed. The shower water was kind of cold in the morning but a lot hotter at night. I remember that.I like this little hotel. It's not a Hilton that's for sure but if you just need a place to crash and then leave the next morning this is the place to stay.I think we paid about 50usd per night. My 2 gripes are; the filthy floor and the shower/ low water pressure.The floors need to be mopped every day. It's pretty bad when you take a shower and notice your feet are all black from walking on the floor.The water pressure isn't very good which for me is a big thing.It's a cheap hotel to spend the night only. And it think for the price, the room it's nice. The air conditioner works well, the room comes with refrigerator and microwave (they work well too) and wifi service. The bathrooms are very clean as well the bedroom. And the TV signal is good too. The parking is in front of the room which is good too.Worst and most rude staff I have ever encountered. I think it was the owner. I almost left without staying even after paying.Stayed here last night, and I'm really happy the room. Very clean, the bed is very comfortable. I stayed the night in another hotel a few days ago, and I was very disappointed. This hotel has a great price and very nice clean rooms.My daughter, (who is pretty picky) and I both thought this was a great deal. Centrally located, close to so much. Rooms were clean. I think having laminate or hardwood floors instead of carpet helped. Guy at front desk was very nice and helpful. We stayed 9 nights and my only complaint was that the bed is very hard. Instead of box springs the mattresses were on wooden platforms.  Too hard for me, but my daughter thought it was great. Free Wi-Fi, HBO.not bad for the rate, but the guy at the front desk is so rude you want to smack him. Otherwise Ok. I would have given another star if the front desk person had a better and more courteous attitude.Great value for only $40 a night. Friendly service. Pretty cozy. All wood floors, clean, microwave, fridge, and free high-speed wifi--what a deal! Small room, but a big bed. Again, can't beat that price. The only negative is that there is no hair dryer or shampoo/conditioner in the rooms. And the surrounding area is a little shady, but maybe that's the West LA in me talking.Is in the process of being remodeled. Looks like it may be a nice place when they are done but, had rather hard bed  and the floors were kinda dirty. Not bad for a couple of nights but, I don't think I'd want to spend a ton of time here.

I've stayed here 6 times now and I've enjoyed it 4 out of the 6. The staff has changed and are much friendlier. My company has this hotel listed as preferred as well as the airport Marriott. I choose this hotel because Hyatt allows you to add your points to Southwest Airlines rapid rewards which ends up going farther for me because I fly often. A few times I requested a king bed but ended up getting stuck with two queens because they ran out of the rooms with kings (booked my room weeks ahead so this was frustrating). The hotel is very clean and amenities are good. I wish they offered room service, instead you have to come down and pick it up yourself at the lobby counter.This hotel is a good option if you're looking to stay for a night or two. I'm not sure I'd spend an extended amount of time here though.The staff at the front desk was very courteous, the girl who checked us in even gave us a small tour and explained what was offered before we proceeded to our room.The room itself was nice. We stayed in a king "suite" which had a king-sized bed and a large sleeper sofa. There is a small bar sink and a mini fridge but no microwave. One minor compliant I have about the room is the bathroom. First the design of the door is awful. It swings so close to the toilet you have to squeeze between the side of the toilet and the wall to get it closed. Definitely needs to be redesigned into a pocket door. My husband and I are average size and we even struggled to close it, I'd imagine a larger person would really have trouble. Also the shower water took quite a while to heat up.The pool area is decent however the pool itself was full of dead bugs and there was green algae growing near the steps to get into the pool. The hotel is right next to I-10 so there is quite a lot of traffic noise outside. Wasn't an issue for us but if you're looking for a peaceful, quiet spot to lounge by the pool, you might be disappointed.One thing we really enjoyed was their free breakfast skillet. That morning they offered waffles, breakfast sandwiches, oatmeal, boxed cereals, fresh fruit, yogurt, and various pastries, toast, bagels, etc. The food was hot and fresh. They also have juices, milk, water, coffee, and tea.Like I said, overall this is a good hotel for a short stay.Let me start by saying that the common areas of the hotel were nice and the rate was very good.  However, the bathroom was so small we had to almost crawl over the toilet and squeeze ourselves between the toilet and the shower door to get in and close the bathroom door.  The dish TV was out the majority of our stay.  The battery died in our tv remote and when I called down to the front desk, they put me on hold for at least 15 minutes before answering my call.  Then, they made us go down to get a new remote rather than bringing one up to our room.  They also "encouraged" guests to skip housekeeping due to weather-related staffing issues.  I give it two stars because I got a great rate and it was relatively clean.  Otherwise, I might have given it one.I've stayed in Hyatt Place locations in several cities and this one showed promise when I walked into the lovely lobby, but you can tell this location is showing its wear and tear.  As I headed to my room, I noticed the wallpaper was coming off the wall and in my room, the shower stall could use a good re-grouting.  Even still, the bed was comfy and the room was clean.  I enjoyed a dessert in the downstairs bar/seated area which is very cozy and inviting,  I would stay here again on a return business trip - hopefully they have a budget to spruce up the place.I like this hotel, since I'm part of their Hyatt Goldpass Program. But this time I'm only giving 3 stars due to the low water pressure, 2 nights we were there. Also due their power outage, which took an eternity for the Wi-Fi and TV to turn back on. Breakfast was great and so are the regular food items from the Gallery Menu.This place is very nice! The employees are super nice!!! I recommend this place to anyone staying in the El Paso area!King bed is soft and comfortable.  The showers are spacious.Pretty decent hotel with spacious rooms, free wifi and good breakfast. Only issue I had was with the air unit where thermostat didn't work properly so I was constantly having to adjust. Noise is also a concern since they are very , very close to the freeway. Ask for a room as far away and on a high floor.Well, the hotel was okay, but that is about it. That being said its cheap so why not stay? I wanted to take a shower before bed, but the light in the bathroom would not turn on and it was kinda creepy in the dark bathroom at 10PM. So, I resorted to washing my face in the sink. I almost flooded the room in the process because the sink was clogged. When I was trying to fall asleep I noticed the gentle lull of the freeway sounds was interrupted by a loud air conditioner. I also noticed how hot it was in the room. After inspection I noticed that the room was set to 58, but was actually 74. Luckily I like toastier temperatures than most, but the AC was definitely broken. The complimentary breakfast was satisfactory but I warn you: it was a mad dash to get coffee before they ran out. Checkout was quick and the workers were pleasant. Altogether not an unenjoyable experience... but it was not particularly pleasant either.I've stayed at dozens of these Hyatt place hotels, and this was only OK. The area is utterly charmless, and the rooms are smaller than most Hyatt place rooms - our bathroom door hit the toilet as it opened and closed.If you are staying here then the options in El Paso are pretty lean, so it's an endurance event, nothing to remember.Wow has this hotel aged and gone down the tubes!  Elevator wait is at least 5 mins before you can get on it to go to your room, girl at front desk agreed that they have had several technicians out and can't make it function correctly?Couches are ripped with tears in them, bedspreads are snagged, wood trim in room is worn.  Stayed at a Hyatt Place last night in Albuquerque and this El Paso Hyatt Place does even come close to the Hyatt quality!  I'll never stay here again!!!!Nice hotel, But there's no microwave, and the bathroom it's really hard to get to the toilet......Well it's hard to close the door in the bathroom.  You have to step in the shower, to close the bathroom door.  It's a nice room, nice sectional, desk, refrigerator, nice LG flat screen TV.  They have hot breakfast, that's always a plus.  The staff is very friendly and helpful.They have very friendly staff, especially Derrick at the front desk. He was very empathetic to my situation. Normally check in is at 12pm the earliest, I arrive at the hotel at 9am due to car trouble and it's a Sunday, all car repair shops are closed. Derrick was very customer oriented that he made an effort to try to find me a room right away so I can just settle down and relax. At the end, he was able to check me in early and I get to relax after a disastrous morning.   I appreciate his compassion and professionalism. Thank you, Derrick from the front desk!Visiting Hyatt Place El Paso Airport is like being a special guest at your rich Uncle's place. The exhibits are always interesting, the grounds are relaxing and the view is  stunning. The price is right too. For the cost of parking you get a tram ride and the whole shebang. Also, down by the garage/tram station there are nice picnic grounds and a sculpture garden.Good place to stay.  We've stayed at several Hyatt Place hotels across the country over the past few years, almost always with a pretty positive experiences.  This instance was no different.  Clean comfortable room, friendly staff, and the amenities we're used to with Hyatt Place.  I do have two small negatives though for this particular location...no coffee after breakfast, and they leave the chairs on top of the tables.  I don't mean they put them up to clean the floor then drop them back down.  No, they leave them up all day.  We stayed three nights; every morning after breakfast, the staff would throw the chairs on top of the tables, where they'd stay until some time after we'd gone to bed late in the evening.  I'm not suggesting this was wrong, it just created a really weird vibe.  The other item...coffee.  At every other Hyatt Place we've stayed, we were able to help ourselves to coffee from a carafe in the lobby all day/evening long.  Not at this location.  When we asked the front desk, they quickly offered to sell us espresso drinks, but explained we'd need to wait till breakfast for the coffee we were asking about.  Again, I'm not suggesting this was wrong, it just didn't fit with the expectation we'd developed after staying at more than a dozen other Hyatt Place locations.All in all, a good hotel.  I'd definitely recommend.We always stay at the Hyatt. Great location,  clean hotel,  nice rooms, good value.  Parking is free and safe.  Breakfast used to have more variety, now rather basic.  Great staff,  especially the cleaning ladies. Only complaint: on first floor it was very loud and our sleep was very disrupted.The staff was wonderful. I felt like they were there to serve only me. Friendly and personable. The rooms and bed helped me sleep like a baby. The food wasn't my cup of tea but it will fill your belly in a pinch. I'll be staying here again. For sure.Place is very nice and clean, but NO queen beds. And no wifi streaming. The single beds are comfortable however, if you expect to sleep with your significant other you'll be disappointed. If you only want to check email, fine but don't look forward to streaming movies because their internet contract does not allow it. Small bath. If you want to eat great texmex google Fortis. Went there 25 yrs ago and recently returned still great food. It's in an old remodeled house.New Years Eve in El Paso, TX. We were nervous about this one. It turned out OK, and the rooms are actually pretty nice with a plush seating area. We wished there was a little more room carved out for the restroom - you had to step between the shower and toilet just to close the door. Free breakfast hit the spot, but wouldn't have had anything else to eat there and the drinks were overpriced. Luckily there's a Walgreens across the freeway, where we procured our champagne for the midnight toast. This is right on the I-10, and although we didn't think the noise was a problem since we're from LA and it's always noisy, your mileage may vary. You're gonna be hard pressed to find a decent hotel in this town, and while I can't shout from the rafters about Hyatt Place, I wouldn't hesitate to book again.Stayed a night here for an interview and the facilities are fantastic for the discounted rate!  My room was hugemongous with a full size couch and office area leading to the beds and bathroom sink.  The free wifi is fast and reliable and I enjoyed the complimentary hot breakfast with a pretty full range of options (hot breakfast sandwiches, French toast, oatmeal, cereal, pastries, tea/coffee, etc.).  The free, on-demand shuttle will also take you anywhere within a ~3 mile radius of the hotel - an immense help if you don't have a rental car at your disposal.I love the layout of HP rooms and always enjoy my stays here.  This one was just like all of the others, so it was clean and nice.  Didn't know the only pool was outside, so we lingered a little longer after a long day of driving the day before, and I got up and went to the pool, and normally I love an outdoor pool and getting some sun, but all of my lotion was in the car and I got a little sunburned (which is rare for me, since I am usually the spokesmodel for sunscreen,) but that bag was still packed in the car and I didn't know it was an outdoor pool until I got there 8-}  The pool itself was too cold and had a film floating on top of it, with dead bugs and leaves near the stairs, so it didn't seem very sanitary, but I was there before it was supposed to open, although no one came out to skim the pool while it was supposed to be open.  The breakfast provided was the usual, except the eggs were powdered and tasteless, but the link  sausage was good. One star off for non-skimmed pool and skimpy eggs.  But we will visit another HP again soon.
review_content_20: My first experience staying at a Hyatt Place and I'm satisfied. The rooms are large and comfy. Love the big couch and 42" TV -- makes you feel very comfortable. Nice work desk with adequate lighting, a few outlets near the desk area - - could probably use 2 more ( i travel with lots of gadgets). And coffee maker, mini-fridge, small sink. The closet and actual bathroom are on the small side. The bathroom vanity is just outside with adequate lightning. But the water pressure in the shower is AWESOME! :)The bed.. meh! "I've had better" certainly applies here. NOT the best bed I've stayed in. Overall the room and property are very clean. One note - - when checking in, ask for a room on the EAST SIDE. My room was on the West Side, and I could hear all the traffic last night on the 10. Took me a while to fall asleep, and I'm too lazy to move everything. Oh and the breakfast... my opinion, kinda blah. Some cereals, white breads, mini-donuts, sugary yogurts, fruit, juices, coffee & tea.Review from Jan 09' stay:PROS: Ginormous plasma TV, most comfortable hotel bed EVER (can't say enough about it), big couch with ottoman in the room, free wireless internet, friendly and accommodating staff. CONS: No room service, food available in lobby was really poor, no vending machines or stores near by, really scratchy carpet, staff wasn't aware of a good mexican restaurant in their border town, location was next to a rough neighborhood and a freeway.The staff is what puts this hotel over the top. They are TOP notch. The lobby and common areas are well-appointed. And we enjoyed the lay out of the room. Bed was comfy and the pillows were marvelous. HOWEVER, the bathroom in this hotel is a deal breaker - period. You can not close the door to the bathroom if you are standing in the bathroom. Let me be clear. It is impossible to be in the bathroom (consisting of a toilet and a shower) and close the door at the same time unless you actually step into the shower. Yes, in the shower. Moron design and will influence my decision to stay at any other Hyatt Places with the same configuration. I have been on European cruises that have better bathrooms. Breakfast was okay - lots of breads, fruits and juices. Delicious ruby red grapefruit that morning. Also, these properties appear to run slightly higher than similar brands but I get the loyalty program aspect of it.Okay, the good first--The staff, especially David and Raul were great.  The hotel has a shuttle to and from the airport.  The free breakfast was wonderful, and the beds were really comfortable.  Now the bad.  The rooms are hard to keep cool.  Both my boss and I had to have our refrigerators replaced, and my "new" one STILL didn't work.  The other reviews about the elevators are true, they are scary and actually broke down while we were there. No microwave and NO VENDING machines on the floors.  If you want a soda you have to pay for it at the front desk.  Don't ask how much they charge, it will scare you. And one of the reviewers is absolutely correct, the wifi is only good for email. I told my boss I thought this hotel was a Best Western in disguise.  She said I gave it too much credit, it was probably a Motel 6 in disguise.  If possible, stay somewhere else !Nice hotel.The only reason for -1 stars is that getting to anything to eat or any shopping is quite a trek. Although you can see the mall and several restaurants from your room, there is a large highway separating you from them, and no direct route across near the hotel.I love Hyatt Place. Location is right by highway, so ask for a room  not facing it!The check in process was smooth and the staff was friendly. I ordered food from the kitchen a few times and it wasn't the best, but it got the job done. Checking out was just as smooth and very quick. The room itself was cozy, clean and the direct a/c unit was a plus. The only outlet I could find was behind the TV, which was not convenient.Wonderful stay and impressive continental breakfast including a decent selection of coffee and Tazo teas. The staff was very friendly and the rooms were clean and comfortable. The room had 2 twin beds and a fold-out queen size sleeper sofa that was perfect for us and our 4 small children.This is my second stay at a Hyatt Place. My first was in Atlanta several months ago. After two stays, I have to admit I'm really digging this new concept Hyatt has introduced to business travelers.The customer service has been top notch, the rooms clean and spacious (giant flat screen). Food available 24 hours, free wi-fi, nice lobby, free breakfast. And all for a very affordable price. I highly recommend this brand for those budget conscious business travelers.Pros: nice modern room. good size for family of 4. Good price.Cons: very very weak plumbing; clogged so much that we had to use the common restroom on the first floor.I have been in El Paso for about 3 months on and off now for work and I stay in the Hyatt Place El Paso. Everyone who works at this hotel goes above and beyond to make sure your stay is as comfortable as possible. The few times I did have minor complaints, they were dealt with immediately and without question. The staff is extremely friendly and always greet me with a smile when I walk in.- The hotel is VERY clean, the building is new and nothing feels old or outdated.- The rooms are all spacious, included, couches, free WIFI, and nice TV's- Free breakfast, and the food that you can order 24/7 is also pretty good.- Small but fully stocked bar in the lobby.- Staff is extremely friendly and personable, always have good suggestions for restaurants and things to do.- Pretty central location, close enough to downtown and the airport.Overall, for living in a hotel for about 3 months, these guys do a great job and definitely made my stay comfortable.I would suggest this hotel to anyone who is traveling to El Paso for a short or long period of time.We needed to visit some family in a small town outside of El Paso Texas, and were trying to book at a nice hotel near the airport.  We crossed our fingers and gave this hotel a try.  We were very happy with our stay here! Considering downtown El Paso is a very busy and loud place with a lot of traffic, we were ready to be dissapointed.  But the Hyatt made our stay great.  The rooms were really big with a large sitting area with a sofa and wet bar!  We had two queen beds, and also the room has a large flat screen TV, everything seemed clean and smelled clean.  Even though this hotel is near the freeway, the noise really wasn't  loud at all.  we had the fifth floor, so maybey that is why.  They give a free continental breakfast with fruit, cereal, bagels and stuff, so that was nice.We would stay here again.I've stayed here many times, as I must travel to New Mexico on business and I like the fact that it is close to the airport.  The staff is very friendly and they really try to help in any way possible.   The breakfast is good, especially since they have added some hot items such as breakfast egg muffins to the menu.   The only reason for the three stars instead of four is one very important item.  The wi-fi.  Although I read a review that says the wi-fi is fast, it is not.  I use the internet for Skype and also for remote desktop where I can sign in over my network and do work on my home computer.  This is the only hotel in recent stays over the last few years that does not have reliable, fast wi-fi.  Many times, when I type an email at home, I have to wait a minute for each character in a word to appear.  At other times, on Skype, the video of who I am talking too, breaks up freezes, and a message comes on and says, "your internet connection is slow, there may be frozen or jerky video".    I have talked with the manager on numerous occasions, and he is very nice and wants to help, but the internet never seems to change.  Perhaps his hands are tied by corporate?  I don't know.  But if you are a business traveler and you really need fast wi-fi that's reliable, this is not your placeThe hotel was comfortable and fulfilled our needs. We have stayed at the Hyatt Place properties before and all of them have the same style and setup. The staff was friendly and we checked in and ordered pizza at the cafe next to the check-in counter and took the pizza back up to our room which was very convenient. The rooms featured a queen size bed, sectional, desk, mini fridge, wet bar, and a large flat screen TV. Our TV had some minor issues with the picture quality but was otherwise very nice. The shower seemed a little old and maybe needed a bit of refurbishment but overall we were happy with our room. Plus the hotel offered free WiFi which is always a plus!Easy access to the freeway, safe, friendly staff, and good food options for a single girl who didn't want to venture out in El Paso alone at night. Can't go wrong :)This is a great hotel in a nice location close to food and shopping.  The facility and rooms are clean and neat.  The staff was very helpful.  Since I was a day sleeper on this trip, my room was serviced in the evening while I was at work.  And the hotel staff was quiet during the day while I slept.  The room had a mini bar, refrig, desk and sofa.  I would recommend for a business trip or extend stay.  Very nice.We were in El Paso because we had Buddy Passes on Southwest to Vegas. We could not get to Phoenix from El Paso so we just decided to spend the night and head back to Dallas the next morning. Being a travel agent they have a $49.00 per night rate which we jumped on since it was only 4.7 miles from the airport. I think for the rate we got, the hotel was very nice. The lobby was very modern and very clean. There were couches and TVs all over the place. We even got a sandwich and some sodas from the front desk " store". We got a room on the 6th floor and the room was very nice and roomy. We had 2 couches, work desk, sink w/fridge and a huge TV, just in the living area. The bed was just OK and the bathroom and the closet were very small, but all good no big deal because we didn't have that much stuff anyway. We decided to go to the local (really in New Mexico) casino, so while my wife was taking a shower and getting ready I went to the front desk area to have a beer. They do sell domestic bottles for $4.00 at the front desk bar area. I had a few and talked to another front desk guy by the name of Jim A. He was really cool guy and we talked about the travel industry and how he used to own a little travel agency. He gave us recommendations on where to eat and we talked about the casino we were going to later that night. The hotel was easy to get to from the AP and since we drove around the area the night before, getting back to the AP was really easy, we didn't even have to get on the highway. I would recommend this location to anyone in the area. As we was driving to the hotel from the AP we did see many hotels that were closer, but if you want to interact with nice people and stay at "not your normal cookie cutter hotel' then I would drive the 4.7 miles to this property and relax. My wife and I did partake in the free breakfast. They had the normal goods but they also provide many cooked to order items as well. I have the bacon and eggs with seasoned potatoes and for $7.00 it was better than I thought it would be. Very Good. If we end up in El Paso again for any reason we will make another reservation here.I was in El Paso for a few days on work at got a good rate at this Hyatt. It's clean and has plenty of parking. The rooms have the big swiveling flat screen TVs and mine even had a tub, which was way cool to soak in after working long days. It's close to the freeway, but the only places you can really walk to are an Ihop and a Denny's. Meh. There's a house of ill repute about a half a mile away if your into that kinda scene.This is probably the best you can get in El Paso.  We stopped here for the night to break up our drive from Austin to Los Angeles.  Our room was very clean, comfortable, and updated.  The staff was friendly.  There was food in the lobby for us to order even though we arrived at 9:00p.m.  And they actually followed through on the requested 7:00 a.m. wake up call!  We will surely come back here next time we pass through.

review_content: This was the nicest Marriott I have ever stayed in. It was extremely clean. The service was impeccable. The catering and banquet room were excellent. The front desk employees were full of great suggestions and we had so much fun talking to them about El Paso. My bed was very comfortable and the pillows were perfect. My room service breakfast was great. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.But, I do have to admit while we were there on the 2nd night, a fire alarm went off (similar to the comment before). My hair looked like a monster and I didn't budge. But, if I had small children, this would have been a huge issue. I find it ironic that it happened while we were there as well. Plus, when do you know you need to leave? I wish there would have been a voice to tell us why it went off and what we were suppose to do (like the casinos in Vegas.)Decent hotel but overpriced. Easily the worst Marriott property in the area, and there are several others very close. Internet prices are outrageous ($15 a day I think). No fridge in the room. Not even a mini one. A co-worker waited 40 minutes for a salad at the bar. TV is usually on the fritz. Bathroom is tiny. The air conditioner does nearly nothing except make a lot of noise. That being said, the people that work here are great, even if there are maybe too many of them. I don't need someone to grab my bags at the door or hit the elevator button for me. Not really a complaint, just saying. They are trying to pass this off as a luxury hotel, but its really not even an average Marriott for the area.Avid Business traveler and visit El paso often. I have stayed here numerous times and always I have some sort of issue...this time was the Internet was messed up and I had to spend a few hours dicking with that one. Had to do laundry and there was a bad dryer wasting my time and money. Water all over the laundry room. I called twice, but no one gives a rat's Ass! I should have slipped and sued there Ass. Also I'm an elite status and was never recognized, thanked or given a room or entry into the concierge floor..nor was I given the obligatory Internet access code. My suggestion is the Hilton Garden Inn around the corner. This will be my next choice.It's an OK airport hotel.  It's my choice, honestly, when staying in El Paso.
